name: Townhouse in Bristol · ★4.77 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
The neighbourhood is friendly and welcoming; most houses are Victorian like mine, but the ones opposite are old miners cottages from the 1860's.

Much of community life centres around Victoria Park which is a large lovely green space at the end of my road. It has a children's play area, a lovely little café that you can dash to for bacon sarnies in the morning and great views across Bristol.

There is a city farm a few minutes walk away as well and a meander into the centre of Bristol takes you through the park and you can choose to go easily along the harbourside to see the best of beautiful Bristol.
host_about: I am pretty laid back, enjoy meeting new people and having my house lived in by anyone who comes to stay, love being out in the wilds with a tent or out walking, swing dance fanatic, and nearly always have a good Malbec open. Love a good unicorn! I work in the charity and childcare sector.

name: Condo in Bristol · ★4.96 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 2.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview:
This area is on the water and has splendid views of the S.S. Great Britain.
This neighborhood has plenty of local amenities; bars, restaurants and shops.
host_about: Living in Bristol since 2007, I am an architect with a passion for traveling and meeting new people. Let me make you welcome in my waterside apartment while you visit exciting Bristol.

name: Townhouse in Bristol · ★4.79 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Southville is pretty darn hip, frankly. North Street is bustling with bars, restaurants, quirky shops and culture. Huge murals and street art cover most buildings, thanks to the annual Street Art festival, Upfest. The Tobacco Factory Theatre hosts plays, comedy, classes and a great weekly market. There's lots of green spaces, even a City Farm within 15 minutes. The house is next to two high streets with plenty of independent shops, but it's on a quiet lane so it's peaceful too.

5-10min walk:
Loads of Murals/Street Art, Vintage/Retro shops & bars, Buddhist Centre, old fashioned Swimming Baths, City Farm.

15 min-25 min walk:
Tobacco Factory Theatre, M-shed Museum, Thekla boat-nightclub, Nelson Street graffitti, Banksy trail... Ashton Court Estate - a lovely walk and great for deer!
host_about:
I'm an Art Technician, lecturer and sometime designer, which occasionally leaves time for making, dancing, ranting about Tories etc. I like people, live music, cats, sci-fi, tea, and recovering from covid...

I now host with my partner Tom, who is great at cryptic crosswords and also works in education, previously journalism. He can't dance but he likes a good board game.

Tom and I speak some Spanish and have mostly forgotten how to speak French, German and Japanese, but can stumble through a conversation if prompted :)

name: Townhouse in Bristol · ★4.65 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview: Located in the cosmopolitan and bohemian community of Greenbank, Easton. Excellent local food shops that sell a wide range of quality foods, cool cafe's and restaurants, providing a range of different cultural cuisine, ie Thali, Moroccan, Indian, Vegan, great coffee at Cafe 5 etc. Good public transport service provides a short ride to city center and other surrounding areas .. A local train service within walking distance trains to: Temple Meads Train Station, Clifton, Redland, Gloucester rd and Bath etc. Plus bus services.  The Bristol to Bath railway path, is great for both cyclists and pedestrians and is right on our doorstep. Green spaces and lovely parks in walking distance.
host_about: So far I've really enjoyed the experience of hosting the varied and interesting selection of people who have visited my home. I'm calm and friendly, respectful, easy to get along with person. When I travel, I like to stay in places that offer me privacy and space but helpful and friendly if I need anything. I like a clean, clear space, that I can call my own, so I aim to offer the same to my guests, I'm also open to a friendly chat and cuppa if you need that. I'm told people feel relaxed and at ease in my company. I am well traveled including time spent in West Africa and Europe. I've lived in Central and South America and the Caribbean. I love the arts and culture, I'm a practicing writer, photographer and therapist. I love music and dancing and for many years I worked alongside world music artists, working and traveling with artists from all over the world; I think this has given me a broad understanding, appreciation and acceptance of different people and different customs. I relate well to others and am told by people who have limited grasp of the english language that my spoken english and diction is clear and easy to understand. I speak a little spanglish! I like walking, nature and yoga.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
host_about:
I rent rooms out in my home in Bristol. I'm a self employed freelance travel content marketer and PR copywriter and during the pandemic I was hit hard so I now rent 2 of my spare rooms. 

I'm in my mid 50s and have done the partying so now am an early to bed, early to rise person and  love going to bed early with a good book  I always aim for 8 hours sleep. I try to fit in gym classes daily, and  meditate regularly.

I like to keep a clean and tidy home (and hope if you're staying with me you would respect that and keep it clean/ check my house rules).

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.64 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Gloucester Road is a popular, vibrant area just north of the city centre. It is known for its independent shops which include an independent book shop, arts & crafts, vintage clothes/charity shops, health food shops, hair salons, bakeries/grocery shops, artisan chocolate shops as well as abundant cafés, bars and restaurants. It has become an increasingly popular area with local students attending both of Bristol’s universities.

Bishopston is a vibrant & popular neighbourhood with a strong community feel. The house is a 5 min walk from Gloucester Road, famous for its independent, characterful shops, cafes and street art, & considered to be the longest row of independent shops in Europe. It has a great choice of cafes, bars and restaurants - perfect for relaxing and watching the world go by! Some of which offer free live music.

It is about half an hour’s walk away from the main shopping areas, & 45 minutes walk from the vibrant harbourside area - good bus links t
host_about: I have lived in Bristol for 18 years and I divide my time between working as a complementary therapist, and teaching English to foreign students, both of which I love! My interests and quests include good health, good food, good music and good coffee!  I love travelling and happening across new and special places & have really enjoyed meeting many varied and interesting guests via airbnb over the years.

name: Home in Westbury on Trym · ★4.96 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 private bath

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
host_about:
Your hosts are Lis and Tris. 

Lis is a professional dog walker with various hobbies, including playing the cello. 
Lis is the main host with broad experienced hosting. first overseas students, later with Airbnb.
Lis likes to regard herself as a nurturer and loves making people happy and comfortable,
Lis and Tris are a married couple with no children, but three lovely dogs, Benji, Flea and Dudley.

Lis speaks Catalan, Spanish, English, Italian and can mumble French.
Tris speaks English.

I do love music and play the cello and listen to classical music mainly, making my home a very relaxing place to live in.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.90 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths

We are widely travelled and have an appreciation of home from home comforts. We have brought up our two children here while working and renovating this idyllic retreat. We welcome you to join us in this unusual sylvan setting and welcome suggestions to make your stay even more comfortable.

host_about: We love to travel and meet people from different countries and cultures. We are very sociable, down to earth and easy to get on with.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.90 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
We live in a quite suburban neighbourhood which is tranquil and spacious. There are parks nearby and access to local amenities such as supermarkets, shops and transport. If your stay is in the warmer months, you will be able to enjoy the garden also - and you may even get some home grown fruit and veg!
(Please note we are not in central Bristol!)
host_about:
Hi!
I love hosting and have done so for several years. Meeting new people and making them feel welcome and comfortable is a treat!
My interest in people extends to my work - I teach yoga and am a trauma therapist. I run my therapy business from home so this may limit your accessibility to the kitchen during the daytime - no problem if you are at work!
You may find me practicing yoga while you stay - often in the garden in the summer months.
My husband is often away working as a choreographer in the USA, so when you stay it may be me or both of us here but I will let you know.
I have a BFA in Dance, and used to live and work in Holland and New York City. I have studied business, philosophy, creative writing and love learning.
I am looking forward to hosting you - please get in touch!

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
host_about:
My name is Joanne. I am from New Zealand and have been living in the UK for over thirty years, living in London for 15 years before settling here in Bristol for twenty years now. 

In 2013  I joined the Airbnb Community offering homestay accommodation to travellers & visitors, university students, those looking to relocate and or work in Bristol for short stay visits. 

My previous experience of homestay hosting involved working closely with an established Bristol English Language School, 2010 -2013. I was valued by them for my contribution to homestay experiences offered to their foreign language students. 

With the unprecedented events of the 2020 Covid 19 Pandemic, I closed my doors to hosting from March 2020 until  
June 2021. The three lockdown phases, in particular, though challenging at times, offered me & I hope others some extraordinary experiences, a time to pause, reflect, restore, regroup. So much to fathom during them & in the uncertain times we now continue to face. Gentle, gentle. 

It was with some reticence I concede, that I opened my doors to hosting again in the last weeks of June 2021. I am rediscovering again the enriching experience of sharing my home, creating a welcoming, relaxed & comfortable experience for others, a space where connecting in good conversation is valued & respected as much as the need for privacy & discretion. 

I feel immense gratitude for the experiences I have shared & been privilege to with guests through Airbnb hosting & I look forward to the many more experiences to come my way. 
With much warmth & appreciation, Joanne

name: Townhouse in Bristol · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: Our house is unusual in that there's a communal garden at the front, with no access by road, and a cul-de-sac at the back, so we have no passing traffic at all.  Clifton village, full of life, shops, restaurants, bars etc is a short but strenuous walk up the hill.
host_about:
We're a busy, active family of two lawyers, two children (post-university age) and a lively (10 year old) working cocker spaniel. Both keen skiers and open water swimmers, Anne is a runner and Iain a mountain-biker. There are more bikes in the garage than people in the house ... 
PS it’s ‘iain’, not ‘Lain’!

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.90 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Because Somerset Road forms the top edge of Arnos Vale's beautiful Victorian cemetery, there are no 'cut through' roads between Wells Road (A37) and Bath Road (A4), and no passing traffic at all. So, despite it's proximity to many useful major routes into and out of Bristol, the area is extremely quiet. Because of the elevation (it sits at the top of a hill), and the fact that we border the 48 acre nature reserve at Arnos Vale, the air quality is also excellent.

There is a very well stocked local corner shop a couple of minutes walk away (literally round the corner!), and nearby Wells Road offers restaurants and shops. Major supermarkets etc also within walking distance.

Through Arnos Court park you can get to Paintworks with the super cool Bocabar for drinks, coffee, cocktails and excellent food and pizzas. Beyond there are several craft beer taprooms, the new Wake The Tiger interactive art installation, and other interesting venues in the rapidly developing St
host_about: I'm a freelance media producer, so a lot of the time I'm working from home. I'm also a musician, photographer, cook, writer, philosopher and all round renaissance man! Lived in Bristol for 25 years, and it's a city I love and I know well, so if you're new to town I can give you some tips for finding interesting and uniquely Bristol-style culture.

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.90 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Shirehampton Village is 7 miles from Bristol city centre. With great transport links from Shirehampton Station and busses to Bristol and Weston Super Mare via the Severn Beach train line, Avonmouth Park and Ride, the green bus, stops a 3 minutes' walk away and there are frequent buses from the high street in Shirehampton village to Bristol City centre and Cribbs Causeway.
There are local shops, pubs and takeaway within walking distance.
We are blessed with some wonderful views of the river Avon along Lamplighters marshes and Daisy Fields just a short walk away.
host_about: I have lived in Shirhampton since June 2019, I share the house with  my best friend and lodger, my 2 children, 3 cats and 12 rescue hens. I have a background in hospitality and take pride in providing a pleasant place to stay. Where possible my impact on the environment is minimised.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Townhouse in Bristol · ★4.85 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
This is a vibrant, evolving community with people from all cultures and influences. It's not a beautiful area by any means, so if you want a quiet, leafy suburb, this isn't for you. If you're after an inner-city, conveniently located place, close to the town and to train, coach and motorway, then this fits the bill. We are only a 10 minute walk to the shopping centre (Broadmead and Cabot Circus) where there is a large cinema and many restaurants. Away from town there is a road called St Mark's Road which has many lovely eating places.
Try the Greenbank, Volunteer Tavern or Phoenix pubs which are all a short distance away.
host_about:
Friendly, considerate and kind, laidback and happy and comfortable with people of all orientations and cultures.

I let my guests have their own space and time. If you need help then I am very happy to assist, if you'd rather be left alone to do your own thing, I totally understand.

I love travelling and have been fortunate enough to visit many different places. I love reading, the opera and theatre, nature and walking my lovely dog.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.71 · 5 bedrooms · 6 beds · 4.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: The views are spectacular - one way, we see  the river and woodlands and the other way, we see the distant cranes at Avonmouth with the estuary and the Brecon Beacons in Wales beyond them.  It feels as though we are in the country and yet we are just a ten minute drive into town.  The Portway lies below us - so you can hear the hum of traffic, especially with the windows open but and the birds and wildlife too - we love that mix.
host_about: A busy mum of two who runs her own business in tv production.

Much of community life centres around Victoria Park which is a large lovely green space at the end of my road. It has a children's play area, a lovely little café that you can dash to for bacon sarnies in the morning and great views across Bristol.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: We live in a quiet, residential suburb in North West Bristol. There are a few local shops just around the corner, and the nearest supermarket (Aldi) is a 20 minute walk, or few minute's drive.  Westbury Village, with lots of pubs, cafes and restaurants is a 8-10 minute drive. Close to Southmead Hospital and Airbus. On two major bus routes to the City Centre which takes about 45 minutes
host_about: John is from Bristol, England. Interests are: cycling, gardening, cricket,  current affairs, cooking and music. Shoko is from Inage, Japan and her interests are cycling, reading, cooking and current affairs. We also have a lovely cat called Eric.

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Ours is a quiet residential street that's centrally located. Walk to the famous Gloucester Road in under 10 minutes for independent shops, greengrocers, pubs and restaurants. Cotham Hill and Whiteladies Road are 15 minutes' walk in the opposite direction and offer some of Bristol's best and most buzzing restaurants. If you're after retail therapy from high street shops or want to explore the historical harbourside, that's about 20 minutes' walk from my place, with the vast open green space of the Downs about 25 minutes away.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.88 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Bristol is called the Gateway to the West Country and so is a great place to stop en route to Devon and Cornwall or to go directly west into beautiful Wales. It is also a great place to stay in for itself.
As well as being the UK's first cycling city, Bristol also won Green City status. It has great cycling routes as well as public transport and is a vibrant, multicultural city with plenty of cultural, musical and historical events and places.
We are located close to St Mark's Road, which is a short vibrant street with restaurants, takeaways, artisan bakery and the renowned Sweetmart, as well as mosque, Methodist church and pub. Nearby is gastropub -The Greenbank, Este - a Brazilian/Columbian cafe, and deli/cafe No 12 The High Street, as well as Eastville Park all within walking distance.
While most guests enjoy the diversity and boho atmosphere of the locality, one or two people have expressed concern about the neighbourhood. Please note that this is an inner city ar
host_about:
I (she/her) have lived in Bristol since 2002, working for Bristol City Council (Adult Education and the arts).  Having left the Council to return to study, I now work at UWE.
I have been hosting on Airbnb since 2014, love travel myself, and enjoy meeting lots of lovely new people.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.88 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Montpelier was recently voted one of the top 'coolest places to live in the UK' (The Times) . What's noticeable about it how is different all the buildings are .. You get a real sense of that from the roof terrace. There's a real diversity of people and things to do as well .
There's a nice pub just opposite, The Cadbury, with tranquil beer garden and great sunday lunches. Within a couple of minutes walk there are several eateries, with great variety whether for breakfast, lunch or dinner. If you want (guaranteed every night) live music with your food The Canteen on Stokes Croft. Also at the bottom of the road is a farm shop, an Italian deli and a yoga studio.
host_about:
I'm easy-going and sociable, and can get along with just about anyone. 
I love music, food and interesting conversation. I work as a music therapist in health care settings throughout Bristol. There are lots of instruments in the house anyone can play if they like. 
I love my home. It is characterful, comfortable and peaceful, and I take a pleasure in welcoming people in to it.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.93 · 3 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
St Werburghs has lots to offer including three excellent pubs, a city farm and farm cafe, and a fantastic organic supermarket (The Better Food Company).

The main row of shops (Mina Road) is a stones throw away from the house and has a selection of take-aways and restaurants.

If you fancy a bit of the outdoors, Mina park is just around the corner and there is a community garden leading to 'strawberry hill' with a beautiful view across Bristol.

The popular areas of Stoke's Croft and Gloucester Road are also in walking distance (15 and 25 minutes respectively) and offer some great bars, restaurants, pubs and shops.
host_about: I am a natural host and I take great pride in my home. I enjoy cooking and baking and guests are welcome to use any of our many cooking and baking books and equipment during their stay. I will also leave some home baked goodies as a welcome gift.

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.33 · 1 bedroom · 1 shared bath
host_about: I was born in Iran, my parents are from India and I've lived in England since I was 13! I have been hosting foreign students for the last 16 years!!

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.82 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
host_about: I was born in Iran, my parents are from India and I've lived in England since I was 13! I have been hosting foreign students for the last 16 years!!

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.78 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: Our home is very homely, warm and cozy. It's a quiet, humble area, a minutes walk to the BAWA leisure club. 6 minutes to bus stops which go to the city centre (up to 40 mins to town). Approx 20 mins by car. There are lots of takeaways in the area too. The famous Gloucester road is a short bus ride away too (15-20 mins). famous for its independent shops, cafes and restaurants.  We take great pride in the house. It's been in our family from when it was built in 1920. I am the 4th generation to own it. My Mum (Sally) lives there permanently and I live in London but occasionally visit. However, I will be on hand to help you throughout your stay.
host_about:
I am open minded, easy going, avid traveller. I am a creative person and love the arts. 

Although I own the property, My mum lives there full time and is my Co-host. The house has been in our family since 1930 (when it was built).

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.81 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: My flat is located in a bohemian and lively neighbourhood which is urban and diverse. It is a quiet street in general and I always feel safe as a single woman living alone, but there can be a bit of noise from people walking back from the local pub. I love the life of this area,  it is scattered with lovely green trees and birdsong, little lanes, colourfully painted houses, graffiti and murals. 10 minutes walk to the hipster highstreet of Stokes Croft with trendy Cafes, restaurants and bars, 15 minutes walk to Cabot Circus high street shopping mall and 15 minutes walk to St Werburghs City Farm and Self Build community.
host_about:
COVID 19 Update: To all my potential guests; please rest assured I am taking this pandemic very seriously and have taken the following actions: 
* updated my listing so the cancellation policy is flexible. 
* I am in touch with all guests making sure they let me know if they have any signs of infection
* my cleaner is cleaning with extra care and disinfectants on all touch points 
* I have also made sure there is at least a day between bookings so that in the unfortunate scenario that one of my guests was ill, there would be time for the virus to become inactive. 

I am from Glasgow Scotland. I am a Yoga Teacher, physical performer, dance maker and artist. I love to provide a quality experience and continually work to add special touches to make my listing better for my guests. Recently I got fast internet in the flat - whereas I had previously used my upstairs neighbors. I work hard and am often busy, but believe in kindness and resting through all activities and acceptance of humanity. I love to eat healthy; juicing and salads and quality animal produce. I am also passionate about a really well made cup of coffee and reading in cafes.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.68 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Montpelier, is the creative quarter of Bristol which is just 10 to 15 minutes from Cabot Circus and 20 minutes walk from the harbour side.  There are some great local restaurants and an organic supermarket just 5 minutes away.
host_about: Hello,  Michael, Olivia and Arthur (our beloved Irish Terrier) live in Central Bristol.  Olivia works as a child and adolescent therapist and Michael is a youth worker.   The three of us love walking in nature, art and going to gigs.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.69 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · Half-bath
host_about: I am a young at heart 56 year old female, who enjoys meeting up with friends and being social, whilst also enjoying a slower paced life and the beautiful out doors. I'm a vegetarian but have no problem with meat eating lodgers! I enjoy meeting people from around the world and would make you feel very welcome. You will have full access to your bedroom, the kitchen, dining room, garden plus upstairs bathroom and downstairs cloakroom. Full access to Wi-Fi internet is available. I am considerate and quiet and would expect others to also respect this. This is a women only home.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.77 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to the vibrant and multicultural Easton quarter of Bristol! Our house is located in a friendly and lively neighborhood that is known for its excellent cafes, takeaways, and restaurants, as well as its many local amenities. Easton is a creative and artistic area that is full of character, and there are several pubs nearby where you can play darts, pool, and listen to music.

Our house is perfectly located to make the most of everything that Bristol has to offer, and it is a great choice for students, professionals, and visitors of all kinds. Whether you are in town for work, study, or leisure, you will find plenty to see and do in this exciting and dynamic city. We hope that you will enjoy your stay with us and make the most of all that Bristol has to offer.
host_about: I am very fond of cooking. I love fashion and music and am a very positive person who loves life.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.53 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
An oasis of calm so close to the University, shops and restaurants of Whiteladies Road and Cotham is just round the corner. You can enjoy all the charms of Clifton on your doorstep. The Clifton Downs are just up the road with wide open spaces and views over the gorge.
It's walking distance to the famous Brunel Clifton Suspension Bridge, University and docks. Lots of pubs bars and restaurants nearby.
host_about:
Quiet, much travelled, still exploring. Interested in the arts, design & architecture, films, literature, walking, motorbikes, cycling, technology, a Francophile. 
Pescatarian (fish-eating vegetarian, I don't eat any meat)

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.83 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Cotham Hill and Whiteladies road have become one of the most vibrant areas in the city, as well as being a short walk (around 20 mins) from Clifton Village, with its historic suspension bridge, shops and restaurants. The Triangle, Harbourside and bars and clubs of Stokes Croft are also all within walking distance.

name: Bed and breakfast in Bristol · ★4.97 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: We are within easy reach of the center of Bristol, with its museums and art galleries and the historic old town. Bristol docks are 5 minutes walk away, with the famous SS Great Britain, which draws visitors from around the globe, and a choice of waterside pubs and restaurants. We love the buzz of Bristol, and we're sure you will too!
host_about: Into art and music and staying fit. Living with partner in Bristol for last 20 years.   We're offering our guest room for visitors to Bristol looking for quiet, welcoming accommodation within easy reach of the city center. Please note that we have a two night minimum stay policy.
property_type: Private room in bed and breakfast

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.96 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview:
My neighbourhood is a vibrant and diverse, the home of many cultures, and includes also artists, musicians, environmentalists. I value and have been taken an active part in this community for many years.

There is a park and children's adventure playground and a church at the end of my street. I am an active member of the edible garden community in St Pauls and Bristol, in lauding Incredible Edible, PLANT@St Agnes Park, St Pauls Edible Adventures.
host_about:
My name is Joanne. I am from New Zealand and have been living in the UK for over thirty years, living in London for 15 years before settling here in Bristol for twenty years now. 

In 2013  I joined the Airbnb Community offering homestay accommodation to travellers & visitors, university students, those looking to relocate and or work in Bristol for short stay visits. 

My previous experience of homestay hosting involved working closely with an established Bristol English Language School, 2010 -2013. I was valued by them for my contribution to homestay experiences offered to their foreign language students. 

With the unprecedented events of the 2020 Covid 19 Pandemic, I closed my doors to hosting from March 2020 until  
June 2021. The three lockdown phases, in particular, though challenging at times, offered me & I hope others some extraordinary experiences, a time to pause, reflect, restore, regroup. So much to fathom during them & in the uncertain times we now continue to face. Gentle, gentle. 

It was with some reticence I concede, that I opened my doors to hosting again in the last weeks of June 2021. I am rediscovering again the enriching experience of sharing my home, creating a welcoming, relaxed & comfortable experience for others, a space where connecting in good conversation is valued & respected as much as the need for privacy & discretion. 

I feel immense gratitude for the experiences I have shared & been privilege to with guests through Airbnb hosting & I look forward to the many more experiences to come my way. 
With much warmth & appreciation, Joanne

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.67 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: The proximity to everything on the harbour side also to Cabot shopping  centre and the university.
host_about: Hi, we are Gali and Rob and we love to welcome you into our home.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.91 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: Redland is an attractive residential suburb to the north of the city centre near the Downs. The architecture of the area is predominantly Victorian and it benefits from a wide range of local amenities. The house is situated 5 minutes from Whiteladies Road, with access to a wide variety of shops, supermarkets, restaurants, cafes and pubs. It is perfectly located for walking to Bristol University, BBC, BRI, The Spire Hospital, Bristol Zoo Gardens, The Downs, Clifton Village and the City Centre.
host_about: My husband Dermot and I love cycling,we are both regular cyclists here in Bristol and have had cycling holidays abroad. We love to travel and this year visited  some of the national parks of North America. We love  trying different cuisines. I love reading and I am in a local book club. We have met lots of wonderful people through hosting and also  enjoyed being Airbnb guests. It's a great way of getting to know local areas etc. I speak some French. We love our home and living in Bristol and we hope you enjoy it too.

name: Condo in Clifton · ★4.82 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: Clifton is the historic jewel in the crown of Bristol with stunning Georgian terraces, bars, alfresco dining and boutique shops. The apartment is situated on a leafy 300 acre park so perfect for walks, running or picnics in the summer!
host_about:
Originally from Clifton in Bristol but have lived and travelled in many destinations around the world. Been using Airbnb since 2012 and stayed in destinations from Abergavenny to Australia as often prefer being able to stay in a home as opposed to a hotel.
I'll be on hand to advise on things to do, restaurants etc if required.

name: Townhouse in Bristol · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Cotham is a lovely late Georgian/early Victorian area of central Bristol with easy access to the business, sightseeing and shopping districts as well as Bristol University, the Bristol Royal Infirmary complex and the BBC.
host_about: I'm Sue from Bristol and I have been hosting since September 2014.  I've had a great time doing it and met some lovely people from all over the world..   My husband Nick and I both have backgrounds in law.  He is a barrister and I was a solicitor and,  latterly, dealt with business development for large law firms.  I changed course about the time I started doing Airbnb and now run a small vegan catering business so Airbnb is a really good fit.  We have two little parsons terriers, Enzo and Tiggy, and I am lucky enough to have a half share in a horse which I ride a couple of times a week.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Pubs, park, a short walk away from public transport services train, bus, metrobus

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
We live on the docks in the heart of the city. We are in a quiet row of beautiful Victorian 3 and 4 story town houses and villas that are only 5 mins walk from M shed and cafe's and restuarants and 10 mins walk from the Watershed and Arnolfni arts centres and theatres and cinemas. for more details see our first listing "amazing location city centre" and reviews as it is the same house - our family home.
There is a new 'foodie' area 200meters from us with an organic supermarket, and numerous cafes and bars and 9 converted shipping containers that house a variety of fantastic eating locations including one run by a Michelin starred chef and a BBC Masterchef finalist


Please ensure you have completed your Airbnb profile as we only accept guests who have put info about themselves - ie where they are from, what they do, any hobbies etc. Please note that this is a big old house where our family and deerhound live. The wet room and bathroom are used by us too. If you a
host_about: I was a TV Director, now I am writing my first novel, play guitar with several bands, narrate audiobooks. My partner Jacqui, works for a charity, teaches and is a crafter; we’re Both creatives, love good food, music and the cinema but not necessarily all at the same time. Our religious views are that you can see Bristol Cathedral from our back garden.

name: Townhouse in Bristol · ★4.95 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: We live in a quiet residential street that is right in the heart of Bristol. You can walk to Cotham Hill in 3 minutes, where you will find seriously good bars (Bravas, a tapas bar; Brewhouse, pizzas and craft beer), restaurants (Pasta Loco, one of Bristo's top rated restaurants) and all the buzz you would expect from a student city. Whiteladies Road is a further 2 minutes away and here you will find the marvelous Boston Tea Party cafe and the Cowshed restaurant (amongst many others). Plus you'll find all the usual supermarkets and pharmacies.
host_about:
Caroline runs a brand & packaging design consultancy and Luke is a drinks consultant and chair of a food charity. We love art, culture,  food, cooking and entertaining and have a house full of things we have gathered from our travels around Europe and the world. We share our home with our charming Scottie dog called Pearl.
We are naturally gregarious and enjoy meeting new people and having them to stay in our home!

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.52 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The Studio offers ready access both to central Bristol, to Bath by car or train, and to the River Avon Valley and local parks and nature reserve (two minutes down to the river walks).
For central Bristol, 36 bus stop within 2 minutes walk, bus half hourly (hourly during daytime on Sundays); or 25 minutes walk to Temple Meads which is a transport hub for buses all over Bristol as well as local and national trains; or drive to centre 10-20 minutes depending on traffic, then use pay park or some free places in evenings; or taxi (£8?). Bus timetables online or use Bristol Bus timetable live app. Hard copy of 36 timetable at studio, along with taxi cards and some rail timetables.
It is two minutes walk to the local Village Centre which has a fair sized Co-Op (with Amazon locker and cashpoint), local Indian, Chinese, Pizza and café outlets, GP surgery and Lloyds chemists shop.
Avonmeads Retail Park within 4 minutes drive or 25 minutes on foot has numerous outlets, some 24/7,
host_about:
My wife and I have busy professional jobs which have given us a great deal of experience over the years with many types of people, different cultural settings and nationalities. We also own property which we let to young professionals and have had extensive experience both with lodgers and tenants (over 150 contracts); and with property development and maintenance. An overview, including testimonials, can be viewed at www bristolpad co uk. We are recognized for being efficient and pro-active in ensuring that the accommodation we provide is of high standard and well maintained. We are NLA and ICO registered. 
The Avonview Studio flat described here represents an annex development which we feel will be attractive both for business and holiday travellers to the Bristol area. It is our first experience of short term letting / managed apartments and we are committed to ensuring that we provide a high standard of service. We also have excellent local contacts and contractors to support our services.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.42 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: This place is fantastic - peaceful (right on top of Windmill Hill), only 100 metres from Victoria Park - a beautiful park which covers half of the hill with amazing views and a great outdoor cafe. Some lovely local pubs (only a few minutes walk away) with good food and a fun friendly atmosphere.
host_about:
I am a friendly, sociable, but peaceful person. I love looking after our house and garden, and making it as homely and cosy as I can, and I enjoy welcoming guests to our house. I like to try to make your stay as relaxing and enjoyable as possible.  I do like to host guests who are happy to be considerate in return . Fortunately, for most guests , this comes naturally!

I love nature, and like to try to be as environmentally friendly as I can in the way that I live, and use environmentally friendly products in the house. I also try where possible to minimise plastic so  you will find there is soap rather than shower gel in the bathroom. I don't buy any food containing palm oil, as this product is instrumental in the widespread destruction of the rainforest habitat. However, that said, I do attempt to use up food and/or bathroom products left behind by guests, as I do not like waste, so if you see any non-environmentally friendly items around then these may have been left by guests. My garden is a wild garden, which I have designed to be good for biodiversity,  including birds, frogs, toads, spiders, insects and a fox ! So it often looks quite overgrown, as wildlife loves a good rambling garden :) 

I have two B&B rooms in the house , so you may find other guests staying here at the same time as myself and you. In the summer I also have the summerhouse on Air BNB.

 Please make sure you have read and are happy with all my house rules as some of them are quite specific and may be different to other Air BNB houses that you may have stayed in before. 

I give a minimum of 2% of my profits to charity every month, mainly animal welfare and environmental charities such as Marine Conservation  Society, Cruelty Free International, the Orangutan Foundation, but also the NSPCC and Womankind, a charity which works to reduce violence to women in certain countries which have a cultural history of violence against women. 

So you can be happy in the knowledge that the money you pay me will be spent wisely, on charities and  products which lead to the caring of our environment, animals, and humans, rather than contribute to our destruction.

 My hobbies are singing, music, dancing, gardening, writing, sewing, and many others!! I look forward to meeting you :)

name: Guesthouse in Bristol · ★4.75 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The Cabin is located on the edge of a City Park at the bottom of my large garden, there is a side entrance the door has a key code for security.

This is a very safe Neighbourhood, the street is part of a large post war cul-de-sac built to house teachers from the nearby private school.

It is a short walk to a small shopping centre and two lively communities with local restaurants and pubs. It is close to two cycle paths, with direct access to pretty walks and historical woodlands, yet still very close to the city. The front of the house is ordinary but the rear is extraordinary (Narnia )
host_about:
Our Mum, Wendy, recently passed away in December 2017 after a short battle with an aggressive cancer. Mum worked as a Social Worker in the Adoption department and ran the AirBnB on the side, with the help of us; her three children (Ruby, Guy & Laurence) and her friends. Laurence named our home "The Wendy Estate" when Mum started sharing our home with AirBnB and various other lodgers she met & supported over the years. 

It was Mum's greatest wish that we continue to host our beloved cabin and treehouse on Airbnb and we hope to do so in a very 'Wendy like' fashion. 

Written by Wendy in 2015 ; "I am a Guardian reading, permaculture type, I work part time, love travelling, all things garden and 20th Century design. I like  sharing my lovely space with other people I am lucky to live in a rural oasis in the heart of a beautiful city which I know really well! "

A little bit about us... 

Ruby is the eldest & bossiest, she'll be making sure the rooms are up to scratch and there's enough tea and coffee in for you. Ruby is trained as a photographer but also knows all the best 'value for money' eateries & how to get about the city on public transport. 


Laurence is he's the music man of the three of us. He will tell you about the best forms of night life & the music culture of Bristol. 

Guy is the money making entrepreneur, he knows how to live a luxurious life and will give you ideas for how to have a truly luxurious time in Bristol.  

We all love food, music, and socialising. We live in a house full of books and many lovely items that make this house & the outbuildings our home and we look forward to continue sharing the 'Wendy Estate' with the rest of the world.

name: Condo in Bristol · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: My apartment is located on old historic Square, with lots of green space, yets its minutes walk to the City center.  You can walk to all the great bars and restaurant nearby within 10 mins.
host_about:
Hi, I love travelling and have travelled most of the world happily and at ease immersing myself in different cultures.
I still enjoy my walks in the beautiful surrounding countryside of my city, my yoga practice and cooking new recipes of delicious food.

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.93 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Stoke Bishop is a quiet residential area of Bristol. The apartment is situated very close to The Downs, a large and beautiful public park with views over the suspension bridge. Access to shops and other local amenities is by foot (15-20 mins) or by car (5-10 mins). The flat is ground floor - with two flats above, these are occupied by families with small children.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.81 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
We live next to a beautiful Victorian cemetery- with a gorgeous chapel, full of trees and leads to the Royate Hill conservation area part of which is on the old rail viaduct. Lovely place for a sundowner drink looking over Bristol.

Please look at the online guide book we have created for local shops, transport, pubs and restuarants.


On Greenbank road which is on the end of our road:
-Local Spar run by a lovely family and stocks great range of food and drink. Not your average Spar!
-Greenbank Offlicence which stock beer from every local brewery in Bristol and good wines.
-Este Kitchen for South American coffee and food.
-Matter wholefood for organic lovelies, food and the freshest juices.
-The Greenbank pub (offers craft ales, great food and good music on a weekend).


St Marks Road is also only a 10 minute walk away and there you can find:
Thali Café
Garden of Easton (book well ahead for evening meals, or
host_about:
Danie and I live with our son and daughter in Bristol, England.
We love this city and whilst we love exploring and adventuring over the UK and in Europe, we always love to come back to our home town of Bristol. It's a wonderful place.

We both try to lead a healthy lifestyle- we cycle where ever possible, eat vegetarian food, exercise and both have jobs which we work hard for and really enjoy.

I am a Primary School Teacher and Danie is a freelance Marketing Manager.

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.87 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: This is a vibrant and interesting neighbourhood.  Montpelier is on our doorstep, with it's artistic quarter, beautiful coloured houses and lovely relaxed vibe.  Gloucester Road is a great place to shop or browse, full of independent retailers and lovely food and drinking areas.  Many of our guests head to Clifton Village for a potter.  Full of lovely shops. Georgian squares and cafes, it's a great place to while away a Saturday or Sunday.   You won't be stuck for things to do!
host_about: I have lived in Bristol, UK for over twenty years and enjoy the independent, creative spirit that has makes it such a great place to live.  I'm interested in photography, cycling and being outdoors and I also love hosting visitors and  helping them with any information they might need, such as good places to eat and visit.  I have three children and so family is a big part of my life, and I juggle family with running my own businesses.

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.81 · 1 bedroom · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This lovely flat is perfect for an indulgent weekend break or for a longer stay. The flat is close to all the amenities that Bristol has to offer - bars, shops and restaurants as well as the amazing Lido opposite the flat.
The BBC is a short walk away as is the University of Bristol and the BRI.
There is loads to see in Bristol - Brunel's famous suspension bridge, the museums and art galleries, as well as a thriving theatre and music scene.
It is well worth googling the Lido and booking in for one of their packages as a special treat - it is a wonderful and memorable experience. The Lido bar is fantastic if you just want an afternoon tea, or a glass of wine and some delicious Tapas. There is also a highly rated restaurant upstairs, overlooking the pool.
Next door to the Lido, and in contrast to the modernity of it, there's a delightful quiet traditional pub 'The Victoria' - perfect for that pint of foaming ale!
host_about:
I live in what I consider to be the best city in the Uk - Bristol. I love the fact that it's really hilly and that from pretty much anywhere within the city you can see the surrounding countryside. It's perfectly situated to get quickly to Devon, Cornwall, Dorset, Somerset and Wales.
There are glorious walks to go on from Bristol - into the Mendip Hills or the Brecon Beacons.
Bristol has a very lively art, music and theatre culture and a range of first class restaurants.
My particular passions are spending time with my family, going to the theatre, walking in the countryside and cooking and eating with friends.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.74 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
We are situated in a peacful Victorian terraced street in the heart of popular Southville, in between vibrant, trendy North Street and Bristol's historic centre and Harbourside.

Plenty of tourist attractions a short 10 minute walk away: SS Great Britain, Arnolfini, We The Curious, Aquarium, M-Shed, Etc.

We are within a 5 minute walk of lively North Street's and its trendy independent shops, cafe's, bars and restaurants, as well as the dynamic Tobacco Factory theatre.

Temple-Meads Station a 25 minute walk away.
The airport bus also drops within a a 10 minute walk of the address.
neighbourhood: Bristol, City of Bristol, United Kingdom

name: Townhouse in Bristol · ★4.91 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: Easton is renowned for formidable world grocery shop The Sweetmart, and St Marks Road full of independent shops and restaurants. It's a multicultural area that has a great buzz.
host_about:
Creative, curious, respectful...
We are laid back, love cooking (eating), exploring, theatre, comedy, gigs, weird artsy stuff, fun outdoor activities, hiking, surfing, films, games, a glass of red, conversation.

name: Home in Bristol · ★5.0 · 5 bedrooms · 5 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview: The immediate neighbourhood is very quiet. However, the Gloucester Road is two minutes walk, and has a wide range of shops, restaurants, cafes, bars and pubs.
host_about:
We live in Bristol - European green capital in 2015!

I travel quite a bit through work, but also work from home, running an educational business with my wife. We work hard, and like to travel when we can. 

As a guest, I'm a relaxed person, and we'd be respectful of your home. 

What else do you want to know? Ask...

name: Bed and breakfast in Bristol · ★4.92 · 2 bedrooms · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
host_about: Art teacher living in a central area of Bristol and sharing a house with two other people
property_type: Private room in bed and breakfast

name: Townhouse in Bristol · ★4.80 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
Gloucester Road is a great street with many independent shops restaurants and cafes. 5 mins walk to park or county cricket and frequent buses to the centre and beyond. Stokes Croft is nearby with even more food and music.

This is the best part of Bristol.... it is rich with independent unusual and creative businesses of every sort. There is live music in several venues most nights, and great food inspired by the world, and by localism and seasonality. The shops are quirky, with fabulous gifts (some made locally) as well as essentials. Gloucester Road morphs into Stokes Croft- the artistic and creative hub of North Bristol- on its way to the centre with the river, and the SS Great Britain.
Bristol is a good base for touring about...it is near Bath, and not too far from Stonehenge and Longleat or the seaside at Weston Super Mare or Clevedon. It is also a good stopping off point if on a long journey from North to Southwest or from west Wales to the South East.
St
host_about: My name is Prue, a keen cook who likes crosswords, Scrabble, paintings and red wine in any order. I love Bristol. It is friendly and quirky and interesting. After more than 10 years here, I realise I will never get it properly, as it is so many things to different people.... I am a few minutes' walk from the Gloucestershire County Ground (cricket, Neville Road) in the middle of a long road of mostly independent shops, galleries, cafes, restaurants and pubs. Who could ask for more?

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.62 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Windmill hill is a very community spirited friendly neighbourhood.  There are lots of community events, eg music in the park, arts trail, street parties, bonfire night, concerts in the church, fun day in park. It is right beside one of the nicest parks in Bristol, and conveniently located near the centre, but without seeming too busy.

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
Within a short walk to independent shops, bakeries, cafes, bars, indoor market, brewery, theatre and gym.

Weekly outdoor Sunday market in the Tobacco factory cafe/bar courtyard.

Southville is host to the annual European street art festival, plenty to explore and see.
host_about:
Hi, I have lived in Bristol for many years and happy to share my favourite places. 
I love this diverse, friendly creative city and meeting people from across the world.
I have worked as a midwife and with children's charities. 
The wellbeing of my guests is important. I want every guest to feel welcome, safe and at home.  
I'm a published and spoken word poet. My poetry collection 'Fontanelle ' published 2021. 
Enjoy running spoken word events, baking, walking, spending time with friends and family. 
I keep chickens for their delicious eggs and quirky characters.
Look forward to meeting you and sharing my home during your trip.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.91 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Clifton is a lovely area with big wide streets and green squares. Clifton village has lots of  restaurants and bars....and of course Brunel's suspension bridge (10 mins walk).
host_about:
Hi,

my name is Cat, I'm 44 and I do Interior architecture and Interior design. 

I study Buddhism and personal development, and also enjoy Brazillian Forro and Lindy Hop dancing.

I am a friendly and welcoming host, and enjoy getting to know new people, but also respect others privacy.

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.54 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: St. Pauls is a vibrant area of Bristol close to the city center. Stokes Croft is minutes away and has been rejuvenated in recent years with independent coffee shops, bars and restaurants.
host_about: A 40 something, somewhat nomadic, Londoner. Software engineer by profession. PPG pilot for fun.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are in easy reach of the centre of Bristol, with its museums, art galleries and historical old town.

Bristol docks and historic harbour are only a 5 minutes walk away, highlights include the famous SS Great Britain.

name: Townhouse in Bristol · ★4.94 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The house is ideally located, right off the Gloucester Road (described in the Independent as "the last great British high street"), with pretty much everything you would ever need on your doorstep - fresh bread/ pastries, brunch, lunch on a terrace, cocktails, restaurants, yoga, art, retail therapy and food to prepare at home ( Italian and Spanish delis, whole food shops, fresh meat, fish, fruit and veg.)

The house is, nevertheless on a small and quiet residential one-way street. Cultural areas, such as Montpelier and Stokes Croft, are only a 5-10 minute walk away.

This is a great base for exploring Bristol, including its many festivals, such as St Pauls Carnival, Bristol Harbour Festival, Bristol VegFest, Bristol International Balloon Fiesta, the Ashton Court music festival etc.

name: Condo in Bristol · ★4.83 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: Beaufort road is one of Clifton's quietest, greenest streets, yet just a short walk for the shops and restaurants of Whiteladies road and the city centre.  The perfect location for a business or pleasure trip to Bristol!
host_about: I am a vet and zoologist and have been in Bristol for 20 years now.  I spend much of my time travelling both for work and pleasure.  Aside from my veterinary work I am a keen photographer, allotment grower, and also work as a wildlife tour guide.  I enjoy meeting new faces, networking, and bringing friends together at the table.

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.76 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Our apartment is located in a beautiful area of Bristol, between Clifton and Hotwells. Clifton is a gorgeous village, which has an abundance of restaurants, independent boutiques, lovely cosy pubs and trendy bars. Clifton is renowned for having some of the most iconic spots in the city, the streets are lined with wonderfully charming Georgian buildings.

The apartment is also a short walk away from Bristol’s historic harbourside, buzzing with activity at any time of the day. A ferry stop is mere minutes away, and will take you from the flat into the city centre, but not without seeing the SS Great Britain, and other cultural sites along the way!

We are also a short walk from Clifton Suspension Bridge, the Downs, Clifton Observatory. The City Centre is 15 minutes walk, as is the Bristol Hippodrome.
host_about:
Hi, my name's Sophie, and I am very lucky to be living in the wonderful city of Bristol.

I work in publishing, and am a lover of all things travel, cooking, and can usually be found with my nose in a good book.

I love hosting people from all over the world with my partner Calum and our son Dylan.

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.27 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Montpelier is a lively Bohemian area close to the popular Stokes Croft area of the city lots of Bars and Restaurants close by including the ever popular 'Canteen'. St Werburghs Bristol's Greenest neighborhood is on the doorstep which has a City Farm there are City parks, St Andrews is a particular favourite of ours and cycle paths close by. The bustling Gloucester Road is also within close walking distance.
There is a local convenience store just a 3 minute walk away and an organic supermarket with a cafe just around the corner.

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.96 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is close to everything; the large expanse of the Downs with dramatic views of Avon Gorge and the Suspension Bridge, the University of Bristol, Bristol Docks, Clifton Village, Bristol Zoo. We are central and in the hubbub of Bristol but on a leafy green street with classical Bath stone Victorian houses. Lots of bars and restaurants nearby.

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.71 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
As central as you can be in Bristol, without the noise! Great local pubs and eateries within minutes of the flat.

Bristol's main shopping centre and large cinema complex - 3 minutes on foot.

Central train station - 15 minutes on foot.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.70 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
There is a lovely, leafy St George's Park with its lake, tennis courts and bowling green, just 5 mins walk away - also a 'Grounded' cafe/restaurant on nearby Church Rd. There is also a great Malaysian restaurant & takeaway, 'Siam Smile' a short walk away on Church Rd, east towards Kingswood and now a new fabulous restaurant, 'The Lock Up' , within v easy walking distance, almost opposite Aldi on Church Rd - the food is equal to the best of Bristol! Really!
Besides there being Tesco’s and Aldi’s supermarkets only 3 & 5 mins away from the house, there is also a lovely new 'artisan' bakery with cafe, nearby on this side of Church Rd past theTesco shop..
host_about:
I like to experience life and travelling the world as much as I can now that I have more free time and have always been committed to an ethos of a global community, whereby friends and cultural exchanges are continually being made and welcomed from and by people from all over the world to create world unity.
I love world music and often go to WOMAD. I enjoy all Arts & am currently developing skills in life sculpture in clay and find Bristol a great place to be to enjoy the Arts scene.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.92 · 5 bedrooms · 5 beds · 3.5 baths

Peter runs a small marketing agency and Lucy dabbles in writing/communications, counselling and interiors. They have a booklet of recommendations of shops, bars, cafes and restaurants  in the city and their beloved Gloucester road which is 200metres away and packed with independent shops and cafes. A beautiful base from which to explore the city. They have 3 children from pre-school to teenage.

name: Home in Bristol · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath

A maxim I respect but don't necessarily achieve is do unto others as you would have done to yourself. 
I am gregarious, I like other cultures. I speak English and French and pigeon Italian and pigeon Portugese. I like theatre and cinema and most music apart from house and am not too fond of rap. I like African music, I come from Zimbabwe tho' born in South Africa. 

I like to travel quite simply. My favorite game park and  destination in the world is Mana Pools on the banks of the Zambezi but I also sail and enjoy rock climbing and I travel to Spain and Southern Africa to do these but I also travel to Southern Africa for work.  My favorite coast is the Mozambican coast but I also love the Pembroke coast of Wales.

We enjoy going to nearby venues for live music, the Watershed for great arthouse films, the Old Vic for theatre and the City Museums for topical exhibitions.

My house is shared with lodgers who have been here between 5-10 years so I am used to the benefits of independent living with sociability! 

I have been too busy organising my home to do much traveling recently, but I am going to Edinburgh this year.

I hope my guests will enjoy the privacy of the Coach House and the vibrancy of Clifton Village.

neighborhood_overview:

The local shops and pubs are all within 10 minutes walk of the house.
host_about: I have lived in Shirhampton since June 2019, I share the house with  my best friend and lodger, my 2 children, 3 cats and 12 rescue hens. I have a background in hospitality and take pride in providing a pleasant place to stay. Where possible my impact on the environment is minimised.

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.85 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath

host_about:
I am a very active person competing in triathlons and also horse events, work just about fits in around that!
So when I travel and use Airbnb it is normally for sporting related events.
When people stay in my Airbnb they rarely see me as I am often out and about!

name: Townhouse in Bristol · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
As we have already said our home is just 5 minutes walk from the top of the vibrant Gloucester Road. A 20 minute walk will take you through a bustling street with numerous traders, coffee shops and multi-ethnic eateries to suit a wide range of budgets and tastes.

We are also a few minutes walk to the home of Gloucestershire County Cricket.
host_about:
Hi, we are Lin and Jim and we live in Bristol close to a vibrant part of the City famed for having the longest street of independent traders in Western Europe.

We have family living in three continents so travel is a regular part of our lives. For almost as long as we can remember visitors from all over the world have stayed with us or close members of the family and we love meeting new people from diverse cultures.

Travelling, and living in a multi ethnic city, means tasting and enjoying local real food is a great joy; consequently we avoid the universal fast food chains. 

Our life motto is "Passionate about health, wholeness and the whole of life". Jim and I are "old enough to know better, but young enough to take a few risks now and then" - but that does not include bungy jumping!

name: Tiny home in Bristol · ★4.73 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are two miles from Temple Meads Station on a major bus route. We're also a 7-10 minute walk from the Beechmount Grove bus stop for the A4 Bristol Airdecker bus that can take you to the airport in 26 minutes and Bath in about 30 minutes.

There is a swimming pool only a 5 minute walk from the lodge (Jubilee Swimming Pool) via walkway, and a nature conservation area a similar distance away (callington nature reserve) 5 minutes down the lane and down a hill.

Three streets (10 min walk) away there is an entrance to award winning Arno's Vale Cemetery (and a park!), where Sherlock (Abominable Bride) was filmed.

Broadwalk shopping centre is also a short distance away for supplies, as is a large Tescos (about a mile's drive, with a petrol station) on Callington Road, and also a Lidl further down from Tescos.

As for food, there are Indian and Chinese takeaways just across the road and up a bit, as well as a pizza and kebab place. The Knowle Pub
host_about: A wife, mother of two and the CEO of a wee digital agency and tech social enterprise here in Bristol which I run with my husband Stuart. We don't get out much  - the business is all-consuming so we're really looking for some decent short breaks to make up for it :).

Our street and surrounding area is very friendly and secure. There is a pub very close to where we live called 'The Inn on the Green' which is an excellent pub, which serves a selection of local ales, great food and great staff. They open most of the day and is a great place to meet friends and family. If you fancy something different, try the Raj Pavilions which has great customer service and amazing curry dishes. There is also convenience store and launderette a couple of streets away.

Alternatively further a field, there is a vast array of exciting pubs, bars, restaurants to go on the Gloucester Road. If you are looking for fitness there is also local leisure centre with gym and swimming pool, or if you are looking for stroll t

Aside from my veterinary work I am a keen photographer, allotment grower, and also work as a wildlife tour guide.  I enjoy meeting new faces, networking, and bringing friends together at the table.

name: Townhouse in Bristol · ★4.50 · 3 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Our house is in a lovely bohemian neighbourhood with a park 50m down the hill from our house.  It's a short walk to the farm shop, a newsagent, a tapas restaurant, 2 fabulous cafes and Italian delicatessen.
host_about: JAMES BAYLISS-SMITH is a cameraman and documentary filmmaker currently based out Bristol in the west of England. He has a taste for adventure and is just as 'at home' filming Khazak's hunting with Golden Eagles in sub-zero Xinjiang as he is travelling to the remote presidential palace in the bizarre capital of Naypyidaw to interview the reclusive leader of Myanmar. A member of the Australian Cinematographers Society, James has previously received a cinematography award from the society for his work while shooting for the Australian Broadcasting Corporation (ABC) based out of Beijing, China.

name: Condo in Bristol · ★4.80 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Fishponds is a large suburb in the north-east of the of Bristol, about 3 miles (5 km) from the city centre. It has two large Victorian-era parks: Eastville Park and Vassall's Park (once the Vassall Family estate, also known as Oldbury Court).  It is quite a diverse area and is becoming ever more popular with house buyers as an up and coming area.  There are plenty of supermarkets and restaurants to choose from on Fishponds high street and the amazing Star pub just a stone's throw away... a mecca for Irish folk musicians.
host_about:
Guy is a Bristol based youth and community worker interested in art, music and cycling.
Bliss is an glass blower, gardener and community worker. We are friendly and fun hosts always willing to help where we can.

name: Townhouse in Bristol · ★4.81 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
The neighbourhood is friendly and welcoming; most houses are Victorian like mine, but the ones opposite are old miners cottages from the 1860's.

Much of community life centres around Victoria Park which is a large lovely green space at the end of my road. It has a children's play area, a lovely little café that you can dash to for bacon sarnies in the morning and great views across Bristol.

There are several fantastic local pubs serving food ranging from relaxed pie and mash to a mediaeval banquet style food, or wood fired pizza's. Most guests experience the wonderfully friendly local 'The Windmill' at least once.

There is a city farm a few minutes walk away as well and a meander into the centre of Bristol takes you through the park and you can choose to go easily along the harbourside to see the best of beautiful Bristol.
host_about: I am pretty laid back, enjoy meeting new people and having my house lived in by anyone who comes to stay, love being out in the wilds with a tent or out walking, swing dance fanatic, and nearly always have a good Malbec open. Love a good unicorn! I work in the charity and childcare sector.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.67 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
From the house you can walk out into the Frome Valley where you can often see herons, kingfishers and if you are lucky foxes, badgers or even an otter! Take a stroll around the lake in Eastville Park where there are tennis courts and play areas for the children. You can walk or cycle to the vibrant and multicultural Easton, up to the leafy village of Frenchay or through the valley to Fishponds.
There is also a corner shop at the bottom of the road and a Tesco a 10 minute walk away.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Clare and I live here with my big family where we enjoy the countywide whilst being only a short distance from the centre of Bristol.  This is a family home and not a dedicated Air band b property and as such is full of everything you would expect from a home with kids and pets - the fixtures, fittings and decor are not new but they are clean and well loved! We want you to feel at home and encourage you to read our books, watch our DVDs, play with our toys and ride our bikes!  If there is anything you need just ask and I will try to help.  
We hope you enjoy our home as much as we do!

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.90 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Lively, vibrant, arty neighbourhood.
Short walking distance from many independent shops, restaurants, cafes and pubs.
host_about: I love living in this vibrant, colourful area of Bristol, Montpelier. This is a perfect place for entertaining friends and family. I hope you enjoy staying here as much as I enjoy living here!

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.98 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: At the rear of my house is a children's play park, great for runs or walks. There is also a wooded area (Baydocks Wood) 2 minute walk from house, lovely for walks, runs or just a peaceful place to sit and relax. Local shops and take away's are within a 5 minute walk and there is a gym yards away from the house. A 15 minute walk takes you into Westbury-on-Trym village where there are places to eat and a nice pub.
host_about: I enjoyed my career as a Youth Worker for 37 years and retired  3 years ago, this is when I become an Airbnb host.  I have a partner Richard and family of 3 children and 8 grandchildren and love family get togethers. I enjoy the simple pleasures in life like cooking and gardening, I also like to go swimming when I can. I like helping others and would do my best to make sure your visit to my house is as comfortable as is possible.

name: Home in Easton · ★4.85 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
A friendly, vibrant and community-minded neighbourhood, Easton is a an exciting place to live. There's always something going on.

We recommend visiting these local independents to make the most of your stay in Easton:

No12 - for breakfast/brunch/coffee
East Bristol Bakery - for great bread and pastries!
Sweetmart - for grocery shopping.
Thali Cafe - for a coffee or dinner.
The Greenbank Pub - for a drink and/or dinner.
Easton Community Centre - for coffee / lunch and to experience the local community.
The Plough - for a Sunday roast.
host_about:
I'm a keen cyclist and live in Easton, Bristol with my girlfriend, Heidi. We have a cat called Lola. Together we offer a welcoming house and advice on interesting things to do in Bristol, especially those that are off the beaten track.

We have both lived in other places, including Spain, but returned to Bristol as we like it so much! We can give you a real flavour of what the city is like so you can experience it as a local.

If you enjoy cycling like us, why not bring your bike and we can provide you with cycling advice and route suggestions, extending across the city and as far as Somerset and Gloucestershire.

name: Townhouse in Bristol · ★4.75 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Our home is next to the beautiful Eastville Park and if you like walking you could walk all the way along the Frome Valley into the Cotswolds and beyond! Easy access from the M4 and M5 via the M32 which is a few minutes drive from our house (J2). Great for access to UWE (esp Glenside) by car, bike or bus.
host_about:
Favourites today include:
Books - anything by Janet Evanovitch
Films - anything by Tarantino
Music - anything by Ane Brun
Food - anything middle eastern
Theatre - anything at all

Tomorrow my favourites may have changed.....

My style of being a host is relaxed. I have lived in Bristol for 32 years and know it inside out. I can tell you all about it or leave you in peace to explore. You are welcome to share with the family or stay well away! 

Life motto? We only have one so make the most of it.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.87 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1.5 baths

host_about: We love living in Bristol because its such a vibrant city with music, theatre, festivals and great restaurants.  But we also cross the Clifton Suspension bridge as often as we can and get out into the country.   We love the country as much as we love city life.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.91 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Guest suite in Bristol · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Prime conservation area with good access to shops, bars and world renowned amenities.
Tree lined roads with many notable Victorian, stone mansions.

The area is adjacent to the Avon Gorge, Sneyd Park nature reserve and Durdham and Clifton Downs. Plenty for walkers/cyclists to explore. Local church and shops.

Within walking distance are Clifton Village, and Clifton Downs - a large grassy open area between here. Also, the Avon Gorge, with grazing goats, and Sneyd Park Nature reserve with a small lake, ducks etc.
Vantage points, Brandon Hill and Cabot Tower are a short No.4 bus ride away. The bus also takes you to Queens Road where the RWA art gallery, Bristol Museum and the Wills Building are located. Also to the Hippodrome, near the waterfront and Kings Street where you can find the Bristol Old Vic, old pubs with live music and open air seating. Further on in walking distance are The Watershed, Millenium Square with its big wheel, science museum, aquar

name: Townhouse in Bristol · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are very close to many shops, bars and restaurants. The County cricket ground is a 20 minute walk away, the Bristol Rovers Memorial Ground is a 10 minute walk away, Horfield sports centre and Southmead Hospital are a 20 minute walk away.
Bristol city center is a 20 min bus journey or drive going south, Abbeywood MOD and Aztec West are an easy bus journey or short drive north, as is Cribbs causeway shopping mall.
host_about:
I am a health practitioner working P/T in Bristol. 
We have lived in this area over thirty years and have family locally. 
We find ourselves in a lovely house with space to spare and share with guests. 
We consider ourselves environmentally aware, we turn lights off and recycle as much as possible.
We expect guests to do the same, with our help.. 
Some of our energy is produced by our solar panels.
We must ask guests to be quiet after 11.00 pm

Discover unusual shops, great pubs, real clubs, fabulous food and a wealth of artist studios and ever-changing exhibitions.

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.88 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
