There are 3 pubs within 3 minutes walk, fish'n Chip shop, two Indian Restaurants, 3 other restaurants including a Michelin star restaurant 'Wilks'.  There is a Corner shop, bakery and Grocers. Whiteladies Road is 5 minutes walk and the BBC 15 minute walk or 5 minute bike ride.

name: Townhouse in Bristol · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
We live a short walk from Bristol Temple Meads station in a modern clean 3 storey townhouse in the Cosmopolitan suburb of Totterdown.
Totterdown is a very colourful and vibrant suburb of Bristol, Famous for the wonderful painted housed and its very own Arts Trail weekend in November.
Our home benefits from the most amazing views over the City.

Easy access to local shops including an Italian restaurant, Florence, Vegetarian restaurant/cafe - Sundial, Vegan restaurant - Eat your Greens, Acapella Pizza restaurant, The Star & Dove bar and restaurant, Bank Cocktail Bar, The Shakespeare, The Oxford, Southside Bar & Kitchen, Truffled, The Victoria Park and award winning Fish & Chips from Farrows.

Totterdown also has other wonderful eateries within easy reach, which we're happy to recommend. Wapping Wharf is a complex of shipping container restaurants and is only a 20 minute walk away along the river.

For groceries, Tesco and Co-op are a very short w
host_about: We're an easy going married professional couple with a gorgeous Cockapoo, Monty. We love the city of Bristol and are keen to share it with our visitors. We love walks with the dog, music and socialising.... Particular favourites are a good Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc and a gin and tonic or two. We love to socialise with guests, but also completely understand if you just want a room and don't necessarily want to engage, the separate living room is perfect if you want your own space. We love our unique house overlooking Bristol with a fab city garden. It's a town house so you never feel on top of each other which makes the accommodation feel quite private. We love to welcome guests from all over the world.

name: Townhouse in Bristol · ★5.0 · 5 bedrooms · 6 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Our house is in the middle of a close-knit community within the larger city - we have the best of both worlds, green space and peace outside our windows, with easy access to the city centre, University, BBC, theatres, City football ground, station, airport and wider open spaces at Ashton Court and the Downs (all within 15 minutes in the car).
Bristol is a perfect base for visiting the wider south western area (Bath, Tintern, Stonehenge) and Wales.
Be aware that the house is on a steep hill and access is essentially on foot - while you can park one car at the house, there is an element of walking involved, and the footpaths surrounding our little oasis are ancient and charming but they are also hilly and involve some steep steps and climbs (both up and down!). We recommend you park outside the residents' parking zone if you have more than one car. If you’re just here for the weekend we can provide residents’ parking vouchers for another car for £4 a day.
host_about:
We're a busy, active family of two lawyers, two children (post-university age) and a lively (10 year old) working cocker spaniel. Both keen skiers and open water swimmers, Anne is a runner and Iain a mountain-biker. There are more bikes in the garage than people in the house ... 
PS it’s ‘iain’, not ‘Lain’!

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.90 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The best of both worlds:
5 minutes walk from lively Clifton Village, the jewel in Bristol's crown, with its many cafes, restaurants and shops, its Georgian architecture, and its famous suspension bridge (about 10 minutes walk). In the other direction it is about 15 minutes walk to Bristol harbourside, with restaurants and museums; the Theatre Royal and the main shopping centre are not much further. We are about 10-15 minutes walk from the University of Bristol and the BBC. The BRI is about 20 minutes.
The flat gives onto a green, peaceful garden with plenty of wildlife: badgers, foxes, bats, birds...

name: Home in Bristol City · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: Clay Bottom is not a cut though so is very quiet… joins on allotments and cycle path, very green, lovely neighbours!

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.76 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
I love the convenience and ease of getting into Bristol.
You can walk to Temple Meads in 20 mins or into town along a lovely bike path that runs along the river or jump on a bus and 4 stops later you can be at the Harbourside. There is a large Sainsburys 5 mins walk away and a 24 hr garage opposite where you can buy milk and other bits out of hours. There are numerous fast food chains nearby such as KFC, Burger King, McDonald's and Pizza Hut. A little further around the corner is a Marks and Spencer's, Boots, Dunkin Donughts and a Showcase Cinema.
If you keep left and walk for 5 mins you will come to Arnos Vale cemetery which is very historic and houses a tomb of a famous Maharajah. It also has a nice cafe! Opposite there is the Paintworks which is a centrally located creative hub with its own open plan Bar/restaurant Bocabar, who do excellent Cocktails, pizzas an one of my favourite breakfasts in Bristol (open 7 days a week).
host_about:
Hi worldly travellers, I’m Jason a restaurant and bar owner from Bristol. 
I love to travel and have holiday homes in Devon and Ibiza. I've been a Airbnb host for since 2016 and really enjoy hosting my places and meeting people from all over the world.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to the most brilliant part of Bristol. We are situated on a street that is slap bang between Brandon Hill park and Park Street. Both are a huge fifteen second walk away!

Brandon Hill is a wonderful place from which to watch the International Hot Air Balloon Fiesta, an open air production of Shakespeare, or just have a walk through its waterfalls, woodland and meadow. There's a playground too and the paths lead you all the way down to the river Avon and the centre of town.

Park Street is a shopper's paradise. There are plenty of independent clothing stores (Kushty, BS8, The Guild) amongst the big names (Cath Kidson, Whistles, Jigsaw), indy record shops, and the original Boston Tea Party coffee shop on the corner of our street. There are plenty of wonderful bakeries, cafes, restaurants, and the great Bristol Museum is over the road.

The harbour and its markets, the Aquarium, Colston Hall, the SS Great Britain, the Watershed cinema, @Bristol
host_about:
I'm Jess and I live with my husband, Sam, our three children, and my mother-in-law... who is also the landlady!  This is her home, and it will be yours too for the duration of your stay.  You will find it to be a most beautiful and magical place to spend time.

This is an open home and we are artists, designers, musicians, cooks, travellers, and writers. The house is a reflection of our creativity and lust for life.

As a family, Sam and I took the children back-packing through Europe and Airbnb was a fantastic way to stay in wonderful places on our shoestring budget.  Now it's our turn to return the favour to others.  We love meeting new people, and welcome you and your stories to fill our home.  

As hosts, we can be on hand if you'd like a hands-on experience, or we'll leave you alone if you'd like some space!

I can recommend a variety of great places to eat or drink, both locally and further afield.

I respect diversity, everyone is welcome here in my home - all I ask is that you treat it well. name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.79 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
From bars on boats to art galleries in former toilets, there is a thriving independent spirit in the city that gave the world both Banksy and Wallace & Gromit, and even invented Ribena. If you needed any further convincing, here’s why it’s great to visit Bristol:
12 reasons Bristol is the best city in the UK

1. Its independent spirit: Gloucester Road must have more independent shops than any other street in the UK. When Tesco announced they would be opening on nearby Cheltenham Road, there was a riot. We even have an independent mayor and our own currency, the Bristol Pound.

2. Of all of the best facts about Bristol – that Nipper the HMV dog lived here, that it was actually a voyage from Bristol led by John Cabot and not Christopher Columbus that discovered America – Ribena being invented in the city is the best of the lot.

3. We were the UK’s first Cycling City. Bristol may have a hill around every corner but that doesn’t stop the thousands of peo

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: Easton is a very community-spirited and international part of the city to live in. St Marks Road, the main high street, boasts the Sweetmart supermarket, with exotic foods from all over the world, especially (but not only) Asian cuisine. There is the Thali cafe, Eastern taste Indian restaurant, a Moroccan restaurant, and the Easton Bakery, as well as a pharmacy, aladdins cave hardware store and the Church cafe. There are cafes popping up all over Easton, and on Chelsea Road itself there is a mosque, a sikh temple, the community centre, the Plough pub and the Chelsea Inn!!!

I have travelled to India many times, Senegal, Morocco and the Gambia, Colombia and Venezuela, Italy for 5 summers, in Salento,  Australia and New Zealand.  I love conscious roots reggae music, old and new, in any language as long as it's upbeat and positive! I Iike cooking and eating healthy and tasty(spicey) food! As a host I will gage what you want or need, so if that's space and privacy, that's what you'll get, and if you would like some advice or a chat you may well also get them! neighborhood_overview: This is a lovely quiet, leafy suburb of Bristol, but an easy 40 minute walk to the city centre. Locally we've got the best pizza restaurant - Acapella's - worth booking a table, or just getting take out! Also an amazing corner shop - Star Value. We also have a shopping centre - Broadwalk. Victoria Park, Redcatch Park and Perrott's Park are on your doorstep so it's easy to get out and about. The views from Perrott's over the city are worth seeing.

name: Condo in Bristol · ★4.90 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The Gloucester Rd is a few steps away and we are lucky enough to have some of the best restaurants and gastro pubs nearby. It is the longest road of independent shops in Europe and has a really good selection including a couple of good supermarkets within 5 mins walk, as well as bakers, butchers, fishmongers, greengrocers, gift shops, clothes shops, health food, delis etc. There are also some great retro, vintage and charity shops.

There is a Congestion Zone charge for some cars in the centre. We are not in that zone but do be aware if you are driving here with a non compliant car.

The flat is a short walk away from Gloucester Cricket Club which hosts local, national and international matches. There is a great blog about all the lovely places to eat locally in the flat too. We can send the link if you'd like to plan!
host_about: I sell mid century furniture and homeware and I love living in Bristol.  I enjoy all the theatre, art and culture that the city has to offer.  I love the food scene in Bristol so have plenty of local information regarding markets and restaurants.  I also enjoy the fact that we have some of the best arts centres in the country and a fabulous local independent neighbourhood.

Our flat is on a beautiful crescent in the heart of vibrant Clifton village, with its wonderful shops, cafes and restaurants. It is in a conservation area; the crescent is Georgian and has beautiful views south to the Mendip Hills.
Clifton Suspension Bridge - 7 minute walk
Bristol University - 10 minute walk
Bristol Zoo - 10 minute walk
Clifton College - 10 minute walk
Clifton Lido - 10 minute walk

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.58 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
Condo in Bristol · ★4.85 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Old Market is one of the most historic areas of the city. It was the first part of the city to be built around the castle and today is a thriving bohemian shopping quarter in Bristol.

Old Market has a great selection of shops including vintage and antique stores, as well as more contemporary shops. There are also several pubs and bars throughout the area and it is also known for its LGBT-friendly venues. Highlights of the area include The Trinity Centre (2 mins) and Old Market Assembly (4mins). The architecture throughout Old Market is impressive and varied.

The flat is a 15 minute walk from Temple Meads Train station, 10 minute walk from Cabot Circus (a popular shopping district) and 10 minute walk from Castle Park, which you can walk through to get to the City Centre.

neighborhood_overview:
My neighbourhood contains beautiful period properties, is near to two parks and on a hill overlooking Bristol. There are some fantastic (award winning Thali Cafe and Bell's Diner) restaurants, bars and cafes nearby on Gloucester Road/Stokes Croft, and in neighbouring Montpelier and St Werburghs. St Werburghs city farm/ cafe and pub come art gallery are all a 10 minute walk down the hill. People are really friendly and helpful around here and there is a great arts scene - with life drawing in a cafe nearby on a monday evening if you fancy sketching.

I'm only a stroll from the gloucester road cafes/restaurants and bars - less than 10 minutes. A bit more boho is Montpelier with the nearby award winning Thali cafe.

The Bristol harbour side with summer festivals, galleries, museums and science centres is 20 minute walk or a quick bus ride.

Keep your eye out for amazing street art murals - there are a few Banksy paintings about the place.

There a
host_about: A keen ecologist, teacher, videographer and adventurer. Our home in St Andrews is a retreat for us - quiet and spacious, combining modern technology (WIFI, Smart TV, central heating) with our love of retro furniture and art. The back of the flat overlooks our garden and Bristol city (as I'm atop a hill) and is extremely tranquil. Yet out the front we can leave our front door and be in central Bristol in under 10 minutes. There are plenty of local bars, award winning restaurants, deli's, and cafes here. Stokes Croft and its vibrant night life, or Gloucester Road ( longest independent high street in Europe) are less than a 10 minute walk. As a new Mum I can also attest to the many great spaces and places for babies and young children in Bristol. If you are planning a family trip message me and I can fill you in. Hope you enjoy Bristol whilst you are here as much as we do :D

neighborhood_overview:
>

A quiet, prime conservation area, with many notable stone, Victorian mansions, gated homes & tree lined roads. We are adjacent to the large expanse of the Clifton Downs with dramatic views of Avon Gorge & the Clifton Suspension Bridge (3 mins walk away) Yet still close to the central hub of Bristol City Centre which is 10 mins away via car/taxi. Lots of bars & restaurants 5 mins via car/taxi/No 4 Bus - Close but without all the city noise - Foxes, badgers & numerous wildlife visit our very secluded garden - Which your very welcome to enjoy with a glass of wine - (We currently have a Robin nesting in bush directly outside your apartment)
host_about:
I've lived in Bristol for many years now & absolutely love it. It's perfectly situated to get quickly to Devon, Cornwall, Dorset, Somerset & Wales. There are glorious walks to go on from Bristol into the Mendip Hills or the Brecon Beacons. Bristol has a very lively art, music & theatre culture & a range of first class restaurants. My particular passions are spending time with family, going to the theatre, walking in the countryside, keeping fit, cooking, eating with friends & meeting new people. 

I live in a very peaceful area, yet very close to Clifton's bustling Whiteladies Rd & not far from a variety of other great places to visit.

Looking forward to meeting new guests : )

Lots of local events throughout the year including Upfest international Graffiti art festival , Art on the Hill, Bristol Harbour Festival and Balloon Festival . In the summer you are welcome to sit in our beautiful garden with breathtaking views of the city and watch the balloons go over . The Tobacco Factory is a thriving arts centre / theatre and holds a Sunday market with veg stalls , local food and craft stalls. It takes max 20 minutes to walk to the Bristol docks ( Mshed - great for families , a wealth of cafes and bars / quirky shops ) from our house or walk into town where there are lots of shops and historical indoor market St Nicks.
3 minutes to Bedminster station with link to Temple Meads Mainline station . So you can leave your car and take a stroll to explore all that Bristol has to offer .

Bristol is a vibrant, multicultural city. Greenbank / Easton is a famously alternative area of Bristol, culturally diverse and with a great community. It is well known for Saint Mark's Road, a short street with restaurants, takeaways, artisan bakery and the renowned Sweetmart Supermarket which has everything you would ever need.

This is an inner city area, so there is graffiti, scruffy streets, etc. For green space, there is Eastville Park is within walking distance, or Greenbank Cemetery minutes up the road.

a very strong community. My road is a 1930's Cul de sac there's a mixture of people who have lived on the road, some for many years, and young families who have recently moved in.

The house backs onto green spaces and walks, is 10 minutes from an inner city farm and 20 inner city organic small holding.

host_about:
Born in Swansea, South Wales, I moved to London to train as a dancer many years ago, since then I've worked in the arts  and community sectors  all my life.

 I moved to Bristol 30 years ago and love it more each year!

Currently I work for a small Arts on Prescription organisation based in Gloucester.

I enjoy travel (self catering style), meeting folk, camping, cold water swimming, walking, gardening and a laugh. I'm a pescatarian.

The house has solar panels & I use eco products as much as I can.  I have a cat, Chomsky.

I've always worked with a wide range of people, I'm used to and enjoy living in shared housing  & have done  for most of my adult life.  I  currently have a full time lodger as well.

I'd say I'm warm, friendly, respectful and informal.

I'd like you to enjoy your time in Bristol.

host_about:
Hello ! Although my husband and I have lived in Bristol for 30 years we have strong ties with this part of South Devon as I was born here and still have family in the area  . We started being Airbnb hosts when our kids went to University. We let out a room in our house in Bristol and really enjoyed meeting people and trying our best to make their stay relaxing and enjoyable. Cove Cottage is in a beautiful spot and we would like to offer folks the chance to stay and enjoy some holiday time in our favourite neck of the woods !I teach in a secondary school pretty much full time so life is always busy. My husband is a fundraiser in The NHS . We love Bristol but also love having the chance to get away to Devon when we can. We think it's a great idea to 'share homes' so that people have so much choice about where they stay and the experience it offers. We used to travel a lot and had great adventures in Asia and South America. Life with a large family and work means we don't manage that sort of thing but when we do get away we really enjoy an authentic experience.
We really hope people will enjoy their stay in either of the two locations or even combine the two !

name: Townhouse in Bristol · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview:
Totterdown has been rated one of the five funkiest places to live in Britain. There are pretty coloured houses, murals, parks and plenty of good local food outlets including a Moroccan restaurant and two good pizza restaurants - all very cheap! Some of the pubs have music and there is an excellent vegetarian / vegan cafe as well as fish and chip shop and local Tesco supermarket within 5 minutes walk.
Bristol generally is very cool and relaxed - well known for its music scene and pleasant dockside areas with lots of great places to eat.
host_about: I am a poet with two pretty gardens you can sit in, a calm and philosophical attitude and amazing views across the city. My home is in Totterdown,  a quiet area with shops and cafes and bars, close (15 minutes walk) to the city centre. I'm friendly and pretty relaxed - I like people. I like people who'll respect my home even more! As I've travelled quite a bit and lived in other countries, I've always enjoyed learning about other cultures. Nature is what I wouldn't want to live without.

name: Townhouse in City of Bristol · ★4.93 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview: Totterdown is apparently one of the 5 coolest 😁and best places to live in the UK - very pretty, full of artists and a diverse community. It's 10 minutes walk from Temple Meads and about 20 mins walk to centre of town. There are nearby pubs and very reasonably priced restaurants/bars (Moroccan - Assilah,  Italian - Florence, Eat your Greens - vegan and also Bocabar, Banco Lounge and Accapella) and a fab bakers shop which sells proper sourdough, pastries and cakes within 10 mins walk. A Tesco metro has all the usual supermarket stuff including ready meals, and a great green grocer also within 10 mins walk. There's a huge park nearby too.  Bus stop is 3 mins from my house.

neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.97 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
Southville is an amazing place to visit offering a perfect blend of historic charm and modern energy , with lots of bars, restaurants and cafes just a one minute walk away.

With the famous Tobacco Factory Theatre at its heart, you'll find plenty of cultural experiences right on your doorstep. Explore the local shops, indulge in artisanal cuisine at the trendy North Street, or take a leisurely stroll along the scenic Harbourside.

Southville is also a short walk from Bristol's city center, making it an ideal base for exploring all that Bristol has to offer.

The town centre is only a 25 minute walk or you can hire a scooter from not far away.
host_about:
I love living in Bristol and in Southville. It’s so close to the city and then green green hills for me and my dog Walter to mooch about on!
I work for the Royal Institute of British Architects but I’m not an architect! 
I am in the long process of renovating the house, and enjoy decorating (but NOT painting ceilings!) and have an allotment too, so you may be leaving with a bunch of carrots in your bag!

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.73 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located one of Bristol's oldest lanes, which we call our terrace. We share our terrace with Horts Pub, which can occasionally get busy. However we have a very good relationship with our neighbour Horts and noise is kept to a minimum at all times, with all guests being called in at 10.30pm.
host_about:
Director of an Event Management Agency in Central Bristol. 

Travelling is my passion, my favourite countries are India, Sri Lanka, Morocco and Brazil. Favourite Cities are New York, London, Madrid, Barcelona and Rio de Janeiro.

I have an eclectic taste of music including Electronic, Dance, Pop and Indie.

Free human with a great love for this life and all the creatures I meet along the way. 
I eat plants, I make music and film...and I dance!

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.92 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
Home in Bristol · ★4.86 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: My house is situated in Fishponds, a short (10-15 min) drive from the town centre. the road itself is very quiet and parking is usually available outside, free 7 days a week. Local shops are less than 2 mins walk.
host_about: Hi, I'm Nick and I have lived in Bristol since 2009. My house is an Edwardian terrace, full of character, with a fireplace in every room and wooden floorboards throughout. It's spacious, comfortable and within 15 minutes of the town centre (by bus or car) and is close to the Bristol cycle path. It's also located on a quiet street with very little traffic and has a large garden, with local shops a 2 minute walk away.

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.87 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
Home in Bristol · ★4.91 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · Shared half-bath
neighborhood_overview:
We're part of an inner city village of three roads connected by back lanes and
a very strong community. My road is a 1930's Cul de sac there's a mixture of people who have lived on the road, some for many years, and young families who have recently moved in.

The house backs onto green spaces and walks, is 10 minutes from an inner city farm and 20 inner city organic small holding.

There are local shops, including a mini organic supermarket.
host_about:
Born in Swansea, South Wales, I moved to London to train as a dancer many years ago, since then I've worked in the arts  and community sectors  all my life.

 I moved to Bristol 30 years ago and love it more each year!

Currently I work for a small Arts on Prescription organisation based in Gloucester.

I enjoy travel (self catering style), meeting folk, camping, cold water swimming, walking, gardening and a laugh. I'm a pescatarian.

The house has solar panels & I use eco products as much as I can.  I have a cat, Chomsky.

I've always worked with a wide range of people, I'm used to and enjoy living in shared housing  & have done  for most of my adult life.  I  currently have a full time lodger as well.

I'd say I'm warm, friendly, respectful and informal.

I'd like you to enjoy your time in Bristol.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.84 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
A nice area to live - a quiet street in a vibrant interesting historic city.
Bristol has lots to offer - loads of lovely restaurants, Bristol university and University of the West of England (UWE), cycle routes, green space, a harbour. Its easy to travel to Bristol - M4 , M5 , 1.5 hrs by rail from London, an airport, plenty of buses. My home is close to Bristol Rovers Football Ground and Gloucestershire County Cricket ground - both walking distance. We also have Bristol Rugby and Bristol City football in the city.
host_about:
I'm self employed and working from home so I'm around quite a bit and happy to assist my guests. I love to cook and have a new kitchen - very exciting!
Am a cyclist and enjoy DIY and patchwork and watching rugby. I have a large garden so I must surely enjoy gardening!! I have 2 grown up children so I'm used to children of all ages and I've been involved in Girlguiding most of my life.

Other large employers  - Airbus, MOD, Rolls Royce are close by bus and also UWE and Bristol University. Our historic city is a great place to explore with lots going on. We have green space nearby and also a public gym /swimming pool. Cycling popular in the city - bring your bike or cycle from the station.

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.32 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.79 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Clifton is renowned for having some of the most iconic spots in Bristol, including Brunel’s famous Suspension Bridge, the Observatory and Bristol Zoo.

If you’re looking for somewhere brimming with things to do and see, come and explore the fascinating things the neighbourhood has to offer, from events, dining experiences and retail outlets to must-see gardens, beautiful walks and secret hideaways.

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.40 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Clifton and the Whiteladies Road area of Bristol are packed with shops, restaurants, bars and cafes. We're slightly biased but it's one of the most lovely neighbourhoods in the city. You can also easily walk to Bristol Zoo and Durdham Downs from the apartment. If you're in Bristol for business we are ideally located for the Bristol Spire Hospital, Simply Health (AXA PPP) and The BBC.
host_about:
Hi! We’re Rhian and Will, the perfect blend of West Country guy meets South Wales girl. We got married 4 years ago and since then have been keeping ourselves busy with two kids, a hyper-active dog and a house renovation!

Our home on Grove Road was in need of some serious TLC when we took it on. It had been converted into offices back in the 1950’s and transforming it into a home suitable for family-living was no small task, especially at it’s a Listed Building with lots of beautiful features. The main house is currently rented out as it makes more sense for us to live closer to Rhian’s parents in Monmouth for now, however we kept the basement separate to use as a crash-pad. The reality is we haven’t managed to use it much and it’s a great space, so we thought why not try Airbnb? 

As we’re not currently living in Bristol and want our guests to have access to 24hr assistance we’ve asked the lovely people at Air 360 to manage it for us who are more than happy to help with anything that you might need.

We hope you will love the Studio as much as we do! It’s a fantastic base from which to explore Bristol.

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.86 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This is a lovely residential neighbourhood which is surprisingly quiet with its close proximity to the city centre.

Recommendations and the Local Area

•There is a small corner shop just a 2-minute walk from the flat. Perfect for any small amenities. Its called, Monica’s, on Cotham Road South.

•If you are looking for more there is a small supermarket called, The Co-Operative. It’s a 5-minute walk located on St Michaels Hill Road. You will also find some nice local pubs, bars and cafes along this street.

•To do a large shop there are two different Sainsbury’s, one on the triangle and the other on Whiteladies road.

•There is a Gym around the corner from the flat called, Everyone Active. They allow people to buy day passes for just £3 per day and have a good selection of walk-in classes.

Restaurants

•Areas such as, Clifton Village, White Ladies Road, The Triangle and Gloucester Road are best known for their sele
host_about:
When traveling, I love the freedom and authentic experience that staying in an Airbnb gives you. It has always been my first choice of accommodation when my wife and I have explored many different regions around the World.

Another passion of ours developing old properties in a way that brings out the natural features, while adding stylish touches and modern day comforts. We have done this across Bath, Bristol and the Cotswolds. Each property has its own story and we are very happy to share this with anyone that would like to stay with us.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.90 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths

There are cafes and restuarants from all over the world i nthe Gloucester Road,  Clifton the Georgian part of the city is a 30 minute walk.
host_about: I'm a retired social science teacher and used to work for the Open University.  I love gardening and singing .i enjoy telling people about my beautiful city. I'm a grandmother and my grandchildren live in London and Leeds. I look forward to sharing my home with visitors.

The property is in a vibrant residential area of Bedminster, within close walking distance to the Harbourside & everywhere central!
You really don't need to get in the car as most places central are within walking distance.

Just over Gaol Ferry Bridge & onto the Harbourside, there's the new Cargo area, SS Great Britain, M shed, Bristol hippodrome, @ Bristol, Bristol cathedral, Cabot circus, Queens Square, Welsh Back & King Street, St Nicolas Market etc.
In the local area of North Street there are plenty of independent cafes, restaurants shops.
Bus stops & Supermarkets all close by.
South Bristol Victorian swimming pool at the end of the road, only 2 minutes walk away.
The Tobacco factory Theatre, Bar & Sunday market is just a walk down the vibrant North street.

name: Bungalow in Bristol · ★4.90 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Our cosy bungalow is nestled at the end of a quiet cul-de-sac on a residential estate. There are public transport links enabling access to all areas of the city as well as surrounding towns and villages such as Bath and Clevedon on the main road just 5 minutes from the house. The beautiful area of Clifton, along with the famous Clifton Suspension Bridge is just a short distance from the bungalow. We're situated in between Westbury-On-Trym and Henleaze where you'll find a good selection of shops and restaurants, including an authentic, family run Italian, Indian and Thai, all offering Eat In or Take Out options. There's also a good selection of pubs, most offering a range of excellent food to suit all tastes and budgets. There're just a few houses between us and a restricted wildlife reserve and we have parks and woodlands, just a stone through away from the house.
There's everything you need in the immediate vicinity to enjoy a relaxing, stress free quality of life, with all the a

name: Home in Bedminster · ★4.88 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
A stones throw from creative North Street, you will have easy access to great independent restaurants, shops and bars.
The iconic Bristol harbourside is just a short walk away as well, along with the variety of museums and galleries our city has to offer.

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.68 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The property is on a quiet, residential street but only a few minutes' walk away from vibrant Whiteladies Road with its brilliant selection of shops, restaurants, cafes and bars. Even closer are Cotham Hill and Chandos Road, which are known for their focus on independent retail (food, drink and shopping!) and are therefore firm favourites with Bristolians. It is also just a 15 minute walk away from the Downs, a beautiful, green open space with superb views over the Avon Gorge. Clifton Lido - a real hidden gem of the city - and Clifton Village are only between 15-20 minutes' walk away.

The closest small shop / newsagent is Costcutter, Chandos Rd - just a few minutes’ walk away - or the petrol station on Hampton Road. The closest supermarket is Sainsbury’s in Clifton Down Shopping Centre.
host_about: Welcome!

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.74 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Redland together with Clifton are probably the nicest parts of Bristol to live in. With its tree lined streets, parks and large Victorian and Georgian houses it has a wonderful character. However it still is close to all the amenities you may need and sights you will want to see whilst visiting. Just around the corner from the flat on Whiteladies Road are number of friendly restaurants, such as the Boston Tea Party, The Townhouse or the Cowshed  with good breakfast, lunch and dinner menus. There are many more restaurants and pubs just around the corner on Cotham Hill, but the immediate environment of the flat is quiet and homely. My particular favourites are the Highbury Vaults pub on St Michael's Hill, just up the Cotham Hill and to the right, The Lido restaurant close by in Clifton (open) and the River Cottage Restaurant on Whiteladies Road (closed at the moment). Clifton Down Shopping Centre is within 5 minutes walking distance with a Sainsbury's supermarket, Pharmacy and other  use
host_about: I love Art, travel, good food,people and my work as a designer architect... For my leisure I keep fit swimming and gymming, I love sailing, skiing when I can find the time and try to enjoy life as much as possible in hopefully healthy way. When travelling I prefer to do it not as a tourist but try to imagine what it is like to live in the place... I have lived in Prague, London, Hong Kong, Dubai and for the past 12 years in Shanghai... and travelled extensively in Europe, US, Middle East, Asia and SE Asia. I have stayed in apartments through Airbnb  and have had a great experience of the city this way. My permanent home is Bristol, the city I always love to return to from my travels.

name: Home in Bristol · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Fishponds is still a little bit of a best kept secret in Bristol, just up the road from the diverse and vibrant Easton it is has all of the real Bristol but a bit more tranquil. We have an amazing cycle route which runs from Bath to Bristol city centre which is on the old train line and like an amazing secret vein that can take you right into the heart of the City in no time at all. There are lovely cafes (The Porto lounge) and pubs Snuffy Jacks micro pub and The Star are our favourites. There is also the wonderful Frome valley walkway that again is like a little bit of heaven in the City, we are happy to point you in the direction of the river walk and furnish you with a map if you should need it.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.99 · 2 bedrooms · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths

We love walks with the dog, music and socialising.... Particular favourites are a good Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc and a gin and tonic or two. We love to socialise with guests, but also completely understand if you just want a room and don't necessarily want to engage, the separate living room is perfect if you want your own space. We love our unique house overlooking Bristol with a fab city garden. It's a town house so you never feel on top of each other which makes the accommodation feel quite private. We love to welcome guests from all over the world.

Hello we are Hopewell and welcome to our profile. We are dedicated to making sure you enjoy your stay in one of our many homes, be that in the city centre, Clifton or beyond.
We are here to help you enjoy your time with us and get the best out of what Bristol has to offer. 
Our team really has great knowledge of the area so please feel free to ask us any questions.  We are all really passionate about our great city, and are excited about others coming to explore all it has to offer.

We are experts in Airbnb which started from looking after our own properties, to friends, to the whole of Bristol and beyond.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.93 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview:
This is a very nice neighbourhood. It's close to various supermarkets and local shops, cafes, restaurants, theatre and comedy club. You can find live music most nights within easy walking distance. There's a Sunday market filled with local crafts, food and vintage stalls near Tobacco Factory (a theatre and a restaurant).

You can always stay in this neighbourhood (around North Street or Victoria Park), or spend your time in the centre and the Harbourside.

There is a new 'foodie' area near the Harbourside (Wapping Wharf) with organic supermarkets, and numerous cafes and bars. It's 20 mins walk from the house. There are some converted shipping containers that house a variety of fantastic eating locations (e.g. run by a Michelin starred chef and a BBC Masterchef finalist).

Although we are very close to the high streets, our road is very quiet.
host_about: I work in the user experience industry , currently live in Bristol. I love traveling, food and trying new things.

host_about:
A devoted yogini with a conflicted urban-rural divide! I grew up in London, now live in Bristol where we run Bristol City Yoga, and love the city life. Have enjoyed living in Wales, rural Ireland, Dorset and other beautiful, wild, dive into the river/sea spots in between. An avid cyclist, usually to be found peddling away, yoga-ing or hanging out with friends/ family including my son Madoc and Tinkerbelle the dog!

I love to explore the UK and the stunning subtle light, but also to get away in the winter (autumn, spring and summer!)

name: Home in England · ★4.98 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
There's a surprising amount of green space considering we're a mile from the centre with some lovely walks to be had. The park has a playground and we are a 10 minute walk from St werburghs City Farm with its EXCELLENT cafe (incredible coffee) and playground next door. We have an amazing butcher and baker called Popti & Beast on Mina Road with coffee to die for, and just down the road you'll find Undercover Rock - a climbing centre in the old St Werburghs church. There are also several very good pubs nearby: the Duke of York is a fantastic fave, and the Farm Pub is also good fun and often has live music, our local cafe Napolita does a great brunch and take aways, new restaurants and loads of arty things happening year round. If you just feel like staying in feel free to watch any of our 200+ DVDs and BluRays on our big telly that swings out so you can angle it for your perfect TV viewing needs!!

There is a post office, a corner shop and several delicious take outs literally

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.97 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Montpelier is an extremely colourful, laid back, foodie neighbourhood in the centre of Bristol.  With so much on our doorstep in terms of restaurants, cafes, green parks, music, late night clubs, and general... fun!
host_about:
Hi! I've been living in Bristol, on and off, for 13 years and still absolutely love it here.  Our house is down a quiet dead-end street in Montpelier, but only about 50 metres from the chaos and brilliance of Stokes Croft.  We're massively spoilt to be so close to such great music venues, pubs, galleries, fabulous cafes and restaurants and generally just so much exciting, inspiring energy!  

I used to love Bristol for it's incredible freedom and decedent party culture, and now, since having children, I love it even more for it's brilliant parks, museums, community centres and easy proximity to fields, forests and water.  

I feel really happy to share our home with others through airbnb and hope that the space and location will inspire lots of fun, warmth and comfort for those who stay here.  My husband and I designed and built our home in 2015 as a state of art eco home (super-insulted with mechanical ventilation, solar panels and underfloor heating).  We truly love it here and hope you will too.

name: Townhouse in Bristol · ★4.94 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
It is a quiet street with lots of families, just one minute from the bustling Gloucester road:
bestof bristol . co . uk /74-things-to-do-on-gloucester-road/
At the other end of the street is Horfield Common, a lovely park with cafe and tennis courts.
There is so much to see and do in Bristol, there are lots of festivals in the summer, there are theatres, the zoo, the aquarium. The harbourside area is fun to visit and you can do boat trips or visit the SS Great Britain or just stop for a drink and look at the boats!
visitbristol . co . uk

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.44 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
Rental unit in Redland · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Whilst the apartment is great, the location is even better. We're blessed with being just a couple of minutes walk from nearby Whiteladies Road with s magnitude of bars cafes and restaurants which cater for all tastes. Also on Whiteladies we have a couple of supermarkets, loads of high street shops and even a fancy cinema. Going in the other direction is Cotham with some lovely pubs and great places to eat. Seriously, there is an absolute plethora of things to do, see, eat or drink!

We're well connected too... Clifton Down Railway Station links up with Temple Meads. From the rail station you can link up to the airport using the express bus service. However, for those staying, most places are accessible by foot or using the bus service.

Distance to places of note

Whiteladies Road
Cotham Hill
Clifton Suspension Bridge
Cabot Circus
Clifton Down RW
Bristol Temple Meads RW
Bristol Airport
Cribbs Causeway Shopping Mall

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.65 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths

neighborhood_overview: My property is on Gloucester Road, which is a great part of the city to explore by foot. Gloucester Road runs all the way into Stokes Croft and then on to the city centre. If you are a food lover or want to browse a variety of independent shops this is the place for you. There are also many bars close by on the famous gloucester road and I can recommend a place depending on the type of night out you prefer if you get in touch.
host_about: Happy go lucky, born traveller, I love to laugh

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1.5 baths

My husband and I run one of Zimbabwe's top boutique hotels, Amanzi Lodge and Amanzi restaurant.  We also run several private houses in Harare, that we rent out to business guests and families on holiday.  Pevensey Studio, Pevensey House.   All our properties are 5 star and are rented in their entirety therefore giving guests privacy, security, and a home away from home.
We are enthusiastic about our business and love traveling to see our children in England.  Our passions are the garden, food and wine.

name: Houseboat in Bristol · ★4.98 · 9 bedrooms · 21 beds · 5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Moored on Wapping Wharf close to the SS Great Britain, M-Shed Museum and the trendy Bristol Cargo Quarter.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.96 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: We live in a residential area.
host_about:
We have been Scout Leaders for 30+ years and support the District team.  Our other hobbies:  I love walking, with friends or on my own - I have walked from Lands End to John O'Groats, Pennine Way, Pembrokeshire Coast Path, Two Moors Way, Coast to Coast; to name but a few.   I also love reading novels, fantasy, horror and auto-biographies.  I dream of completing any one of many knitting projects I have started.  My hubby, John enjoys building model boats and DIY.  He also loves reading,  historical novels and other books.  We both enjoy a wide variety of music from jazz to pop to classical.  We also enjoy a variety of food styles and dining out.  
My life motto would be - Always ask, as the answer is more often YES
John's life motto would be - Never give up

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.91 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath

A great location

There are so many great attractions within close proximity that it is impossible to list them all, but here are just a few that are within an easy walk, bike or bus. All of the places listed are within a 30-minute walk and many much closer. In addition to these attractions there are a great many restaurants and bars within a short walk. name: Home in Brislington · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.91 · 3 bedrooms · 5 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Gloucester Road is one of the longest continuous high streets in the UK, consisting of mostly independent shops. There is loads to explore; from yoga to Artisan Chocolate  and all the cool cafes, bakeries and bars in between. If you like to eat out during your stay you’ll be spoilt for choice! You can walk all the way into the centre of Bristol in about 25 mins depending on your pace (many will be much faster) and how many shops you amble into. There are very regular buses, with day passes from £4 so you can hop on and off, it is really easy to make the most of your stay. Bus stop a one minute walk from the flat
host_about: Im a Mum of two!  I love to travel, and am a lover of the great outdoors!  We spend many weekends in the summer months in our Campervan!

name: Home in Bristol · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: On the outskirts of Westbury on Trym, to the North West of Bristol’s commercial centre. It is ideal for the commuter, with easy access to London, the Midlands, South Wales and the South West via the M5 and M4. Bristol city centre and Parkway train station are a fifteen minute drive and only twenty minutes to Temple Meads train station. Bristol International airport is just 30 minutes away. The Mall shopping centre at Cribbs Causeway is a ten minute drive from the house. The picturesque village of Westbury on Trym is within walking distance and includes a plethora of shops, cafes, pubs, restaurants. Nearby there are health and leisure clubs, a golf course and acres of public parkland to explore in the nearby Blaise Castle and Kingsweston Estate.
host_about: I am a professional mum. I’m very friendly and sociable and can offer local advice on dining out, pubs, clubs, seasonal events, kid friendly activities. I can keep my distance and let you relax in private as much as I’m on hand to help! Just let me know your individual needs and I will be happy to accommodate.
neighbourhood: Bristol, Westbury on Trym, United Kingdom

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.82 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is steps away from a rich variety of vibrant restaurants, indie shops, and trendy cocktail bars of Bristol’s prime cultural neighborhood, Stokes Croft. Castle Park and the Bristol Shopping Quarter are within striking distance.

We love this area for its energy, vibe and proximity, you only have to cross the road for a great lunch or wild night out, where you'll find live bands to national DJ s.
You'll not want for anything as food, bars, 24hr convenience is all on your door step.
host_about:
We moved back to Bristol in 2013, and have really enjoyed living and working in Stokes Croft. Bristol's such a friendly, easy going city with a great creative vibe. 

We have fully renovated this property from a deserted derelict to our own flat, the rental flat we let on Airbnb, and our own art and gift shop. 

We now have a wonderful son and are able to enjoy the family aspects of the area now as well as its wonderful social side.

name: Home in Bristol · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
host_about: I moved to Bristol seven years ago, after living in the country for most of my life. I love the friendly atmosphere here, which I relate to as I'm friendly too. So many places to visit, watch or take part in, it's a great place.Cinema and theatre especially the Cube, Watershed, The Old Vic and Theatre Royal in Bath. Walking anywhere and everywhere. I enjoy sewing, gardening, drawing, DIY. reading, visiting galleries and museums.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.78 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Easton is the best of both worlds - all the convenience of inner city multicultural urban living coupled with easy access to the countryside and getting out to fields, rivers and forests. There are lots of gorgeous cafe's and restaurants, great shopping and loads of things for kids to do.
host_about: Hi! I’m Rachel. Welcome to our much loved home in Easton! I live here with my husband Johan and our two little sons, Jasper and Felix. I have studied, partied and am now working  and settled in Bristol, and I am very happy to have experienced all those stages of life in this fair city! Having once fully appreciated Bristols great nightlife,  I can now also appreciate the many cafes, unique shops and proximately to all the green space that Bristol offers. We are so lucky to have  the hustle and bustle of Bristol to enjoy on our doorstep whilst simultaneously having the wonderful sanctuary that is our home.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.67 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Totterdown is a brilliant vibrant creative community, with bars, restaurants, a greengrocer, high street supermarket and cafes all within walking distance.  Several lovely open green spaces (nearest park 3 min walk away) and a chilled atmosphere.
host_about:
Hey, I'm Helen.  I take great pride in my houses and their style, design and comfort.  Both have one thing in common - fantastic views and brilliant close by walks.  

I'm married with two children,  two dogs and two guinea-pigs!  I love travelling, road trips in particular and ski when I can.

name: Townhouse in Bristol · ★4.77 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Our home is a 20 minute bus ride or 15 minute drive from Bristol City centre.

Troopers Hill Nature reserve is a wonderful place to watch the sunset, and we're also close to Conham River Park. It's easy to get into nature from here using cycle routes – just ask us for more specific routes!

We're also a short walk away from Church Road which has an Aldi as well as delis, cafes and pubs.

Our house is bike friendly and cyclists can bring their bikes inside.
host_about:
Me and Ben have stayed in Airbnbs all around the world. We met when we were living in the south of China and have decided to settle in Bristol, a city we fell in love with for its a creative scene and laid back vibe. 

We're fans of road cycling, discovering new places and buying too many books.

host_about: I am a swiss born artist,painter/decorator living and working in Bristol. I love travelling, painting and music. My art has been inspired by my travels and I like to get away whenever possible when I am not working.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.87 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath

We are 2 minutes away from a large park with playground and tennis courts.
We are 5 minutes away from Windmill Hill City Farm which has a lovely cafe.
We are 2 minutes away from Bedminster train station which serves local trains.
We have a convenience store in the corner and a large supermarket is 10 minutes by foot.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.85 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview: Large Tesco's 5-10 minute walk away; Henleaze Leisure Centre 15 minutes walk. Proximate to Gloucester Road with its interesting range of shops, cafes, pubs and bars.

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.44 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
Townhouse in City of Bristol · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
'Our village in the city' is often used to describe our local neighbourhood of 'the dings'. Very centrally located and conveniently close both the city centre and central station. Around the corner (literally) you'll find The Barley Mow - voted 'best pub in Bristol' by CAMRA.

The eclectic district of Old Market is a stones throw away. With over 60 listed buildings it was once the old east gate to the city. Here you'll find many nice bars, resturants and independent shops. 'The Old Market Assembly' being a stand out venue with its own resturant, bar and theatre with excellent locally sourced food at a reasonable price. You'll also find the Exchange, The Stag and Hounds and the Trinity centre to name a few others.

If you enjoy craft beer you’ll find an abundance of local breweries on your doorstep including; Moor Beer, Left Handed Giant, Little Martha, Good Chemistry as well as many excellent cafes, pasty shops, a local deli, a Sainsburys and a Greggs all within
host_about:
Hello folks!

I am a young creative, living and working in Bristol. I currently work as a Design Engineer and enjoy travelling and exploration. I love visiting different countries and taking in the local culture, meeting new people and trying new things.

I am also a home owner and have my own little place in Bristol (which is an amazing city so come visit if you haven't already!) I have been renovating my place for the past year so I am very respectful of people's homes and the amount of work which goes into making your own perfect space. I am clean and considerate. 

I really enjoy local history, food, art and culture, while taking in a few of the local beers along the way. 

I'm looking forward to meeting you all and exploring some awesome places...
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.84 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths

Local supermarkets - Aldi, Tesco, Co-op.

Hipster bakeries and cafes just around the corner and into St George main high street.

Pubs and bars.

Lovely park super close to the house.

name: Townhouse in Bristol · ★4.93 · 7 bedrooms · 15 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview: The house is located a short walk from the main bus station in an area that has been recently voted the 5th coolest place to live in the UK by The Times paper. It lies between two areas Stokes Croft and Cabot Circus. Stokes Croft and the Gloucester rd are jam-packed with local, independent shops, cafes and restaurants there are so many great places to explore my favourite spots are Poco for amazing Tapas, the new place to go Jamaica street stores for a taste sensation (if you can get a table!) or grab some food at the canteen check out the Banksy and breakdancing Jesus before catching live music every night from 8pm followed by late night dancing at no. 51, or the Love Inn till 4am!. This whole area is full of street art and has the most independent shops of any street in the country. Cabot Circus on the other hand is the new modern shopping centre with a huge selection of designer shops, chain restaurants and a Cinema du Lux. A short walk past the Bus station and the infamous Bear Pit
host_about: A keen easy going traveller, there aren't that many places I haven't been. Love music, cinema and food. Always smiling and enjoy meeting new people. An experienced host with over 1.5k reviews :)

hello!

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.82 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The neighbourhood is on the border of the main shopping district of Bristol in the city centre (next to Cabot Circus mall), and the cultural melting pots of Stokes Croft and Montpelier - two of the most vibrant neighborhoods in Bristol. Walk up Gloucester Road for a plethora of independent shops - the most in the UK! Banksy’s ‘Mild, Mild West’ mural is nearby.

The apartment building is nextdoor to Mickey Zoggs, which is a cafe with delicious food and Italian coffee by day, and a hip bar by night, attracting DJs from all over the country as it is host to Noods Radio station which you can see in action! Legendary underground reggae bar Cosies is also on Surrey street, which now has an outdoor restaurant. Incredible new music venue ‘Lost Horizons’ is a short walk away.

There are small supermarkets and restaurants in both Broadmead (just past Cabot Circus mall) and Stokes Croft. You can find small metro Tescos and Sainsbury’s close by, with a larger Tescos express
host_about:
Hi there :)

I'm Simon, a teacher by trade and passionate travel photographer who has lived in various countries, most recently Japan. 

I started using Airbnb to suppliment my income by offering my own apartment here in Bristol city centre and staying in single rooms, and met some lovely people in the prcoess. 

After a two year hiatus, I'm looking to do the same thing again. I'm looking forward to meeting and hosting guests, and meeting some new (and old) hosts.

name: Home in Bristol · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Meals/food not provided, as the house is next door to a large Sainsburys, which is open from 7am to 10pm Mon- Sat, and 11am-5pm on Sundays.

We are about 1.5 miles from Temple Meads. For Southmead Hospital and UWE, we suggest you find a nearer Airbnb as buses will take more than 1 hour to get there.

Sandy Park Road is the main street 2 minutes away with a deli, Post Office, charity shops, coffee shops, bike shop, bakers, Chinese takeway, fish and chips, launderette, dry cleaners etc.

Arnos Vale park and Arnos Vale cemetery are at the end of the road and a lovely place to stroll.

We're not far from the Paintworks and the excellent Bocabar for pizzas and more, and the Bristol Eats.

There's a cinema a couple of minutes walk away, as well as other shops including M&S Food, Boots, The Range, Wilko, Iceland and every kind of fast food outlet (Costa Coffee, Greggs, Krispy Kreme, McDonalds, Kentucky, Burger King) you might require.
host_about:
I rent rooms out in my home in Bristol. I'm a self employed freelance travel content marketer and PR copywriter and during the pandemic I was hit hard so I now rent 2 of my spare rooms. 

I'm in my mid 50s and have done the partying so now am an early to bed, early to rise person and  love going to bed early with a good book  I always aim for 8 hours sleep. I try to fit in gym classes daily, and  meditate regularly.

I like to keep a clean and tidy home (and hope if you're staying with me you would respect that and keep it clean/ check my house rules).

name: Home in Bristol · ★5.0 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: The house is set in a beautiful green leafy neighbourhood but you can walk into the centre of Bristol in 15mins and to beautiful Georgian Clifton in 10mins. This is a quiet residential neighbourhood and hence unsuitable for events and parties. It is 5mins walk from the cafes, restaurants and shops of stylish Whiteladies road. You can buy food at many shops and supermarkets nearby. Nearest shop is 5mins walk. Off street parking at the property is possible (please enquire).
host_about: Lucy is an academic working at the University of Bristol. She likes cycling, hiking and theatre/cinema/art galleries. She is up early for a run and does not stay out to party! She and her family and the dog live in Bristol.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.80 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 2 shared baths
neighborhood_overview:
• Eastville has wide range of multicultural tastes in foods, drinks, takeaways. There are many amenities, pubs, restaurants and shops on Stapleton and St. Mark’s road with many operating 24 hours.
• There are a number of churches, a couple of mosques, a gurdwara (Sikhism) and a synagogue within walking distances of each other.
• If you like nature walks and jogging for fresh air, there are many beautiful parks within a stone throw distance such as Eastville and St George parks, cycle paths, the Frome valley walkway and the Royate Hill Nature Reserve.
• We are opposite Eastgate trading estate with superstores like Tesco Extra, IKEA, Asda Living, mother care, for ease of shopping, Burger king, Halfords, Next, Marks and Spencer food hall, Chinese Hotel and supermarket, Pizza hut , subway ete for shopping
• The house is centrally placed and within easy reaches of universities, hospitals, schools and Warehouses in Bristol.
• The house is 2.5 miles to Bristol city c

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.65 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Our flat is located in the heart of Bristol, with beautiful waterfront views and excellent public transport links all around the city. Cabot Circus with its plethora of shops, restaurants and attractions is only a 5 minute walk away, or you can choose to take a stroll along the riverside and take in Bristol's natural beauty.

name: Condo in Bristol · ★4.89 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: The flat is located in the city centre, just off the charming Portland Square. It is 5 minutes walk from Cabot Circus shopping centre, and 11 minute walk to Bristol Coach station and a 20 minute walk to Bristol Temple Meads raileay station. Its a 15 minute walk from the waterfront.
host_about: We are an outgoing couple who have been married for 37 years. We are passionate about the theatre, cinema and travelling. I work with MWR Life building a global travel club while Rosalind sings opera all over the world. We want our Bristol home to feel like your home and for you to enjoy the sights and experiences of this vibrant city.

name: Loft in Bristol · ★4.78 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Set on the edge of the trendy Stokes Croft area.
In easy reach of late night bars, restaurants, clubs and its only a 10 minute walk to 'Cabot Circus' shopping centre.
Gloucester road is 5 minutes away and jam packed with local independent shops, cafes & restaurants.
It can get noisy in the area, but to be expected in an inner city location.
We advise researching into the area a little as it's not everyone's cup of tea! However, most people love it!

Bristol is famous for its creativity and graffiti artwork and this area is full of it!
host_about:
Lived in Bristol for over 20 years, many in the flat itself. Now have two young boys and very excitable dog. 
I'm a tea addict, interiors junkie and love Bristol's good food

name: Loft in Bristol · ★4.80 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Time Out voted Easton the coolest UK neighbourhood to live in due to its incredible friendliness, diversity and inclusion, albeit a bit scruffy. Trains, buses, E-scooters and the scenic Bristol to Bath bike path are all minutes away from the studio. Pubs, cafes, shops, beautiful parks, takeaways and many artisan, independent businesses, (including seven microbreweries) are close by. Amazing transport links means site seeing in Bristol is quick and easy and there are so many wonderful things to do in Bristol for free.

Check out the Guidebook for more attractions and Restaurants in the area
host_about:
Originally from Somerset, South West England. 
Health and Fitness coach love music and DJingRespectful of others. 
Love travelling, lived in many places around the world, including South America, Brazil. Ibiza. America. Asia. Recently Residing in Melbourne, Australia. 
I love meeting new people and new adventures, 

Look forward to hearing from you.

neighborhood_overview:
The studio is in a fantastic location for anyone going to Bristol Royal Infirmary, as it is just a short walk away. Equally, on your door step is the Christmas Steps, Clifton Triangle, Park Street, the City Centre and loads of different bars and restaurants you really are spoilt for choice.

Hello we are Hopewell and welcome to our profile. We are dedicated to making sure you enjoy your stay in one of our many homes, be that in the city centre, Clifton or beyond.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.96 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: Montpelier is a hub of culture and creativity. A residential area with a real sense of community, whilst being right on the doorstep of the city centre. No need for a bus, the centre is only a short walk away and we're only a few streets away from Bristols popular Stokes Croft and Gloucester Road, home to endless independent shops, cafes and restaurants. Parking is free at the weekends and after 5pm and before 9am , Monday to Friday.

name: Townhouse in City of Bristol · ★4.46 · 4 bedrooms · 6 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
A wonderful house located in a quiet yet central area of Bristol. The area bridges Gloucester Road famed for its indie shops and plentiful good restaurants and cafe; and Ashley down an area of allotments leading down to the City Farm in St Werburghs. You can enjoy walks from here down Gloucester road and the eclectic shops & cafes, through Stokes Croft and graffiti central into town. Or down the other side of the hill you can wander past allotments on both sides and what feels like a rural oasis in the city the farm, cafe and farm pub at St Werburghs. We have a great local pub- the lazy dog with local ales, film night and good feelings all round.

There is a Lidl and an Aldi 1km away on Muller Road.
host_about:
A devoted yogini with a conflicted urban-rural divide! I grew up in London, now live in Bristol where we run Bristol City Yoga, and love the city life. Have enjoyed living in Wales, rural Ireland, Dorset and other beautiful, wild, dive into the river/sea spots in between. An avid cyclist, usually to be found peddling away, yoga-ing or hanging out with friends/ family including my son Madoc and Tinkerbelle the dog!

I love to explore the UK and the stunning subtle light, but also to get away in the winter (autumn, spring and summer!)
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.93 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
host_about: I co-own this Georgian house with a friend. We let it out mainly to staff visiting Bristol University as it's so close to it. Our philosophy is to have a quiet and calm atmosphere so that anyone working from home will  be able to. I mange the property with the help of our faithful cleaner. There is limited parking by the hour in all streets nearby.

name: Townhouse in Bristol · ★4.83 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths

I've lived in Bristol for 14 years.
I love to cook, travel, DJ and walking our lovely dog Yumi. 

Airbnb has been part of almost every holiday over the last 10 years and feels a privilege to be a super host for 6 years consecutively.

name: Condo in City of Bristol · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: Great cafes and lovely shops in the neighbourhood. Just a short walk from Cabot Circus Shopping Centre and the lively Stokes Croft area.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Guest suite in Bristol · ★4.66 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Business class comfort and convenience in the very popular BS6 / Gloucester Road area. Walking distance from city centre (Cabot Circus 15 minutes, Harbour 20 minutes, Bear Pit/coach station 10 minutes). Free street parking.
Safe neighbourhood.
The studio is quite near Gloucester Road / Arches (2 minutes walk), a very popular area, the longest road of independent shops in the UK, also with many eateries to visit or order from within 2-5 minutes walk, also pubs, a very diverse range of shops, also post office, banks, supermarkets etc
host_about:
My wife and I have busy professional jobs which have given us a great deal of experience over the years with many types of people, different cultural settings and nationalities. We also own property which we let to young professionals and have had extensive experience both with lodgers and tenants (over 150 contracts); and with property development and maintenance. An overview, including testimonials, can be viewed at www bristolpad co uk. We are recognized for being efficient and pro-active in ensuring that the accommodation we provide is of high standard and well maintained. We are NLA and ICO registered. 
The BristolPad Studio flat described here represents a development which we feel will be attractive both for business and holiday travellers to the Bristol area. It is our second studio for short term letting / managed apartments (see also Avonview Studio BS4 4AW which has over 50 feedbacks) and we are committed to ensuring that we provide a high standard of service. We also have excellent local contacts and contractors to support our services.

name: Loft in Bristol · ★4.69 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Easton is a unique area of town, which has a lot to offer.

My favourite places are the Green bank Pub - Socialble and Trendy pub
Thali Restaurant for amazing Southern Indian food
The Plough Inn for live music and dancing.

Plus St Marks Road has loads of cool restaurants & Good food shops

Also for a chilled out vibe, St Werbergh's city farm/pub is nearby for great Roasts. St Werbergh's mound is also a great walk and nature hot spot.

Health and Fitness coach love music and DJingRespectful of others. 
Love travelling, lived in many places around the world, including South America, Brazil. Ibiza. America. Asia. Recently Residing in Melbourne, Australia. 
I love meeting new people and new adventures,

name: Townhouse in Bristol · ★4.98 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to one of the most beautiful parts of Bristol. Nestled between Berkeley Square and Brandon Hill, this city centre location is idyllic. With birds singing songs throughout the day and the hustle & bustle of Queen’s Road and Park Street there couldn’t be a better location to discover Bristol.
Brandon Hill is a wonderful place to get lost in and enjoy nature at its best (in your own backyard!). Discover its waterfalls, woodland and meadow. There's a playground too and the paths lead you all the way down to the river Avon and the centre of town.
Park Street is filled with independent clothing stores, charity shops, and the original Boston Tea Party coffee shop. Try out Pinkman’s, a modern bakery and cafe. There are plenty of wonderful bakeries, cafes, restaurants, and the great Bristol Museum is over the road. Swoon at the bottom of Park Street is an absolute must if you are a lover of Italian gelato.
Places to discover less than 20 minutes away by food: The harbo
