name: Townhouse in Bristol · ★4.67 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: Located in the cosmopolitan and bohemian community of Greenbank, Easton. Free on street parking. Excellent local food shops that sell a wide range of quality foods, cool cafe's and restaurants, providing a range of different cultural cuisine, ie Thali, Moroccan, Indian, Vegan, great coffee at Cafe 5 etc. Good public transport service provides a short ride to city center and other surrounding areas .. A local train service within walking distance trains to: Temple Meads Train Station, Clifton, Redland, Gloucester rd and Bath etc. Plus bus services. The Bristol to Bath railway path, is great for both cyclists and pedestrians and is right on our doorstep. Green spaces and lovely parks in walking distance.
host_about: So far I've really enjoyed the experience of hosting the varied and interesting selection of people who have visited my home. I'm calm and friendly, respectful, easy to get along with person. When I travel, I like to stay in places that offer me privacy and space but helpful and friendly if I need anything. I like a clean, clear space, that I can call my own, so I aim to offer the same to my guests, I'm also open to a friendly chat and cuppa if you need that. I'm told people feel relaxed and at ease in my company. I am well traveled including time spent in West Africa and Europe. I've lived in Central and South America and the Caribbean. I love the arts and culture, I'm a practicing writer, photographer and therapist. I love music and dancing and for many years I worked alongside world music artists, working and traveling with artists from all over the world; I think this has given me a broad understanding, appreciation and acceptance of different people and different customs. I relate well to others and am told by people who have limited grasp of the english language that my spoken english and diction is clear and easy to understand. I speak a little spanglish! I like walking, nature and yoga.

name: Home in Bristol · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Our house is less than 5 minutes walk from the bustling North Street which is full of independent cafes, pubs, restaurants and shops.

Also you can walk into the centre of the city in 30 minutes. Here you can find attractions such as Brunel's SS Great Britain, Museums and Art Galleries as well as fantastic shopping options.
host_about:
I have lived in Bristol the majority of my life and absolutely love the city.

I love meeting new people and exploring new cities as well as trying different and new amazing foods.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.86 · 4 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: A quiet area, very close to many amenities such as Gloucester Rd shops, cafes and bars, the city centre and Cabot Circus, Stokes Croft, Clifton and the Suspension Bridge, Bristol Zoo, Redland, The Downs, local cinema, at least 4 good theatres.
host_about: Love the outdoors and traveling

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.77 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Many lovely places to eat and drink just a couple of minutes walk from the accommodation. Cafe-bars, Mezze-bars, micro pub, Weatherspoons , Thai, Indian and Italian restaurants.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.81 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: It's a quiet, humble area, a minute away to the BAWA leisure club. 5 minutes walk to bus stops which go to the city centre (approx 40 mins to town centre). 20 mins by car. We are walking distance to SOUTHMEAD HOSPITAL.  There are lots of takeaways in the area too and a Lidl just 5 mins away. The famous Gloucester road is a short bus ride away too... famous for its independent shops, cafes and restaurants.  We take great pride in the house. It's been in our family from when it was built in 1920. I am the 4th generation to own it. My Mum (Sally) lives there permanently and will be on hand to help you throughout your stay.
host_about:
I am open minded, easy going, avid traveller. I am a creative person and love the arts. 

Although I own the property, My mum lives there full time and is my Co-host. The house has been in our family since 1930 (when it was built).

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.66 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Central Bristol is a vibrant area withany local bars and restaurants, chains and independent retailers.
The city has been voted the beat place to live in the UK may times. It is a cosmopolitan city, with many different nationalities and cultures calling it home.
Embrace the small city lifestyle and walk or cycle to where you need to go.
host_about:
Two kids, two dogs, one VW T4. Proud Bristolian.
I live very close to the properties listed, so in the unlikely event of a problem (or a noise complaint) I can be with you within minutes.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.89 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
From the apartment you can walk to all the harbourside and city centre attractions including the SS Great Britain, M Shed, Millenium Square, The Old Vic Theatre, The Hippodrome, Colston Hall, The University, St Nick’s Market and the main shopping area.

A longer walk takes you up the hill to Cabot Tower and to Clifton Village. Close by there are a wide selection of places to eat and drink including local pubs, harbourside cafes and restaurants including the Michelin Star Casa Mia Restaurant.
host_about: I have lived in and around Bristol since 1982. I am married to John and have two grown up sons. I recently retired from Local Government and John is an Architect. I love nature, yoga and cycling and like to visit new places as often as I can. We have a converted warehouse in the heart of the city that we make available to visitors to Bristol.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.28 · 2 bedrooms · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
host_about: Quiet house in a quiet street.  Very near to city centre and Cabot Circus (shopping mall).  Nearby to Bristol University and lots of bars, cafes.  The area is very artisan and is a haven for students. It is quite diverse in culture and has a community feel.  People always go out of their way to help you

name: Condo in City of Bristol · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
Place to stay in City of Bristol · ★4.80 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
host_about: I am a relaxed and welcoming host that happens to be a pagan and a druid. I live in the South of Bristol very close to many attractions and beautiful countryside and am happy to do guided tours of sacred sites for aditional costs.

name: Home in City of Bristol · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Westbury on Trym is an historic village 3 miles from the centre of Bristol, with shops, banks and restaurants.  The ancient village church is within site of the cottage and well worth a visit, bell ringing practice takes place on a Tuesday evening, but stops at 9pm!  Canford park is within 10 minutes walking distance with a great play area for children, and Blaise woods and Castle a little further.  There are numerous attractions within the city,  some close to the cottage and details of many of them are held in the cottage.  Bristol is an exciting centre, and the gateway to the South West so a brilliant location for your holiday!
host_about:
I love living at Trymwood and working in the garden. It's a joy to welcome people from all over the world to stay in this self contained holiday cottage which is attached to our house. 
I enjoy spending time with my family and friends as well as cooking, reading, sewing and travelling. I'm interested in history and art and enjoy having Trymwood Studios on site which is a gallery and workshop dedicated to art and nature.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.91 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview: Easton is a truly multicultural part of Bristol, now up and coming as one of the more desirable parts of Bristol to be in. There are plenty of local cafes and bars and St Marks Road is the perfect example of this.
host_about: I am a well travelled international person. I love meeting  people and appreciate good communication. I also love music, dancing, Iyengar yoga, playing guitar and singing, making things, fixing things!  I have travelled to India many times, Senegal, Morocco and the Gambia, Colombia and Venezuela, Italy for 5 summers, in Salento,  Australia and New Zealand.  I love conscious roots reggae music, old and new, in any language as long as it's upbeat and positive! I Iike cooking and eating healthy and tasty(spicey) food! As a host I will gage what you want or need, so if that's space and privacy, that's what you'll get, and if you would like some advice or a chat you may well also get them! If I have a life motto, it's to treat others as i would wish to be treated!
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.81 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
A 20-minute walk from the train station and 30 minutes to Bristol City Centre. This is a quiet suburban area, near a main road and bus route into the city centre, via the train station.

Bristol is a thriving city, with bustling waterfront, green spaces, and all the city centre entertainment you would expect of a popular city.

You're going to want to visit Bristol for its history, food scene, ton of activities and proximity to the gorgeous Southwest (Devon, Dorset, Somerset. Think clotted cream tea, beautiful coastline, Cheddar Gorge, and quaint villages), the Cotswolds, and Wales. London is only an hour and a half away by train.

Locally, I love Victoria Park, The 'Bocabar' for a beer or glass of wine, 'A Cappella' for great Italian coffee and breakfast, 'Assana' for a unique and tasty Moroccan dinner, with friendly service, and 'Farrows', the best Fish and Chip shop ever (Sells gluten-free battered fish. People travel for miles!)

host_about: I'm sociable and friendly and can also keep to myself. My Airbnb visits are usually for a workshop so I'll be in bed early and pretty quiet!

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.80 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview:
You are in a prime location when staying at this Air bnb!

You are within short walking distance to many of the main attractions in Bristol.

The road that the house is situated in is a quiet place and parking on the street is free.
host_about: I like to be helpful so hosting on Air bnb has proven to be a good fit for me. I am very house proud, so keep the space clean and tidy. Health and fitness is my passion so you'll find me training clients in my gym or writing training programs on my laptop. My other main hobby is mountain biking and most weekends I'll be off to ride in Wales or some other place. I'm a "down to earth" kinda guy and enjoy all kinds of humour.

host_about:
Hello we are Hopewell and welcome to our profile. We are dedicated to making sure you enjoy your stay in one of our many homes, be that in the city centre, Clifton or beyond.
We are here to help you enjoy your time with us and get the best out of what Bristol has to offer. 
Our team really has great knowledge of the area so please feel free to ask us any questions.  We are all really passionate about our great city, and are excited about others coming to explore all it has to offer.
Everyone has a role to play in the team, so there is always someone to look after you.
We are experts in Airbnb which started from looking after our own properties, to friends, to the whole of Bristol and beyond. 

We look forward to having you to stay!

name: Townhouse in City of Bristol · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: This is the peaceful, residential section of the harbour area, no traffic, no club or party noise. Most of the harbour area is buzzing and therefore noisy, but we are in a lovely quiet section around Bathhouse Basin, which is a mini-marina. We have the UK's 'best restaurant' on our doorstep - Casamia, beat 1200 others to be top of Gordon Ramsay's competition list.  It's a conservation area with beautiful character buildings all around. It's perfectly placed for Temple Meads Station, the city centre and the thriving business quarter around the station.
host_about: I work in education, as a filmmaker and writer.  I live and work from home so am usually there to greet and assist when needed. I have been doing airbnb since September 2017 and am now adding my second spare bedroom to my offer.  I hope to welcome all kinds of friendly and considerate travellers and business people to my home in this lovely part of Bristol.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.91 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: The centre of Bristol is vibrant and exciting. On a weekday evening you can take a walk around the harbour and enjoy many different types of buskers, on a weekend you can't help but get excited for what the night has to offer! Jazz - stay local; Pop - go to the Harbourside; Dance, Soul and Grime - Gloucester Road. Bristol has everything you'd want! There is every possible type of restaurant you could wish for from the classic big chains, to independent Michelin star restaurants. There are large open spaces, lots of shopping and entertainment and attractions, on and off the water!
host_about: I’m Charlotte, I’ve lived and worked in Bristol for 7 years but work has taken me to London permanently so I’ve decided to rent out my home as I can’t bare to sell it. I enjoy the countryside, the city and harbourside in equal measures and there’s nothing quite like Bristol in the summertime, especially the Balloon Fiesta weekend!
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in Shirehampton · ★New · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
Home in City of Bristol · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Montpelier was recently voted one of the top 'coolest places to live in the UK' (The Times) . What's noticeable about it how is different all the buildings are .. You get a real sense of that from the roof terrace. There's a real diversity of people and things to do as well .
There's a nice pub just opposite, The Cadbury, with tranquil beer garden and great sunday lunches. Within a couple of minutes walk there are several eateries, with great variety whether for breakfast, lunch or dinner. If you want (guaranteed every night) live music with your food The Canteen on Stokes Croft. Also at the bottom of the road is a farm shop, an Italian deli and a yoga studio.
host_about:
I'm easy-going and sociable, and can get along with just about anyone. 
I love music, food and interesting conversation. I work as a music therapist in health care settings throughout Bristol. There are lots of instruments in the house anyone can play if they like. 
I love my home. It is characterful, comfortable and peaceful, and I take a pleasure in welcoming people in to it.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.83 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
This area of Bristol is being branded 'the creative quarter'. The Paintworks complex has artists, sculptors, design studios, film companies and marketing agencies in almost every commercial space.

It's not far from Temple Meads train station, and just off a main road, but from where we are you see the canal, greenery and no cars. It's a peaceful place not far from the chaos.
host_about:
I’m a keen traveller, whether it’s over the winter for skiing, in the summer for some sun, or throughout the year for city breaks. It’s where every penny of my money goes. 

I’m normally travelling with a group or with my partner and we’re all sociable and respectful - I look forward to meeting you and exploring your city.

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.55 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath

Many chain restaurants and shops are at the end of the road on Park Street and 'The Triangle', whilst at the other end of the road is Clifton Village with its independent shops and eateries and the famous Suspension Bridge and the Downs. name: Townhouse in City of Bristol · ★4.67 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is bohemian, friendly and vibrant.  We are nestled between Stokes Croft which is teaming with restaurants, cafes and music venues, St Andrews park (probably North Bristols finest park and which also has a playground) and St Werburghs City Farm (where there's a great cafe serving fantastic locally sourced food) and is great for the little ones.  We are a 20 minute walk from the harbour. The famous Gloucester Road is just 10 mins away on foot. The Gloucester Rd is apparently the longest stretch of road full of independent shops, amazing restaurants, cafes, vintage and second hand shops and much more.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in City of Bristol · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.87 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
A 20-minute walk from the train station and 30 minutes to Bristol City Centre. This is a quiet suburban area, near a main road and bus route into the city centre, via the train station.

Bristol is a thriving city, with bustling waterfront, green spaces, and all the city centre entertainment you would expect of a popular city.

You're going to want to visit Bristol for its history, food scene, ton of activities & events, and proximity to the gorgeous Southwest (Devon, Dorset, Somerset. Think clotted cream tea, beautiful coastline, Cheddar Gorge, and quaint villages), the Cotswolds, and Wales. London is only an hour and a half away by train.

Locally, I love Victoria Park, The 'Bocabar' for a beer or glass of wine, 'A Cappella' for great Italian coffee and breakfast, 'Assana' for a unique and tasty Moroccan dinner, with friendly service, and 'Farrows', the best Fish and Chip shop ever (Sells gluten-free battered fish. People travel for miles!)

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.87 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Shops in Clifton Village (5-10 minutes up the hill) including Tesco, Co-op, Delis, Late store/Post Office, Charity shops (6), restaurants (Fish'n'chips, Indian, Thai, Fish, Pizza..), cafes and coffee shops (35 at last count..)
Brunel's Suspension Bridge (of course) about 5 minutes walk up the hill and round the corner.
Clifton Downs start at the Bridge and extend miles along the River Avon, which meets the harbour exit at the bottom of the hill (5 minutes).
You can cross the harbour and walk along the river, stroll along the harbour side into the Centre, , Watershed, Arnolfini, restaurants, clubs, take the cross-harbour ferry to the SS Great Britain and The Matthew, yeah lots of stuff..
You can stroll to Bristol Zoo in 20-25 minutes or take the bus from Clifton Village.
Bus stops in Clifton Village for the City Centre, Redland, Zoo, bus and railway stations and University campuses.
Catch the ferry along the harbour from the bottom of the hill (5-10 minutes

name: Camper/RV in City of Bristol · ★4.56 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are located in an industrial inner suburb of Bristol. It is bounded by River Avon and Harbour feeder canal

We share our warehouse with Kingsland Studios, a creative hub of over 50 independent craft businesses. Our location is not residenital and whilst actually is a safe area, if walking at night - can feel lonely due to majority of buildings being used during the day.

We love our quirky industrial home and think you will too, it is a brilliant base to explore Bristol and all this wonderful city has to offer.

We are very close (0.5mile, 10minute walk to be exact!) to Temple Meads train station, Within a mile of us (15minute walk), there is a large shopping centre, a number of restaurants, a theatre and Motion nightclub as well as many other things.

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
St George is an inner suburb of Bristol. It is known as 'up and coming' and if the number of building works is anything to go by it certainly is! There is a lovely park at one end of the street (St George's Park) and an interesting and unusual cemetery at the other end of the street, both Victorian and quite grand. There is a nature reserve adjoining the cemetery with playing field and paths down to the River Avon at the bottom of the hill.
There are any number of pubs, restaurants and takeaways in St George plus some supermarkets (Tesco, Aldi, Lidl, Co-op).
The pubs are friendly and some specialise in micro breweries and cider. Some have live music some nights a week.

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighbourhood is a vibrant mix of families, professionals and students. Set in a conservation area, the leafy roads are lined with beautiful Victorian properties.

On the next street you'll find the foodie enclave of Chandos Road, home to restaurants Wilsons, Snobbys, Little Hollows, and the Kensington Arms Pub. There are also a couple of Indian restaurants, a great fish and chip shop and bars and cafes, so we are really spoilt for choice, and that's without venturing out of the immediate neighbourhood!

You'll find the essentials to buy at our local convenience store on Chandos Road, fresh bread, croissants and deli items from Bake Away, and for a bigger shop, a large Sainsbury's is a 7 minute walk away.
host_about:
When I travel I like to know the insider tips and local secrets, and that's how I like to help our guests. Especially when it comes to food - my husband teaches cookery and we know all the best places to go for good food in Bristol, from cheap and cheerful to Michelin starred treats.
We love Bristol and want everyone who visits to get the best possible experience, wherever they’re from.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.91 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath

With trendy bars and restaurants of North Street about .7 of a mile and Ashton Gate Stadium about the same distance. We have shops just at the bottom of the street and through a footway, newsagents, café and fish and chip shop.
There is a great climbing centre just a few hundred metres away.
The transport links are outstanding, we have buses and trains galore. If you are driving we can always park on our street and we have no residents scheme.

name: Home in City of Bristol · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
host_about:
We specialise in cleaning Airbnb properties and Hostels, with over 3 years experience in the industry.
We know that cleaning is one of the more challenging aspects of preparing your listing. Your customers are expecting a hotel standard of cleanliness, that's where we come in.

All our Airbnb housekeepers are background checked with at least 2 professional references and then must pass an intensive housekeeping course. Less than 5% of our applicants are successful, we only want the best on our team as our reputation and our clients reputation is extremely important to gaining great reviews and happy customers.

Air Solutions are here to make your life easier when preparing for your guests. In addition to our traditional housekeeping services, we can also offer:
 
Arrangement of Bristol maps, tour guides, leaflets etc. on coffee table as well as a personalised welcome note for guests
Fully Insured and available to Key hold.
On Demand, 24 hour service notice available.
Laundry service including bed linens, bathroom and kitchen towels.
Mint or Chocolates left on pillow, or other comforts or premium hospitality.

Airbnb allows you to set your own cleaning fee during the registration process of your listing. Cover the cost of cleaning your Airbnb without worrying about diminishing profits.

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.73 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
We're in the popular and very friendly Westbury Park area of Bristol and as well as having the lovely Downs just around the corner, there's lots more to enjoy.

This includes brilliant restaurants including the nationally-acclaimed eatery Little French, and fantastic pubs such as the Westbury Tavern (where legendary TV show The Young Ones was filmed) on the doorstep as well as a super cinema.

Our place is ideal for people coming to Bristol to visit family and friends at the University of Bristol and University of the West of England (UWE)

There's also a selection of great shops and cafes within east reach and out place is within walking distance of Blaise Castle, Gloucester Road, Stokes Croft and the city centre.

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.97 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Lovely leafy Georgian neighbourhood, set up high with views over the whole of Bristol. An extremely central location, Cotham neighbours, Stokes Croft (hipster coffee shops and bars) and Kingsdown (beautiful architecture) on one side, and Clifton (Beautiful Village next to the Downs) on the other.

Extremely central with easy access by foot, bus or bike to; shopping in Cabots Circus, culture at the Arnolfini/M Shed and Harbourside/Waterfront - music/theatre at the Colston Hall/Hippodrome/Everyman cinema. Close-by to the BBC, BRI Hospital and Bristol University. Lovely walks on the Downs.

Our nearest park with children's play area, is Cotham Gardens - a few minutes walk down the road.
host_about: We met in our early 20's at Edinburgh University and worked our way around the world mostly hitchhiking, washing dishes and working on organic farms before settling down to careers in Marketing and Creative Media.  Now the proud parents of two fabulous boys and loving our lives back in the South West having finally left London.

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.71 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
Cabin in City of Bristol · ★4.69 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Filwood is a suburban neighbourhood designed in the 1930s as a Garden City as part of the Homes Fit for Heroes Housing Act after the First World War. Built as Council housing, this inter-war red-brick housing estate is typical of its period. There is a strong community ethos and you will be staying at its heart in the grounds of the Filwood Community Centre.

The location is just a 10 minute drive from the city centre and Temple Meads railway station.

You are 5 minutes walk from the Knowle West Media Centre who, along with Filwood CC, are partners in the We Can Make project. The KWMC is a vibrant community arts and media centre where you can find out much more about the We Can Make project and other cool stuff.

Filwood CC has a delightful courtyard and gardens with a locally run café that does a variety of coffees, homemade cakes and hot meals. They also do a mean bacon and egg sandwich.

Bristol has a lot to offer to visitors and is is routin

At the bottom of the street you will find the Christmas Steps Pub, which always has a good atmosphere and a must try for anyone staying at the apartment. Esp the Sunday lunches.
The new Cafe and Cake shop Ahh Toots at the bottom of Chrismas Steps is a must if you fancy a coffee and cake!

name: Townhouse in City of Bristol · ★4.96 · 7 bedrooms · 7 beds · 7 baths
neighborhood_overview:
This is a beautiful quiet Georgian square surrounded by lovely parks, but you can walk everywhere; shops, clubs, cafes, University, suspension bridge, harbourside.
It is one of the most beautiful parts of Bristol. Nestled between Berkeley Square and Brandon Hill, this city centre location is idyllic. With birds singing songs throughout the day and the hustle & bustle of Queen’s Road and Park Street there couldn’t be a better location to discover Bristol.
Brandon Hill is a wonderful place to get lost in and enjoy nature at its best (in your own backyard!). Discover its waterfalls, woodland and meadow. There's a playground too and the paths lead you all the way down to the river Avon and the centre of town.
Park Street is filled with independent clothing stores, charity shops, and the original Boston Tea Party coffee shop. Try out Pinkman’s, a modern bakery and cafe. There are plenty of wonderful bakeries, cafes, restaurants, and the great Bristol Museum is over the roa
host_about:
I've lived in Bristol for 14 years.
I love to cook, travel, DJ and walking our lovely dog Yumi. 

Airbnb has been part of almost every holiday over the last 10 years and feels a privilege to be a super host for 6 years consecutively. 

As a host, I'm discrete but always at the end of the phone.

name: Townhouse in City of Bristol · ★4.98 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath

The 'North Street' area of Bristol is home to a vibrant string of cafes and restaurants. Close by is Bristol City football stadium, Greville Symth park (with a kids area and tennis courts) and ten minutes away is the recently redeveloped Wapping Wharf on Bristol's harbourside, with plenty of artisan shops and restaurants.

We have our own theatre (the Tobacco Factory) just a street away and of course all of the amazing Street art to check out all around us (google 'Upfest')
host_about:
I'm a British guy who loves to travel, enjoys the outdoors and playing games. An engineer by trade, I've lived in various countries around the world but now based in Bristol UK with my wife Jen and two kids Annabel and Cameron.

We're a pretty laid back, positive couple who enjoy meeting new people and having a go at new things.

1. Nutmeg Indian - The Mall
2. Fishers - seafood, Princess Victoria Street
3. the Ox, Whiteladies Rd - steak
4. The Mall and the Portcullis for drinks - Portcullis is very old with a wide range of interesting and local real ales/lagers
5. Eden, a brilliant new cafe right opposite the house. Top quality vegan
6. Noa Japanese
7. Spicer & Cole for yummy brunches
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.66 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This apartment is right off of Gloucester Road, famous for its independent shops, numerous cafes and restaurants. It is also known for its great art and graffiti where you will find some of Banksy's most famous pieces.
Just across the road you will find a lovely park for children and Horfield sports centre which has the best gym & swimming pool in the area, lots of child friendly pubs nearby.
There are excellent public transport links and a bus stop 100 meters from the apartment
From the apartment, you can reach Southmead super hospital within 5 minutes by foot, Bristol city Centre/Cabot Circus 10 minutes by car, M4/M5 motorways 10 minutes by car, M32 5 minutes by car, Cribbs Causeway shopping Mall 10 minutes by car, Bristol Rovers Stadium 6 minutes by foot.

name: Guest suite in City of Bristol · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath

name: Home in Southville · ★4.97 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Southville, Bristol! This vibrant neighbourhood is a delightful mix of history, culture, and community spirit. Its colourful Victorian terraced houses and charming streets create a picturesque atmosphere.

Southville also has diverse culinary options, with a wide range of restaurants along North Street . Additionally, just a short distance away is Whapping Wharf, a vibrant waterfront district known for its fantastic dining scene. Here, you'll find a variety of restaurants all with views of the harbour.

Southville is also home to the Tobacco Factory Theatre, a cultural hub hosting various performances including theatre, dance, comedy, and live music. It is located in a beautifully restored tobacco warehouse, which adds to its unique charm. Don't miss the Sunday market at the Tobacco Factory, where you can explore local crafts, artisanal goods, and indulge in delicious street food.

For museum enthusiasts, Bristol offers a wealth of options. Jus
host_about: Hello, I'm Sam and I live in Southville with my partner Rob and our two teenage sons. We also have two cats who like to hang around the front garden waiting for strokes from passers by and a friendly Labrador (who will bark to say hello but is generally not a barky dog at all)

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.93 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
A quiet residential area featuring a mix of Georgian and Victorian homes. Cotham Gardens - a park with activities for children and a place to picnic and relax, is situated a short walk from the flat. Redland train station servicing Temple Meads and Avonmouth, is next to the park.
There are some great pubs within a short walk including The Hillgrove, Cotham Porter Stores, Highbury Vaults and The Cotham Arms all serving traditional ales on draft. A Co-op food store is available 10 mins walk approx and the Gloucester Rd with its famed local bars and restaurants and great shopping (grocers, fishmonger, butcher, bakery) is around a 15 min walk from the flat.
host_about:
I am a freelance musician who is lucky enough to travel the world performing hence my flat being available sometimes to you! 
After living in London for 20 years I moved to Bristol in 2006 and absolutely love this city and the beautiful countryside around. I'm a West Country boy anyway so feel very at home here. Enjoy your stay in my flat. I'm dead proud of it.

name: Townhouse in Bristol · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
St Pauls / Stokes Croft is one of Bristol's livelier areas and all of the bars and venues attract quite a throng on Friday and Saturday nights. Our place is ideally situated to drop into all of this but guests need to be street wise if they are coming home late and likewise be aware of their personal belongings when out.

Further afield there is the waterside where you can get a ferry to HMS Great Britain and take in the colourful harbour side as well as the Arnolfini gallery. A short walk from there takes you to the aquarium and @Bristol which is great for kids. Lost Horizon / The Thekla / the Trinity are go to for gigs.

Clifton is great for a wander round cafes and pretty streets as well as the suspension bridge and the Downs which is a lovely day out.

Our restaurant recommendations would be: Poco (local food reasonable price) Nadu (modern Indian also reasonable) Viet Kitchen, Caribbean Croft (what they sound like, well priced).

Further

neighborhood_overview:

Headley Park is a lovely, quiet residential area. We are only a 15 minute bus ride to bristol city centre which has hundreds of shops, bars and restaurants.
North street is about 7-10 mins by car and has lots of great cafe bars, pubs and restaurants.

There is a Cineworld about 10 minutes drive with a chain pub, McDonalds, and KFC. We back onto the woods which has a nice short walk. We are near the countryside so also a short drive from some beautiful walks. Children's park at the top of the road.
10 minute drive to ASHTON Court Estate where they hold the Balloon Fiesta.
Great spot for walk and a picnic.
10 minutes drive to Bristol airport.
40 minutes to the nearest beach at Weston Super Mare.
30 minutes to the Severn bridge into Wales.
40 minutes to Wells
30 minutes to Bath
60 minutes to Glastonbury
40 minutes to Cheddar.
15 minutes on the 76 bus
host_about:
I love meeting people so I am really enjoying being a Airbnb host. Bristol is an amazing city - it’s vibrant, full of both friendly Bristolians and lovely people from all over the world! There is so much to do and see, yet my house is far enough away from the hustle and bustle that you are able to completely relax! The house backs onto the woods so you’ll hear beautiful birdsong every morning. 

I’m a business coach, happiness coach, author, speaker and a social entrepreneur -which means I love to create stuff that makes a difference! I am currently working on an amazing project called HappiMe - a non profit to help raise self-esteem and improve mental health in children and young people. 

2012 was a life-changing year for me after going through breast cancer, losing my mum and finding out my husband was having an affair all within 12 months!  (I kid you not!) 
Since then I downsized by business coaching franchise, lost 5 stone, started meditating and started doing the things that make my heart sing!

neighborhood_overview:
There's often lots going on in the area, though many guests comment on how surprisingly quiet and chilled the area is.

Within the Paintworks complex, you'll find Convoy Espresso (open 7am - 3pm), an airstream caravan which serves amazing coffee and snacks, and Boca Bar for daytime and evening meals such as brunch, pizza and roast dinners.

Just around the corner on the St Philips Causeway, you’ll find a large Sainsbury’s, and the Avonmeads Retail park, which hosts: Marks & Spencer, Lidl, McDonald's, Wilkos, Boots Chemist, Foot Locker, The Range, Krispy Kreme, Bowling Alley and Show Case Cinema.

On the Bath Road, stands the historically significant Arnos Vale Cemetery – (a national heritage site) which is a great place to explore some of Bristol’s historic past – or just stroll around on a sunny afternoon. There is even a quaint café at the back of the main entrance.

Beautiful areas of outstanding natural beauty are reachable in a day trip fr

A local favourite with various food options is the Volunteer's tavern - worth going to either, they have a garden! Further away from the centre and 15minutes walk towards Easton you can find Pipal tree which is an Indian restaurant. Alternatively, if you dont fancy the walk hop on the buss and go to Greenbank pub for their live music, food and apparently famous Sunday roast! Amenities for groceries etc can be found in the shopping centre which is a short walk from here (yeeiiii). As for some good coffee and meals, walk a bit further towards Corn Street and St Nicolas Market and you will smell the difference with the street food market (yummy yummy in my tummy, i know!). An

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.82 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: The location is fantastic and is a 30-second walk from the bars and restaurants and bus stops on Whiteladies Road.  It is also central to Clifton, Gloucester/Cheltenham Road and the city centre/shopping district.  It is possible to walk everywhere from the flat and you can be at all these places in an easy 20 minute walk in either direction.  Equally, if you fancy getting out of town to the local countryside or nearby cities like Bath and Cheltenham, this is remarkably easy and quick!
host_about:
Hi, I’m Andie and have lived in Bristol for 7.5 years.  I moved from London in 2010 and have never looked back!  It’s such a fantastic, diverse city with so much going on.  The food, bar and music scene is incredible and, in my opinion, rivals London, yet it is relatively inexpensive.

I have lived in my beautiful flat for 6.5 years and restored it myself in my spare time.  I hope you enjoy it as much as I do.  It is on the reception floor of a Victorian home, so it has the most grand reception room in the building with the traditional features of original shutters, cornicing and huge marble fireplace, ceiling rose, and deep skirting boards.  Please understand that the building is >150 years old so it has its quirks and it is not well sound-proofed.  My neighbours (upstairs and downstairs) are very friendly and I’m sure they’ll welcome you.

I am away on a short-term basis so it still very much looks like a home, albeit a bit less cluttered!  I hope you find it a good home-from-home during your stay in Bristol.

The location is fantastic and is a 30-second walk from the bars and restaurants on Whiteladies Road.  It is also central to Clifton, Gloucester/Cheltenham Road and the city centre/shopping district.  I walk everywhere from my flat and you can be at all these places in an easy 20 minute walk in either direction.  Equally, if you fancy getting out of town to the local countryside or nearby cities like Bath and Cheltenham, this is remarkably easy and quick (just try not to travel in rush hour!).

My favourite place to eat in Bristol is the superb tapas bar called Bravas, which is literally at the end of my road and it is always an easy stumble home after one too many dishes of patatas bravas!  I can thoroughly recommend the Iberico pork and deep fried aubergine in molasses.  Trust me!  I recommend booking as it’s a small place and very popular.

There’s a quirky bar called HMSS (Her Majesty’s Secret Service) right next to Clifton Down Shopping Centre, within a few minutes’ walk.  It does fantastic cocktails that are elaborately and imaginatively served.

There’s also a fantastic brunch spot at the end of my road (corner of Hampton Park and Cotham Hill) called Rubicon Too and they have seating outside, which is a wonderful sun-trap on a sunny morning, but equally lovely on a colder weekend day.  The pub opposite the cafe, The Brewhouse, has a lovely outside seating area (opposite Rubicon Too), which is very popular in the summer.  It is one of the few spots in Bristol where you can bask in the sun whilst nursing a glass of wine or cold beer.

There are all sorts of wonderful attractions in the city centre, also walking distance or a short bus ride.  The bus stop is about a minutes’ walk away, as is Clifton Down shopping centre with all the local amenities you could need, including a large supermarket (Sainsburys), pharmacy (Boots) and stationers (WH Smith).

Clifton Suspension Bridge is c25 minute walk away, or a quick taxi ride, and Brunel’s SS Great Britain is also relatively close, on the south side of the river.  There are various Banksy murals dotted around Bristol too.

If you’re in Bristol for work, my flat is a few minutes’ walk from the BBC, about 15-20 minutes from Bristol Royal Infirmary (main hospital) and c10 minutes from the university (city centre campus).

I hope you enjoy your stay in Bristol, and my flat, as much as I do.

Best wishes,
Andie.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

Between stints living abroad I have been living in Bristol for the last 12 years and in this apartment for the last 8 years. Currently I am spending a lot of time away so am not able to take advantage of this great space and its great location, so I thought I would let others do so!

As a designer I have taken great pride in my flat & have enjoyed building much of the furniture that now fills this space and hope you enjoy the art wall which is filled with artwork & photography from my travels.

I hope you enjoy staying here in this most vibrant of Bristol locations, sandwiched between Stokes Croft (Bristol’s cultural & artistic hub), full of independent shops, restaurants (I’d recommend Poco Tapas Bar) & bars (try the Canteen to spot an original Banksy) and Cabot Circus, Bristol’s premier shopping location.

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.74 · 3 bedrooms · 2 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Old Ashley Hill can be found between two of Bristol’s most popular areas, St Werburghs and Montpelier. Picton Street, with its extensive range of eateries, is an eight-minute walk through eclectic lanes. Here one can find the highly rated Bianchis Itallian local favourite Oowie Burger, Thali Cafe, and The Bristolian. There is also a fantastic Italian supermarket. There is the famous Wiper & True brewery and tap room 5 minutes walk from the house in the other direction, as well as more pubs nearby.

A few yards more and you find yourself in Bristol’s Heart – Stokes Croft, home of Bristol’s counter culture. In the house’s immediate vicinity are the allotments, St Werburgh’s eco-village and Mina Road’s restaurants including the acclaimed Cauldron. There is also an organic supermarket, Church (converted to a climbing centre) and a number of excellent pubs and breweries all within walking distance.

Bristol's central shopping area (Cabot Circus) is a 20 minutes walk a
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.77 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
History
The Exchange dates back to the mid-18th century. However, it wasn’t until 1869, after nearly 30 years of housing a bi-weekly corn market, that the structure gained its now famous glass roof. Although the roof itself was replaced shortly after the Second World War, St Nicks holds onto much of its vintage charm. It is the last 18-century exchange building of its kind in the city. Nowadays, the market atmosphere remains, yet the Glass Arcade is now home to numerous independent food purveyors, eager to serve up culinary delights with a smile and a warm welcome.

The Market Today
There are plenty of different stalls to sample, but rest assured that you can’t go wrong with any of them. The team of traders cater for a variety of needs, be it lunch to go or more of a sit-down affair. The stalls themselves are famous in the city, for both the variety of their produce and the sheer deliciousness of what they’ve got to offer.

Part of St Nicholas Market | © J
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.62 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: My Coach House Apartment is near Totterdown and St Phillips. In 2016 it was named the fifth hippest place to live in the UK by The Times.The area is most famously known for its brightly painted Victorian houses, many of which are situated on a large hillside and can be seen from miles around. They resemble the colourful and vibrant feel of Totterdown itself.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in Bristol City · ★4.83 · 3 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Centre of town is a short 10 minutes drive away or a 25 minutes bus ride.
Harbourside - Boats, restaurants and museums are perfect for both professional and leisure use.

Cabot Circus – a semi-indoor shopping area filled with popular retail shops, restaurants, and cinema, great for families.

Stokes Croft – a taste of true Bristol flavour of life, where you can find great pubs, graffiti and delicious restaurants.

St George Park – amazing for a lovely walk or picnic with a pond for a feature in the park. Ice cream vans are often around the skate park area, providing something for everybody in a family.
host_about: I am an adventurous and outgoing person. I tend to travel because of the love for food, nature and culture. I also love movies of all sorts and strongly believe that there's always something to explore anywhere you go.

name: Serviced apartment in Bristol · ★4.17 · 1 bedroom · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Right in the heart of Bristol,  the city centre is lively and full of Bristol's rich history. Just up the road you will find park street and clifton, home to some of Bristol's most popular independent shops, bars and cafes. At the top of Park street you will find Bristol museum & art gallery and Wills memorial building, and at the bottom of Park street is the impressive Bristol Cathedral- perfect sightseeing spots practically on your doorstep! Why not take a walk through St Nicholas market which is full of culture and fantastic food, or walk into Cabot Circus, Bristol's central shopping centre, for a bit of retail therapy! There are plenty of green spaces if you'd prefer a nice walk and some fresh air- queen's square is right next door and nearby you will find brandon hill, castle park and many more. Bristol harbourside is the perfect place for foodies (lots of choice!) and art & culture lovers- we recommend M-shed, watershed, and Spike island. No matter what kind of break you are look
host_about:
Hello we are Hopewell and welcome to our profile. We are dedicated to making sure you enjoy your stay in one of our many homes, be that in the city centre, Clifton or beyond.
We are here to help you enjoy your time with us and get the best out of what Bristol has to offer. 
Our team really has great knowledge of the area so please feel free to ask us any questions.  We are all really passionate about our great city, and are excited about others coming to explore all it has to offer.
Everyone has a role to play in the team, so there is always someone to look after you.
We are experts in Airbnb which started from looking after our own properties, to friends, to the whole of Bristol and beyond. 

We look forward to having you to stay!

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.84 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: St George is to the east of central Bristol and positioned on the River Avon. The main street (a short walk away) has a range of shops, cafes, restaurants and amenities. The flat is located next to a Bath-Bristol cycle path, a Nature Reserve and Troopers' Hill, with views over Bristol. A beautiful riverside restaurant/bar is located a short walk along the river (open Spring - Autumn). The city centre is a short taxi drive away.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.89 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Very close to the great Gloucester Rd, one of Bristols greatest streets. A fantastic village feel with all the features you would expect to see that you can lose yourself in.

Many great restaurants from around the world, multiple pubs to choose from, specialty shops and local groceries.
host_about:
Hi,  Im Andrew

A lost Aussie living in the UK for over 15 years. have been using Airbnb right from the start for most of my travels and now a host with them as well. 

One of my  lives objectives is to have traveled more countries than my age, so thats a few! 

Love to explore, try new things and meet people along the way.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Condo in City of Bristol · ★4.87 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Portland square is one of Bristol’s oldest squares so it’s really pretty. The square is a park which is a great place to relax. On the square there is church that is lit up at night and is now a circus school and events space. Behind the church you can find a children’s park. The location is very quiet although you are in the city centre.

The shopping centre where there is a cinema & restaurants Cabot Circus is 1 minute walk from my apartment. Sainsbury’s supermarket is 2 minutes away via Cabot Circus.

St. Paul’s and Stokes Croft are really trendy areas with lots of cafes, bars and street art. Castle Park and the waterfront is less than 5 minute walk and you can walk to the harbour in under 10 minutes via the artist quarter of The Christmas Steps.
host_about:
I’m Bristolian so feel free to ask for recommendations for places to visit and where to eat 

I am renting the whole apartment & garden exclusively. Please note my cat and I no longer live in the apartment. 

The apartment is in the perfect location for exploring the city on foot & has many great places for food and drink nearby including the Artist Residence Hotel next door who serve great coffee, cocktails & brunch.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.83 · 4 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Bishopston is one of the most family friendly areas of Bristol and also has the advantage of being seven minutes walk from the bustling Gloucester Road. This high street has cafes, bars, independent shops, restaurants, butchers, bakers and food stores - it's known for being one of the best independent shopping streets in the country. Just at the end of our street is a co-op supermarket which has everything you need at hand, whilst at the other end, just around the corner, is St Andrews Park, great for relaxing, paddling and playing. A nice walk is to the City Farm in nearby St Werburghs, which boasts a very characterful cafe with healthy food, next door to a pub renowned for its Sunday dinners. Bristol is a great place to visit, with the harbourside being especially packed with activities, and is surrounded by lovely countryside.
host_about: I like culture, cycling and travelling.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.67 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
Condo in City of Bristol · ★4.98 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Old Market is very centrally located between the main train station Temple Meads, the waterside area Welsh Back  and the main Shopping centre Cabot Circus (15 minutes  walk to each one ). It's a colourful and bohemian area a mix of faded historical architecture and modern Bristolian urban street culture.
host_about: Profesional educated English guy., with good travel experience of France, Spain, Italy
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.81 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: Whether you choose to benefit from the in-house entertainment or not, you have lots to enjoy and explore right on the doorstep.  Clifton Village, the Suspension Bridge, Bristol Harbour, Park Street, the Downs, the City Centre, The Hippodrome, Bristol Old Vic and Tobacco Factory are all within walking distance!
host_about:
Hello!

My name is Mike and I'm the General Manager of the Bristol Improv Theatre (UK). 

I love to travel and have seen the hosting experience from both sides, as a guest and as the manager of our theatre, which has its own accommodation.

The Bristol Improv Theatre (or BIT) is an independent, community-led, not-for-profit arts venue, run by artists , which hosts events, shows and classes year round. 

We are very lucky to have accommodation as part of the venue, which we offer to visiting artists, directors, workshop leaders and occasionally, visitors to Bristol. So, if you are passing through Bristol and are looking for an unique and exciting place to stay, on behalf of the all of us at the BIT, I will be delighted to welcome you.

I look forward to meeting you!

Mike
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Clifton is a beautiful area to explore with many restaurants, shops, coffee shops and bars. We are 5 mins walk from Clifton Downs and not far from Brunel's famous suspension bridge.
host_about: We are Damian and Stephen, a friendly English couple who like to travel. We enjoy staying in various places from Hostels to hotels and Airbnb of course! Both of us like music festivals, camping and good food and wine.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in Bristol · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Neighbourhood is lovely! Good community spirit, neighbours will say hello and look out for each other and safe. All essentials can be found on high st less than a minute walk away. Best chip shop in Bristol but i’m biased.

By car you can get to town in 15-20mins dependent on traffic, or the motorway is less than 5 mins the opposite direction.

By bus it’s 25-30mins to town with direct links to Southmead hospital, Cribbs causeway (out of town shopping) and town centre.

By train it’s just a few stops to Clifton, Redland, Montpelier and Bristol temple meads.

Surrounding area has the local high street with all amenities, lovely green parks with historic attractions such as Kingsweston House (lots of weddings!), Blaise castle just a few minutes away.

I can give advice on transport, bars, restaurants, Bristol area! May be able to drop you in town for a night out if i’m around!
host_about:
Young at heart, creative but professional 40something host, 3 cats, no kids, v. clean & houseproud as I spent the best part of a year refurbing house, I have a reasonably good social life so i try not to be in all the time, so you get some peace! 

It’s pretty quiet & calm in my house, the perfect retreat from outside world... Oh and I’m vegan but not preachy...

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The area is quiet, with lots of families. There is a supermarket and convenience stores nearby and within a short drive. Lots of independant shops, second hand shops are also a short walk or drive away.

A 10-15 minute stroll gets you to the harbourside, city centre and all the attractions of Bristol. Bedminster railway station is 5 minutes walk away and Temple Meads mainline railway station is 10 minutes walk (with links to Bath). Within 15 minutes drive you can be out of the city and into North Somerset.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.57 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Our 3 bed townhouse is located just off the historical Portland Square in an amazing central location. You can walk to Cabot Circus within just a few minutes!

The Townhouse is placed minutes from Cabot Circus, close to St Pauls and Stokes Croft, as well as an amazing stay if you are needing to get to the pub!
host_about: A person who would like to know more people and learn different cultures.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.71 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
A few minutes’ walk takes you to the Harbourside area, home to the Arnolfni Centre for Contmeporary Art, M-Shed museum, Brunel’s SS Great Britain and a wide choice of bars and restaurants, including Cargo, where a host of food and drink outlets are housed in shipping containers.

The Sunday Times named Bristol as the best place to live in 2017, describing it as “cool, classy and supremely creative”.
Bristol is host to events throughout the year including the annual Harbourside Festival and concerts at Queens Square and Millennium Square. If you’re a fan of Banksy and other street artists, Bristol is the undisputed capital of street art and grafti in the UK, with examples on show all around the central areas.
host_about: Well traveled, professional guy who enjoys the unconventional. A responsible and efficient host whilst friendly and genuine. I am here to assist should you so need.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.80 · 4 bedrooms · 6 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
As previously mentioned, your home-from-home is perfectly located for every brilliant thing Bristol has to offer: live music, festivals, the Universities and art schools, galleries and museums, bakeries and coffee shops, restaurants, pubs and bars, and the rich and diverse history of this city on the water.

Our neighbours are the celebrated, world-class St George's concert venue and Brandon Hill, one of the most lovely of Bristol's parks. The spectacular Clifton Suspension Bridge is a walk away and there is so much on offer throughout the year that you won't want to leave.
host_about:
I'm Jess and I live with my husband, Sam, our three children, and my mother-in-law... who is also the landlady!  This is her home, and it will be yours too for the duration of your stay.  You will find it to be a most beautiful and magical place to spend time.

This is an open home and we are artists, designers, musicians, cooks, travellers, and writers. The house is a reflection of our creativity and lust for life.

As a family, Sam and I took the children back-packing through Europe and Airbnb was a fantastic way to stay in wonderful places on our shoestring budget.  Now it's our turn to return the favour to others.  We love meeting new people, and welcome you and your stories to fill our home.  

As hosts, we can be on hand if you'd like a hands-on experience, or we'll leave you alone if you'd like some space!
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.97 · 4 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Montpelier is a lovely bohemian quarter in the heart of Bristol with great restaurants and street art.  St Andrew's park is just around the corner and within a 30 minute drive you can get to gorgeous Somerset or Gloucestershire countryside and villages.
host_about: I'm a TV Producer and I live in Bristol with my husband and 2 young children
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: The beauty of the surroundings..  Family friendly neighbourhood close to Hanham and St.George. Easy access to the cycle path in to town (15 mins). Access to local shops and restaurants too and easy exit into the beautiful surrounding countryside too.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.91 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
St Werburghs is a real hidden gem. Despite being pretty central and a 20 minute walk to the centre of town as well as the fantastic Gloucester Road which is jam-packed with independent shops and restaurants, St Werburghs is a really green space with a village feel. The City Farm is close by as well as Narroways Nature Reserve and a community garden at the bottom of the road. It is lively and has lots of great cafe's, pubs and restaurants and is incredibly friendly and relaxed.

Unlike many areas of Bristol, you can park for free on all residential streets in St Werburghs including my street. Spaces on my street can be tricky to find however so be prepared to park on any of the neighbouring streets! There is a bus stop on Sevier Street which also takes you to the centre of town - around 30 minutes total journey time.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.60 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: Diverse and vibrant area
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Townhouse in City of Bristol · ★4.97 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: This is the peaceful, residential section of the harbour area, no traffic, no club or party noise. Most of the harbour area is buzzing and therefore noisy, but we are in a lovely quiet section around Bathhouse Basin, which is a mini-marina. We have the UK's 'best restaurant' on our doorstep - Casamia, beat 1200 others to be top of Gordon Ramsay's competition list.  It's a conservation area with beautiful character buildings all around. It's perfectly placed for Temple Meads Station, the city centre and the thriving business quarter around the station.
host_about: I work in education, as a filmmaker and writer.  I live and work from home so am usually there to greet and assist when needed. I have been doing airbnb since September 2017 and am now adding my second spare bedroom to my offer.  I hope to welcome all kinds of friendly and considerate travellers and business people to my home in this lovely part of Bristol.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Bed and breakfast in City of Bristol · ★4.83 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
property_type: Private room in bed and breakfast

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.86 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.76 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
Home in City of Bristol · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: As stated above, I live close to the Gloucester Rd area of Bristol which is renowned for its independent shops ,cafes, pubs  and bars. There are also a number of the usual chains. My neighbourhood is very friendly and it is a fairly typical residential set up with many young families now occupying the street . There’s nearly always a space to park in the road and no charge to do so
host_about:
Hi

name: Tiny home in Center City of Bristol · ★4.65 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Walking down Picton Street, the first shopping centre of the old city, you will be greeted by local artist Alex Lucas's pink mural "Welcome to Montpelier". There are a number of gorgeous historic buildings nearby. 5 minutes’ walk takes you to St. Werburghs, an oasis of tranquillity in the heart of the city. Highlights include the city farm, self-build community ‘The Yard’, numerous allotments, Gaudi-like cafe and local's favourite pub The Farm. 10 minutes’ walk takes you to the organic supermarket and cafe Better Foods.

Richmond Road is a particularly special place, with an eclectic mix of residents. We have a home for the learning disabled, people from various religious and ethnic backgrounds, grand colourful Grade 2 listed buildings and Daddy G/Massive Attack's tastefully period home and garden. We came here partly because it reminded us of Ladbroke Grove & Portobello Road- positive and creative people from all over the world. The excellent Cadbury pub is 30 seconds down t
neighbourhood: Center City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.85 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: We live in a quiet corner of a very vibrant area. The immediate neighbourhood of Cotham offers some of Bristols most beautiful streets and views. With a very short walk down the hill there is Stokes Croft and Montpelier which is home to Bristol's cultural quarter, outdoor gallery and celebrated restaurants, cafes and bars. Within a 10 minute walk you can reach St Pauls, traditionally Bristol's Jamaican quarter and St Werburghs, home of City farm and the pioneering self build communities and Gloucester Road, hoasting more independent shops than any other street in Britain. Other areas of interest and within a 25 minute walk are Clifton, with its fine architecture, charming lido, iconic bridge and views across the gorge; And the harbourside, perfect for a stroll, with waterside restaurants, bars and market, home to Arnol fini and Millenium Square and a wealth of maritime history.
host_about: My name is Anna, I live in Bristol with my partner Matt and our daughter Eva, before Bristol I was screen printing in London and am currently trying to work out whats next after being full time mum for the last couple of years! I love making and creating and the great outdoors but with a penchant for the creature comfits of city life!
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.79 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
A 20-minute walk from the train station and 30 minutes to Bristol City Centre. This is a quiet suburban area, near a main road and bus route into the city centre, via the train station.

Bristol is a thriving city, with bustling waterfront, green spaces, and all the city centre entertainment you would expect of a popular city.

You're going to want to visit Bristol for its history, food scene, ton of activities and proximity to the gorgeous Southwest (Devon, Dorset, Somerset. Think clotted cream tea, beautiful coastline, Cheddar Gorge, and quaint villages), the Cotswolds, and Wales. London is only an hour and a half away by train.

Locally, I love Victoria Park, The 'Bocabar' for a beer or glass of wine, 'A Cappella' for great Italian coffee and breakfast, 'Assana' for a unique and tasty Moroccan dinner, with friendly service, and 'Farrows', the best Fish and Chip shop ever (Sells gluten-free battered fish. People travel for miles!)

We also ha
host_about: I'm sociable and friendly and can also keep to myself. My Airbnb visits are usually for a workshop so I'll be in bed early and pretty quiet!
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.30 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Our basement studio flat is located in the heart of picturesque Clifton Village very close to the famous Clifton Suspension Bridge. Thoughtfully decorated in a contemporary style, our studio is a perfect base for both business and leisure travellers alike. The bridge is almost within sight, and Bristol Zoo is around 10 minutes' walk away.
host_about:
Hi We're Gabrielle and Mark 

We moved to Bristol in 2000 and apart from a four year stint in San Francisco, have lived here ever since. We love the laid back vibe of Bristol and the mix of great cultural things to do, the variety of architecture and neighbourhoods as well as the closeness to beautiful countryside. 

We hope you enjoy your stay!
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.90 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Montpelier is the most colourful and creative neighbourhood in Bristol. The neighbourhood is overflowing with street art, art collectives, art shops and galleries. Food is equally well represented! Whilst you may not be able to sit indoors there are still LOADS of delicious takeaway options at all our local restaurants and lots of lovely green open spaces to relax and eat your yummy food in.

Eat and drink
Independent enterprise is one aspect of Montpelier/Stokes Croft that makes it so unique. There are some fantastic places to eat drink and pass time. so many brilliant spots, I've listed a few below, but there is so much more! Just go for a walk, follow your nose and let the good vibes lead you :)

Cafes (to name a few…)
Bristolian Café, 2 Picton Street BS6 5QA
Literally at the bottom on Wellington Lane, this café has fantastic atmosphere, always buzzing, good breakfasts and lunches and decent beer, wine cocktail selection.

Arts House,
host_about: Lover of Montpelier and all things Bristol.  Originally from the East Coast of the USA. Part time babysitter of my two lovely grandchildren who live next door. My daughter Poppy used to live in this flat but I have spent a bit of time making it my own which I hope the photographs reflect!
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

host_about: Hi, I'm Louise :) I used to run and own an award winning wine bar in the centre of Bristol, as you can imagine I'm very passionate about wine and am currently studying towards its highest certification. Beyond that I enjoy spending time with my friends and family, eating out, cooking and am guilty of the occasional box set binge!

neighborhood_overview:

There are lots of lovely cafes and trendy eateries a few minutes walk from the flat on either side- Picton Street, or Mina Road. It is in walking distance of the St Werburghs Farm, parks and places to walk.
host_about:
I am from both England and France. I work as a childminder and make children's books for Short Moments for Kids. I am passionate about the nature of mind and supporting projects that bring benefit to the world. My husband John plays in a band called Massive Vibe Live!. We sometimes travel to go on tour or to go away in our camper van as love nature retreats.
When in Bristol, we live in this flat at the Courtyard, a new eco build, it is a very cosy space, in which we spend a lot of time drawing and making music, and we hope our guests will like it.

neighborhood_overview:
The location of our space is a massive bonus. We live in a friendly, bohemian, family community with lots of lovely cafes and restaurants with outdoor seating, pubs, parks, a climbing centre and an organic supermarket.

The site sits in the heart of the unusual Ashley Vale, next to a city farm and surrounded by allotments on one side and a nature reserve on the other. You'd be forgiven for forgetting that you're in the middle of a city with easy access to both the centre and the M32, to get out to surrounding areas.
host_about: Hello, I live in Bristol, UK with my two children and my partner Ollie. I’m an advocate for children and young people’s rights in education and universal basic income. Ollie and I are also both drag kings and cabaret producers.

name: Home in Redland · ★4.82 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The house is in the heart of Redland, just off Chandos Road. Redland is an affluent, leafy, sought after area of Bristol which sits astride two very different worlds - elegant Clifton with its famous bridge on one side, with the more Bohemian Gloucester Road, Montpelier, St Werburghs areas on the other. Vibrant, multicultural Easton is just five minutes away on the local train (Stapleton Road station).

Local amenities start a minute's level walk away. The highly-acclaimed Wilsons and Little Hollows restaurants on Chandos Road are both Michelin listed. There's a new upscale bakery on Chandos Road and a local shop. There are wider choices around Whiteladies Road/Cotham Hill and Gloucester Road/Zetland Road, each 10-12 minutes' walk.

The immediate neighbourhood has an eclectic mix of professionals, academics (no student houses in the road) and eccentric creatives. You're likely to hear some of my neighbours play classical music! Apart from that it's extremely quiet.<
host_about: Proud custodian of "The Pile" since 1996. No better place from which to enjoy this chaotic, beautiful city.

name: Serviced apartment in Bristol · ★4.24 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
On your doorstep you have Bristol's shopping outlet. Cabot Circus is a uniquely-designed, modern shopping centre. Here you will find all your high-street favourites and the west's flagship House of Fraser expands all three floors. Your Cabot Circus shopping experience continues across Penn Street into Quakers Friars, named after the friar that still stands in the midst of high-end, designer shops and eateries, including Apple, All Saints, COS, Oliver Bonas and many more. The piazza is surrounded by restaurants and cafes and in the warm months you can dine alfresco as water fountains dance playfully in front of you.

Gloucester Road (also known as Bristol's Independent District) is credited as the longest street of independent shops in Europe. This colourful high street meanders up from Stokes Croft through the areas of Redland, St Andrews, Bishopston and Horfield, supporting a fantastic array of shops, beauty salons, cafes and bars.

You really can spend the whole d
host_about:
Hello! and welcome to our profile.

Your Apartment- Bristol, is passionate about providing unique living spaces that make guests feel more at home than at a hotel. A family run business, we have established ourselves as Bristol’s leading provider of serviced apartments.

Offering a wide selection of boutique-style serviced apartments at affordable prices. These range from studios to 3-bedrooms, with each apartment interior individually designed by our in-house creative team.

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.98 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Our house is a  three minute stroll from Gloucester Road, the longest road of independent shops in the UK,  jam-packed with cafes, pubs, restaurants and artisan bakeries.  We are also a ten minute walk from St Andrews Park, complete with cafe and paddling pool in the summer months! And only fifteen minutes walk from Gloucestershire County Cricket Ground. Walk ten minutes towards town and you will be in graffiti central on Stokes Croft-Banksy and many others have left their mark here.
host_about:
We are a small family with two children aged 15 and 12. We love to travel and are always thinking about our next trip!

We live in Bishopston, Bristol close to Gloucester Road, reputed to be the longest street of independent businesses in England. Bristol is a fantastic city and it is a privilege to show a small part of it to our guests.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.90 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
You are within walking distance of The Downs (15 minutes), Whiteladies Road (6 minutes), the University (10 minutes), a lovely park (6 minutes), Gloucester Road (15 minutes) and Clifton (20 minutes). The city centre is also a short 20 minute walk, and the University is only round the corner, 10minutes walking distance.

Additionally, you are surrounded by great transport links (Clifton Down Station, Redland Station and numerous bus stops) taking you wherever you would like around the city.
host_about: Hello I moved to Bristol 5 years ago with my husband. We are absolutely enchanted both with the city and the convenient location of our home that we tend with loving care. I was born in Mexico and my husband in South Africa. We have lived in Latin America, Continental Europe and Asia for much of our life; before Bristol, in Thailand, travelling widely across Asia. We thrive on meeting people from a wide range of cultures in a welcoming home.

Business: If you are visiting Bristol on business, you'll be very close to BAe Systems, Rolls-Royce, airbus and Southmead Hospital. A short drive to Aztec West and Cribbs Causeway Mall make this an ideal location.

Leisure: The quaint and bustling villages of Westbury-on-Trym & Henleaze are under 5 minutes in the car and thriving with shops, pubs and restaurants.

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.57 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: A quiet, but centrally located, street. City centre, bars, restaurants, the famous harbourside, and iconic landmarks, are all within a few minutes' walk.

name: Townhouse in City of Bristol · ★4.88 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
The neighbourhood is friendly and welcoming; most houses are Victorian like mine, but the ones opposite are old miners cottages from the 1860's.

Much of community life centres around Victoria Park which is a large lovely green space at the end of my road. It has a children's play area, a lovely little café that you can dash to for bacon sarnies in the morning and great views across Bristol.

There are several fantastic local pubs serving food ranging from relaxed pie and mash to a mediaeval banquet style food, or wood fired pizza's. Most guests experience the wonderfully friendly local 'The Windmill' at least once.

There is a city farm a few minutes walk away as well and a meander into the centre of Bristol takes you through the park and you can choose to go easily along the harbourside to see the best of beautiful Bristol.
host_about: I am pretty laid back, enjoy meeting new people and having my house lived in by anyone who comes to stay, love being out in the wilds with a tent or out walking, swing dance fanatic, and nearly always have a good Malbec open. Love a good unicorn! I work in the charity and childcare sector.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Condo in City of Bristol · ★4.75 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This elegant and refined district of Bristol is like a miniature of Bath. Following the terraces, crescents and squares of Georgian and Regency architecture you are led temptingly from Clifton Triangle to Clifton Village along a trail of cafes, bars, restaurants, pubs, shops, chic boutiques and leafy squares.

Boredom will never set in as you share a postcode with some of Bristol’s most famed attractions – Brunel’s Suspension Bridge, Bristol Zoo Gardens, Bristol City Museum and Art Gallery, Bristol Observatory and the sprawling green Durdham Downs (great for walks, runs, or picnics if you’re feeling more relaxed).

Key shopping roads include Whiteladies Road, Princess Victoria Street and Regent Street.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom
