name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.79 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Grand Georgian townhouses line the streets and crescents of affluent, leafy Clifton. Clifton Village is home to upscale boutiques and quirky indie shops, and the buzzing bars and restaurants around Whiteladies Road are packed with students and locals. Clifton Down is popular for kite-flying, and the Bristol Zoo Gardens houses gorillas and meerkats. Brunel’s landmark Clifton Suspension Bridge straddles the Avon Gorge.

name: Townhouse in City of Bristol · ★5.0 · 5 bedrooms · 5 beds · 3.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Here are some of our favourite places to go! Bristol is very family friendly and most places welcome children. We’ve focused mainly on places in our local area as we love it so much and there are fab options but there of course loads of great places in the city centre and around the harbourside too.

AREAS IN BRISTOL

Bishopston – our local neighbourhood. Lovely parks, great independent shops and a wide variety of places to eat and drink
Clifton – gorgeous Victorian part of town, views of the Clifton Suspension Bridge, especially if you take a walk on the Downs
Centre – lots of shopping and eating here
Harbourside – check out waterside pubs and restaurants or one of the galleries or museums (see more below) or take a ferry ride for a different view.


EATING & DRINKING around Bishopston and Stokes Croft
Breakfast, brunch and coffee
- Hobbs House Bakery – delicious baked goods. You can sit in courtyard garden at back and have

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.64 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Redland is an affluent suburb which spreads from Whiteladies Road down to Gloucester Road and neighbours areas such as Cotham, Bishopston and Clifton. From here, you can easily access the vast green expanse of the Durdham Downs, Bristol University and Whiteladies Road – making the area very popular. The houses are typically large Victorian properties ideal for families. Parts almost have a village-like feel where you can find pockets of independent restaurants, bakeries, delicatessens among some excellent local pubs.
host_about: Hey, I'm Patrick. Bristol born and bred. Professional neuroscientist and amateur musician. I'm making my cosy little garden flat in the heart of Bristol available to all you lovely world travellers while I travel the world myself for work. Bristol's an amazing place and I hope you enjoy both the city and your stay in my flat! I want you and future guests to be as happy as possible with your visit, so all feedback welcome - both positive and constructive. :)
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Condo in City of Bristol · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
Gloucester Road is at the heart of Bristol's creative and independent district. It is the longest road of independent shops in Europe and is very proud of its independent spirit. It was recently shortlisted for Britain's Best High Street.

The apartment is located in a perfect spot for eating out and has some great places to go right on the doorstep, including the lovely Hobbs House Bakery. There are also some great pubs and cocktail bars in the area, The Grace pub opposite the apartment is famous for its award winning Sunday roast. Further down the road Filthy Thirteen and The Bootlegger serve dangerously tasty cocktails.

5 mins away is the leafy Victorian St Andrews Park with it’s cute tea van (and toasties), boating lake and plenty of benches to relax and chat. Sundays often sees impromptu music, picnics, juggling or slack rope walking practice happening.
Derby Road is the home of Bristol St Andrews Lawn Bowls and most summer evenings and weekends there a
host_about: Hello, I’m Katie. I have lived in Bristol for over 9 years and work here as an applied Health Researcher. I love to cook and explore the vibrant Bristol food scene. I’m a novice gardener and have recently started a small herb garden on the balcony. I live in a very vibrant and creative area of the city with a great community spirit. Gloucester Road is the longest road of independent shops in Europe including fantastic restaurants and cafes. I love meeting new people and am always happy to give recommendations about exploring the city.

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
Bristol's creative and cultural history makes it unique - Banksy street art, International Balloon Fiesta, Harbourside Festival plus Brunel's iconic SS Great Britain and Clifton Suspension Bridge amongst others. Upmarket Clifton village was the city's Bohemian quarter in the 60s but today people enjoy its chic boutiques, antique shops and relaxed cafes. In the city centre St Nicholas Market offers indoor independent traders and is a melting pot of global street food stalls. More information can be found at the Visit Bristol website.

Locally, the lively, friendly villages of Henleaze and Westbury-on-Trym are easily reached within 15 minutes walk. Each village houses several cafes, independent shops and Co-op and Waitrose supermarkets. There is an Italian restaurant, Morrisons minimarket and hairdresser at the end of the road. Southmead Hospital is within walking distance (approx 15 mins).
host_about: Now that we’ve both retired, my husband and I have undertaken interesting voluntary work which keeps us out of mischief! We also enjoy socialising with friends and family, travelling, the arts, theatre, playing bridge and walking.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in Bristol · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Redland is an attractive residential suburb to the north of the city centre near the Downs. The architecture is predominantly Victorian and it has a wide range of amenities.
There is easy access to a variety of shops, supermarkets, restaurants, cafes and pubs.
host_about: My husband Dermot and I love cycling,we are both regular cyclists here in Bristol and have had cycling holidays abroad. We love to travel and this year visited  some of the national parks of North America. We love  trying different cuisines. I love reading and I am in a local book club. We have met lots of wonderful people through hosting and also  enjoyed being Airbnb guests. It's a great way of getting to know local areas etc. I speak some French. We love our home and living in Bristol and we hope you enjoy it too.

Bristol is well known for its vibrant and multicultural lifestyle. Behind the house is a nice big park and loads of pathways that can take you to the local woodlands. Very good for those who love walking or jogging.

The room is warmly decorated with cosy, clean grey carpets and have a royal feel to it with loads of space and storage, you will definitely feel at home away from from home. The property have big front and back garden which is always maintained. The house is a comfortable house with full amenities. We follow Airbnb’s five-step enhanced cleaning process, which is based on Airbnb’s cleaning handbook.

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.82 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Shops in Clifton Village (5-10 minutes up the hill) including Tesco, Co-op, Delis, Late store/Post Office, Charity shops (6), restaurants (Fish'n'chips, Indian, Thai, Fish, Pizza..), cafes and coffee shops (35 at last count..)
Brunel's Suspension Bridge (of course) about 5 minutes walk up the hill and round the corner.
Clifton Downs start at the Bridge and extend miles along the River Avon, which meets the harbour exit at the bottom of the hill (5 minutes).
You can cross the harbour and walk along the river, stroll along the harbour side into the Centre, , Watershed, Arnolfini, restaurants, clubs, take the cross-harbour ferry to the SS Great Britain and The Matthew, yeah lots of stuff..
You can stroll to Bristol Zoo in 20-25 minutes or take the bus from Clifton Village.
Bus stops in Clifton Village for the City Centre, Redland, Zoo, bus and railway stations and University campuses.

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.97 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview:
Easton is a multi-cultural part of inner city Bristol with its own little high street. It's about a 25 minute walk into the City Centre.
Known for it's strong sense of community, wide variety of cafes, shops and restaurants from Brazilian and Indian to Afro-Carribbean and African, vibrant music scene and lovely open spaces.
Like many inner city areas undergoing regeneration it can be a little scruffy around the edges.
host_about:

Sometimes they'll be a homemade cake, bread or a dish for you to try.

Love Bristol for its vibrant festival, music, arts and food scene.

Travel whenever I can - recent visits to Morocco and Spain

My partner stays overnight sometimes.

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.72 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Just over the river from Temple Meads station, the area is very tranquil, but with easy access to the centre. Cabot Circus shopping centre and the lovely Castle Park are only ten minutes walk away. There is a Starbucks, Wetherspoons and Veeno wine bar nearby, in addition to local pubs like the Barley Mow and the Old Market Assembly.
We now have a Sainburys just two minutes away! Very convenient!
host_about:
Hello!

We are Ana (Spanish living in UK for six years) and Guy (British). Ana is a documentary filmmaker and Guy is an animator. We usually live in Bristol where we are Airbnb hosts but we LOVE to travel the world. Message us if you have any questions! :)
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Condo in Bristol · ★4.89 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
Tiny home in City of Bristol · ★4.88 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: We live in one of the safest streets in Bristol with friendly neighbours and plenty of FREE on street parking. We're just round the corner from IKEA, Eastgate Shopping Centre and a 24hour Tesco Extra. We're not far from the city centre and have two public bus stops just at the end of our road. We also have two bikes that our guests are welcome to use. If you're lucky, we can sometimes be around with our car to drop you where you need to be.
host_about:
Our Mum, Wendy, recently passed away in December 2017 after a short battle with an aggressive cancer. Mum worked as a Social Worker in the Adoption department and ran the AirBnB on the side, with the help of us; her three children (Ruby, Guy & Laurence) and her friends. Laurence named our home "The Wendy Estate" when Mum started sharing our home with AirBnB and various other lodgers she met & supported over the years. 

It was Mum's greatest wish that we continue to host our beloved cabin and treehouse on Airbnb and we hope to do so in a very 'Wendy like' fashion. 

Written by Wendy in 2015 ; "I am a Guardian reading, permaculture type, I work part time, love travelling, all things garden and 20th Century design. I like  sharing my lovely space with other people I am lucky to live in a rural oasis in the heart of a beautiful city which I know really well! "

A little bit about us... 

Ruby is the eldest & bossiest, she'll be making sure the rooms are up to scratch and there's enough tea and coffee in for you. Ruby is trained as a photographer but also knows all the best 'value for money' eateries & how to get about the city on public transport. 


Laurence is he's the music man of the three of us. He will tell you about the best forms of night life & the music culture of Bristol. 

Guy is the money making entrepreneur, he knows how to live a luxurious life and will give you ideas for how to have a truly luxurious time in Bristol.  

We all love food, music, and socialising. We live in a house full of books and many lovely items that make this house & the outbuildings our home and we look forward to continue sharing the 'Wendy Estate' with the rest of the world.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.83 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
There are many great restaurants, bars and cafes close by. Our favourite restaurant is The Soukitchen, we love to shop locally at the deli, greengrocer, fishmonger and butchers which are a 2 minute walk from the house. There is also an Aldi with in a 5 minute walk.

For entertainment check out a show at the Tobacco Factory Theatre or comedy at The Hen & Chicken

It is approx 30 minute walk to the City Centre, 20 minutes to the SS Great Britian and the harbourside.

Ashton Gate Stadium is about 10 minutes walk from the house: The home of Bristol City Football Club and Rugby Clubs as well as a music venue.

neighborhood_overview:
Great location to be based for any visit to Bristol, business or leisure.

The flat is walking distance to most of Bristol’s best attractions - the Clifton Suspension bridge, Brunel's SS Great Britain, Bristol Cathedral, the Old Vic or Hippodrome, Cabot tower & Cabot Circus, to name just a few.

1 minute walk to an M&S and the nearest bus stop.

Within 5 minutes you could walk to a larger Sainsbury’s and Clifton Down train station.
host_about: We lived in the flat for 10 years+ but family life took over so sadly we don’t live there any more. Its a great place to live, right in the heart of the Clifton area, next to cafes and shops, and a stone’s throw from the BBC and university. Great transport links too being 2mins walk from Clifton Down station and buses running frequently up and down Whiteladies on the door step.

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.91 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in BS1 - 400 meters down the road you have the historic Christmas Steps with a selection of unique independently run shops. The same distance in the opposite direction you have the top of Park Street, which is overlooked by the beautiful Wills Memorial Building of Bristol University. Park street offers a range of up market dining and drinking establishments. Many of which are still lively until the early hours. Your are a five minute walk from the waterfront which is the heart and soul of the city offering lots of great places to eat, look out over the water and people watch. Taking a stroll down to the waterside food market every Sunday is a personal favourite.

Even with its central location you will find my apartment a still and relaxing place to be this in my view is what makes it special.

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.97 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
We live in the Lower Knowle area of south Bristol. Our community is extremely friendly and on the border of Totterdown - a bohemian district of colourful, painted houses.

The city itself is a truly vibrant place, busy with cultural events and diverse communities. Bristol is full of historic sights from the Clifton Suspension bridge to the SS Great Britain and has a great reputation for street art (Banksy is from here), live music, festival culture, hot air balloons and world-class food.

As well as great shopping, theatre and cinemas nearby we’re also close to the beautiful open greenery of Ashton Court and fascinating Arnos Vale and in easy reach of the Mendips and Cotswolds.

Easy transport links to Bath, Wells, Bradford on Avon, Glastonbury, Clevedon, Weston Super Mare and Cheddar.

We are lucky enough to live within an easy walk or cycle of the city centre and harbour as well as Temple Meads so why not leave your car behind!
host_about: We are a friendly family of four. I’m dad to a teenager and a very sweet primary schooler. Both my wife and I are musicians and we enjoy cooking and travel. Our family are looking forward to welcoming people into our home.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in Redland · ★4.74 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 2 shared baths
neighborhood_overview:
The house is on a quiet road in Redland, Bristol just off Chandos Road. Redland is an affluent and sought after area of Bristol largely made up of leafy roads with grand old houses. For somewhere with so many peaceful corners and the huge green space of the Downs a short walk away it is remarkably central - the University, BBC and the Centre are within 1 - 1.5 miles. It is also one of very few localities in Bristol with its own station.
Bristol is famed for its diversity and Redland makes up the divide between two very different worlds - elegant Clifton on one side and the more bohemian Gloucester Road corridor on the other, with the arty, alternative Montpelier and St Werburghs areas nearby. Vibrant, multicultural Easton - where the world's first commercial chocolate bar was produced - is a different world yet is just five minutes away on the local train.

The immediate neighbourhood has an eclectic mix of families, professionals, academics (no student houses in the roa
host_about: Proud custodian of "The Pile" since 1996. No better place from which to enjoy this chaotic, beautiful city.

name: Home in Redland · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 2 shared baths
neighborhood_overview:
The house is on a quiet road in Redland, Bristol just off Chandos Road. There's an above average local shop, a good cafe for breakfast and Redland bakery is just a minute's walk away so you're guaranteed fresh bread and pastries!

Chandos Road has several independent restaurants including two Michelin listed ones (one - Wilsons - with a star). There's a comprehensive selection around ten minutes walk away in either direction, around the Cotham Hill/ Whiteladies Road junction in one direction and on the vibrant Gloucester Road / Stokes Croft corridor. The latter is particularly good for eclectic, budget options.

name: Guest suite in City of Bristol · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
THE LOCAL AREA

—Shops, Food, Pubs, Cafes & takeaways—

Shirehampton village/ high street (a short 3 minute drive or 10 minute walk away) covers everything you need from a hardware store, hairdressers, barbers, florist, bakery, butchers, greasy spoons, fish and chips takeaway, kebab and burger takeaway, vets, pet shop, LLOYDS Bank, Boots (Toiletries and Pharmacy).

Ruby Jeans - The Parade is a lovely recently opened Cafe Bar Restaurant in the village, with lovely decor, run by a local couple. Offering brunch, burgers, mains, small plates and Sunday roast menu. Or just grab a coffee and pastry to go. They also stock bread, along with other pantry items.

Co-Op supermarket is the largest supermarket in the village 10 minutes walk away. There is a large Sainsburys supermarket next to the Clifton down train station, a 9 min train away if you don’t have a car and need a wider selection of goods.

Premier Express is a handy convenience store
host_about:
I’m Bristol born and bred, with so much love for the city. I’m a working professional in the arts and community sector and have lots of knowledge about places to visit in Bristol. 

I look forward to offering a comfortable space for guests to kick back and relax in the quiet rural area of Bristol providing amazing transport links to the city and nearby business districts.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.98 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: We are fabulously located in the north of Bristol. It is located 1 min walk from the famous Gloucester Road, which is one of the largest High Streets in the UK and has the most independent shops of any street in the country. It is packed with great places to eat and drink, listen to music and party. Walk for 30-40 mins down the Gloucester Road and you will be in Bristol City Center. There are also buses every few minutes. Bristol Rovers and Gloucester Cricket Ground are both a short walk. Beautiful Clifton and the Clifton Suspension Bridge is a nearby. We are also very close to Filton, which is home to many businesses including; Airbus, Rolls Royce and the MOD.
host_about: Hi, I’m Gaby. I’m a mum of 3 kids and 1 dog! I like travelling, music, good food and fitness.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

A 10 minute walk from the centre, close to a wide range of local restaurants, shops and bars full of characters.

It is also the perfect location if you are visiting the University of Bristol or hospital.

Great for couples, solo adventurers, business travellers and University students.

Home in Bristol City · ★4.93 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.79 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
On your doorstep you have Bristol's shopping outlet. Cabot Circus is a uniquely-designed, modern shopping centre. Here you will find all your high-street favourites and the west's flagship House of Fraser expands all three floors. Your Cabot Circus shopping experience continues across Penn Street into Quakers Friars, named after the friar that still stands in the midst of high-end, designer shops and eateries, including Apple, All Saints, COS, Oliver Bonas and many more. The piazza is surrounded by restaurants and cafes and in the warm months you can dine alfresco as water fountains dance playfully in front of you.

Gloucester Road (also known as Bristol's Independent District) is credited as the longest street of independent shops in Europe. This colourful high street meanders up from Stokes Croft through the areas of Redland, St Andrews, Bishopston and Horfield, supporting a fantastic array of shops, beauty salons, cafes and bars.

You really can spend the whole d
host_about:
Hello! and welcome to our profile.

Your Apartment- Bristol, is passionate about providing unique living spaces that make guests feel more at home than at a hotel. A family run business, we have established ourselves as Bristol’s leading provider of serviced apartments.

Offering a wide selection of boutique-style serviced apartments at affordable prices. These range from studios to 3-bedrooms, with each apartment interior individually designed by our in-house creative team.

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Easton has a lot of character and some original Banksy art can be found. We are very close to the wonderful St Marks Road - home to the fantastic Bristol Sweet Mart for groceries and many great cafes and restaurants, some favourites include No. 12 and Dela. We are also close to The Greenbank pub who have good food and activities worth checking out.

Stapleton Road Train Station and bus links to the City Centre are a stone's throw away.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.88 · 3 bedrooms · 6 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The area has lots to offer without having to jump into a car. The local newly refurbished pub is just 50m away and has live entertainment most weekends.

100m away is the nature reserve-Troopers Hill, this is well known locally for being one of the best viewpoints of the City.

A 10 minute walk will get you to the local high st, here you will find a great selection of pubs, cafes and great restaurants.

A 20 Minute walk gets you to an amazing hid away riverside bar Beeses tea gardens, the problem is that its on the opposite side of the river.. however get this.. they operate there own small boat that will pick you up and take you to the bar and then take you back for a fee of 50 pence!! this is a must see if the sun is shinning!!

neighborhood_overview:
The City Centre and Old City of Bristol are the heart of the city and offer a superb taste of culture, food, history and fantastic shopping opportunities. A trip to Bristol would not be complete without a visit to its central area.
There's a lot crammed into one space including Central Bristol and the Bristol Hippodrome, Bristol Shopping Quarter, Bristol's Old City and Bristol Old Vic, Park Street and College Green and Christmas Steps Arts Quarter. Making this an area to explore to its fullest on your visit.

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.93 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview: This bit of Upper Knowle is lovely  -  its mainly residential, not far from Arnos Vale Park and Cemetery to the north, and Redcatch Park in the other direction.  Moments from the Wells Road and The Broadmead Shopping Centre there are essential shops very close by and the quirky cafes and shops in Totterdown are about half a mile down the hill.  Access to Templemeads and Central Bristol is good (either on foot or regular buses) and its easy to get to Bath and Wells (by car and by bus) from here.  About 10 minutes drive from the M32.
host_about:
I live in Bristol and teach yoga.  I've used AirBNB several times with great pleasure - it feels much better than being in an anonymous hotel.  
I travel a lot - in the UK and Europe.  And I've made good friends with one or two or my AirBNB hosts.  
I used to live in Sussex and regularly hosted Airbnbers in my house there.  So I know what both sides of the transaction are like.  I hope I'm as good a guest as I'd like my guests to be.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.86 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The Flat is located in what is quite possibly Bristols most photographed street of coloured houses. Cliftonwood is one of Bristols best communities, hidden away on the hillside between Clifton village and the waterfront. This quiet colorful street is away from the hustle and bustle but just a short stroll up the hill to the lovely Restaurants, shops and amenities of Clifton village. The flat is opposite the Clifton wood community Gardens and just a 5 minute wander down to the riverside. From here you can walk along the water into town (10 mins) or take a ferry boat into the city center for more Great restaurants, Theatres, Museums and shopping. It is approximately 15 minutes walk to Clifton suspension Bridge and across the gorge to Ashton Court deer park if you fancy a stroll in the countryside.
There is lots to see and do and the guest welcome pack will help you find some of our favourite restaurants, and places to see in the city.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.77 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Easton is a friendly and diverse area of Bristol, which I'm sure you'll love. There are great local pubs and restaurants, from my friendly local The Whitehall Tavern, to the more upmarket Bristol Spirit just around the corner. Make sure to visit St Mark's Road to grab a coffee, stop off for a Thali or get lost in the Indian supermarket.
host_about:
I work in maths education but I'm also quite creative and I'm into all kinds of making. I have quite an impressive fabric stash! I also love to dance. A lot of my travelling is to dance events around Europe. There's nothing better than learning new ways to dance in beautiful places.

I've done a fair bit of travelling around Europe, Africa and North America but more recently I've been exploring closer to home and am enjoying discovering beautiful places in the UK. I like my own space but I'm also a sociable person. And I love real coffee and a good breakfast with friends.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Condo in City of Bristol · ★4.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are located in Clifton, which is a safe, upmarket area with professionals and students alike.

Just a short walk away is Brandon Hill which is perfect for walks and picnics, welcoming human and beast alike.
This is also where the iconic Cabot Tower is located. The tower is 32 m high and has 2 viewing platforms open to the public, accessible through a spiral staircase providing a perfect vantage point, with great views in all directions.

Going deeper into Clifton, towards the Clifton suspension bridge, you will find a variety of traditional shops and restaurants.

Going the other way, Park Street and Queen’s Road are full of boutiques, music and book shops, bars, clubs, and restaurants. Here, you can also find iconic landmarks such as Wills Memorial Building, Bristol Museum & Art Gallery and an artwork ‘Well Hung Man’ made by world's renowned graffiti artist - Banksy.
host_about: My girlfriend and I have lived in Bristol for the last couple of years while we are studying at the university. I enjoy cooking and going on park walks/runs.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Boutique hotel in City of Bristol · ★4.75 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
host_about:
Bristol's only boutique art hotel, partnered with the Square Club and Square Kitchen, this hotel offers you a stylish and comfortable stay on one of Bristol's most historic Georgian Squares. With a convenient central location that offers respite from the bustle of Bristol, stay with us make the most of the city. 

The Berkeley offer you the option to check-in and out online so that all you need to do is collect your key, minimising the time you spend at reception. You can contact the reception team through a messaging app on your own phone to make it as easy as possible to get what you need.

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.74 · 7 bedrooms · 14 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview: higgihaus@hampton (#46) is a mere stone's throw from Cotham Hill and the Whiteladies Road, both chock full of shops, restaurants, coffee shops, leisure facilities (including a cinema and gym) and all the transport options you’ll likely need when staying in our awesome city (including the train at Clifton Down). The Downs (400 acres of amazing parkland) is a hop, skip and a jump away in one direction and the city centre is a short walk in the other. Clifton Village, the Gloucester Road, Stokes Croft and the Harbourside are all easily reached on foot. The BBC, Bristol Royal Infirmary and Bristol University are all nearby.
host_about:
At higgihaus we're on a mission to deliver the sort of accommodation we love to stay in when we're travelling - comfortable, convivial, achingly stylish and that somehow manages to capture that elusive 'it feels good, but I'm not sure why' feeling. 

Founded by Luke Spikes in 2017, higgihaus will be bringing its unique brand of 'place to stay' to urban locations across the United Kingdom. For now, we're focused on Bristol and Cardiff and would love for you to stay with us when you, your family, and friends visit these awesome cities.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, Bristol, United Kingdom

name: Serviced apartment in City of Bristol · ★4.79 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Townhouse in City of Bristol · ★4.99 · Studio · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
The House is situated on a quiet street, just off the popular vibrant North Street which has a number of great restaurants cafes, bars, and shops including the wonderful Marks Artisan Bakery and cafe,The Souk Kitchen (booking advisable),The Tobacco Factory Theatre and bar and the Comedy Box at the Hen and Chicken.

Further down the street there are a number of independent shops including book, record and vintage shops.
Greville Smyth Park is 5 minutes away and has a nice playground. A further 20 minute walk takes you into Ashton Court.
The Tourist Information Centre is a 25 minute walk away

20 minutes walk away is the harbourside, SS Great Britain, Gaol Ferry steps with its funky container bars and foodie shops, Museums, Arnolfini Art space and Galleries. You can also catch a ferry around the city.
host_about: I am retired and  like the freedom this gives me to travel. I use Airbnb’s as a guest and this has inspired me to host.

The village had a range of local shops, some of which are very novel and interesting. There are small major chain supermarkets open from early until late as well as delicatessens and fresh produce suppliers such as Reg the Veg!
.... of course there is an award winning fish & chip shop and other takeaway option ... Indian, Chinese, Pizza, Japanese etc ....

neighborhood_overview:
The flat is located in the Totterdown area of Bristol. This is a mainly residential area, with plenty of independent shops, restaurants, cafes and bars within easy walking distance.

The flat is also close to three parks - Victoria Park is the closest (at the bottom of the road - 5 minutes walk), Perrett's Park is 10 minutes walk, School Road Park is 8 minutes walk.

The flat is 10-15 minutes walk from Bristol Temple Meads station, 25 minutes walk from Wapping Wharf (harbourside), or 30 minutes walk from Cabot Circus (shopping). Alternatively, the flat is close to a bus stop or just grab an Uber.

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: A leafy suburb in West Bristol, close to the historic Blaise Castle estate, Kings Weston House and only 2 miles from Clifton and the Downs.  For those visiting students at the University we are very close to the halls of residence in Stoke Bishop BS9.  For those working we are also not to far from Avonmouth and about 4 miles from Air Bus and the MOD.
host_about: Being a host with AirBnB means I get to meet lots of interesting and lovely people and hear about their travels and adventures.  I've travelled around the world myself but now work from home running my own business.  I'm  super sporty, love tennis and most sports and always see the glass as half full.  I've recently bought and completely renovated this lovely house in this wonderful part of Bristol and it's nice to be able to share it with other people who are passing through.

name: Home in Shirehampton · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 0 shared baths
neighborhood_overview:
Neighbourhood is lovely! Good community spirit, neighbours will say hello and look out for each other and safe. All essentials can be found on high st less than a minute walk away. Best chip shop in Bristol but i’m biased.

By car you can get to town in 15-20mins dependent on traffic, or the motorway is less than 5 mins the opposite direction.

By bus it’s 25-30mins to town with direct links to Southmead hospital, Cribbs causeway (out of town shopping) and town centre.

By train it’s just a few stops to Clifton, Redland, Montpelier and Bristol temple meads.

Surrounding area has the local high street with all amenities, lovely green parks with historic attractions such as Kingsweston House (lots of weddings!), Blaise castle just a few minutes drive away.

I can give advice on transport, bars, restaurants, Bristol area! May be able to drop you in town for a night out if i’m around!
host_about:
Young at heart, creative but professional 40something host, 3 cats, no kids, v. clean & houseproud as I spent the best part of a year refurbing house, I have a reasonably good social life so i try not to be in all the time, so you get some peace! 

It’s pretty quiet & calm in my house, the perfect retreat from outside world... Oh and I’m vegan but not preachy...

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.51 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
host_about: I am very sociable, honest and kind.

name: Tiny home in City of Bristol · ★4.98 · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The local area is a melting pot of all things good! Local schools and families, leafy parks and tree lined streets, fabulous Michelin star restaurants and independent traders, more pubs, bars and restaurants than you can count, the Clifton suspension bridge, the list just goes on and on.

Most of our guests have made plans before they arrive, but if you are new to Bristol, had a change in plan or need any advice on what to do and where to go, let us know what your interests are and we will do our best to help.
host_about:
Runner, coastal beach walker, campervan enthusiast and dad to three. 
I'm a regular airbnb guest and host. I love exploring and enjoy having guests to stay with us in a wonderful part of Bristol.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.97 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: We are close to lots of local amenities (but also out of hearing range) from bars, cafes and shops. Easy access to Ashton Court, Ashton Gate Stadium, a 10 minute train ride to Bath Spa and easy access to Cardiff etc.
host_about: Travelling here, there and everywhere...
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.99 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Clifton is a lovely part of Bristol. We are 5 minutes walk from Clifton Village with its bars, cafes, restaurants and shops and the world famous Clifton Suspension Bridge. We are 15 minutes walk from the Clifton Triangle and the main buildings of Bristol University. We are a 25 minute walk from the Bower Ashton campus of UWE and from Ashton Court Estate.

In fact, a 20 minute walk east gets you to the heart of Bristol's shopping district and 25 minutes west gets you into the North Somerset Countryside.

Our road is a hill and the entrance to the flat is down some steps, so this may not be suitable for people with mobility challenges.
host_about: I am an artist, my husband and I have lived in Bristol for 15 years. We love the arts, the countryside, cooking and our allotment.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The area is in he gentrification process and has a gorgeous park just 5 minutes away (St George) and some cracking food outlets (The Lockup, Faraway Tree, Loaf and Volunteer Tavern are all close by). Old Market - recently voted the Sunday Times "coolest" area - is just a 20 minute walk away.

If you like walking there is a lovely walk down the river to Beesees (only open in the summer) and Chequers Inn.

There are LOADS of buses into town (bus stop is 2 minute walk away) and Lawrence Hill station is an 8 minute walk away. Bristol Temple Meads is 25 minutes on foot, or 10 minutes (if that) in a cab.
host_about:
Hello Fellow AirBnBer! 

I am a very laid back, experienced Air Bnb host obsessed with my guests’ comfort during their stay. I have bags of energy and live a busy life, and use Air BnB when traveling and at home. 

I love sports, languages, dance, multiculturalism and curious stories (and hosting!). I am open minded and inquisitive but a traditionalist at heart, and value good manners and kindness above all.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

host_about:
Hello we are Hopewell and welcome to our profile. We are dedicated to making sure you enjoy your stay in one of our many homes, be that in the city centre, Clifton or beyond.
We are here to help you enjoy your time with us and get the best out of what Bristol has to offer. 
Our team really has great knowledge of the area so please feel free to ask us any questions.  We are all really passionate about our great city, and are excited about others coming to explore all it has to offer.
Everyone has a role to play in the team, so there is always someone to look after you.
We are experts in Airbnb which started from looking after our own properties, to friends, to the whole of Bristol and beyond. 

We look forward to having you to stay!

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.58 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is perfectly placed just a 5 minute walk from Clifton village where you can find an abundance of independent shops, café’s & bars!  One of Bristol’s most recognisable structures – the Clifton suspension bridge is just a 8 minute walk away or you can head to the observatory and take in the views of the bridge and city! The iconic Bristol harbourside is a 24 minute walk away or a fun way to explore the city is to use a Voi scooter!
host_about: I’m friendly, reasonably and easy going so I hope to be able to accommodate the needs of your stay.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.88 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: We are about 15 minutes drive from an out of town shopping centre - The Mall at Cribbs Causeway - and about 25 minutes from Bristol city centre, where there is some fabulous shopping at Cabot Circus,  2 theatres (The Hippodrome and The Old Vic), a historic harbourside with many restaurants, pubs and cafes and several museums.  The Bristol Downs and Clifton Suspension Bridge are about 10  minutes drive away and both well worth a visit.  We are also not too far from the seaside with Clevedon pier and sea front just 30 minutes drive away.  We are in easy reach of South Wales, and now that the Severn Bridge is toll free it's easy to just hop over.  There are lots of walks literally on our doorstep and cafes and local shops within walking distance.
host_about: Nurse, mum, runner & baker :)

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.89 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the centre of Bristol most beautiful neighbourhood.

Clifton village is a very special place, with its grand architecture, chic cafes, restaurants, pubs and bars. Not to mention the incredible Avon Gorge and the suspension bridge.

We are also only 5 minutes walk from the shops, restaurants, bars and clubs of Clifton triangle and the Clifton down area.

Hospital Doctor living in Bristol. I love to travel for the great food, countryside and sports activities.

I am English and I speak conversational French and Spanish.

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.96 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: We love totterdown with its colourful terraced Victorian properties. It's brimming with great pubs and restaurants  and little independent cafes . We have an excellent bakery and fruit and veg shop on our street which we couldn't do without . We love walking though Victoria park where you can look across the Bristol skyline and often see hot air balloons floating overhead. An excelent place to stop for a coffee or head to the Victoria park pub for one of the best Sunday roasts in the city .
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in Totterdown · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Totterdown is a very cosy little hub a stones throw away from the city. Peaceful enough to get a goodnights sleep and feel safe in the neighbourhood, but also very practical plenty of local amenities.

Tesco express (open 7am till 10pm) - 0.2 miles away - 3 minute walk

Co-op supermarket - 0.3 miles - 5 minute walk in the other direction
(A nice organic store also next door)

Oxford Pub - 0.2 miles away

Temple meads train station - 0.8miles - 14 minutes

Victoria Park - 0.5 miles - 8 minutes

Perrett’s Park - 0.2 miles - 4 minutes (great sunset view)

Arnos Vale 0.7 miles 14 minutes
host_about: Fun and respectful

name: Cottage in Clifton · ★4.91 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview: There is so much to do in Bristol that we are sure visitors will return again and again. Over the Summer we have festival after festival in the Harbourside, Ashton Court's Balloon Festival, St Paul's Carnival, and Ashton Vale stadium to name but a few. We have many theatres within walking distance of the cottage as well as fabulous landmarks such as the Clifton Suspension Bridge and Bristol Cathedral. You are spoilt for choice for restaurants - we especially recommend Bar 44, The Albion, Pump House, Gambas, and Riverstation - as well as bars, such as the iconic Avon Gorge (Hotel Du Vin) with its wonderful views across the suspension bridge and gorge.

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.90 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Head north of the centre to find hip nightlife, independent traders and a bohemian vibe on Gloucester Road and Stokes Croft. Take a stroll around bohemian Stokes Croft, often referred to as Bristol's cultural quarter. Discover unusual shops, great pubs, real clubs, fabulous food and a wealth of artist studios and ever-changing exhibitions.
In fact the whole area resembles an outdoor gallery with colourful graffiti that continually transforms its walls and buildings. You might see some great artwork today – but by the time you want to show it to your friends tomorrow it has miraculously vanished or changed into a completely new picture. Keep your eyes open for some of Banksy's best known pieces, such as the famous Mild, Mild, West, which is next to The Canteen and also look out for the giant mural Breakdancing Jesus by Cosmo Sarson on the opposite wall.

Gloucester Road is credited as the longest street of independent shops in Europe.
Independent shops and business
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Condo in Easton · ★4.75 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in the middle of Easton. Popular places such as Eastville park or St. Marks road (which was named as one of the three best streets in the UK) with many independent cafés and restaurants are only a 2 minute walk away. There is a bus stop just outside the doorstep with buses running every couple of minutes directly to the city centre all day. It takes about 10 minutes by bus to get to the centre to reach Cabot Circus or the harbour side.

name: Condo in City of Bristol · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 4 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
A quite residential terraced neighbourhood, the lovely St Georges Park, Go Karting, good bus routes into Central Bristol or Bath, local Swimming Baths, Sports Centers, with good range of local shops within a short distance, Chip shops and Grocery stores less than 5 minutes walk and open till late.
Bristol Harbourside Festival, St Pauls Carnival, Balloon Festival, the famous Suspension Bridge & SS Great Britain & many other attractions throughout the summer make Bristol a fantastic place to visit.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.60 · 6 bedrooms · 6 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
St Andrews is a very central location. family friendly safe pretty neighbourghood.
15 mins walk in to town, Docks and Harbour, & mins from Glouster rd, tonnes of pubs, restaurants cafes and shops. 1hr from Glastonbury, Great proximity to Devon, Somerset, Cotswalds . 1.hr20 to London on train. 5 mins from M32 motorway.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.77 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is situated on a quiet road in Clifton. Within walking distance are many coffee shops, bakeries, restaurants and trendy bars as well as Clifton Suspension Bridge, the Observatory and Bristol Zoo. Also in the locality are Clifton College, Bristol Zoo Gardens, The Downs, Bristol University, BBC Bristol and Bristol Museum. Park Street and The Triangle provide further restaurants, night life and retail shops, you will find the Harbourside and Cabot Circus shopping centre about a 30 minute walk or a short bus ride away. You can indulge in a swim and beauty treatments at the nearby Lido Spa & restaurant, reservations will be needed for treatments. Genuinely a perfect location to explore Bristol.
host_about:
Simply Check In are a bespoke holiday and short term let management company.
Our serviced apartment staff aim to supply the very best personal and friendly service to all our guests. You may book in the safe knowledge that we will do all we can to make your stay exceptional.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.96 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: A very quiet family neighbourhood.
host_about: Being a host with AirBnB means I get to meet lots of interesting and lovely people and hear about their travels and adventures.  I've travelled around the world myself but now work from home running my own business.  I'm  super sporty, love tennis and most sports and always see the glass as half full.  I've recently bought and completely renovated this lovely house in this wonderful part of Bristol and it's nice to be able to share it with other people who are passing through.

name: Condo in City of Bristol · ★4.14 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
host_about:
Hello we are Hopewell and welcome to our profile. We are dedicated to making sure you enjoy your stay in one of our many homes, be that in the city centre, Clifton or beyond.
We are here to help you enjoy your time with us and get the best out of what Bristol has to offer. 
Our team really has great knowledge of the area so please feel free to ask us any questions.  We are all really passionate about our great city, and are excited about others coming to explore all it has to offer.
Everyone has a role to play in the team, so there is always someone to look after you.
We are experts in Airbnb which started from looking after our own properties, to friends, to the whole of Bristol and beyond. 

We look forward to having you to stay!

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.75 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: This place is fantastic - peaceful (right on top of Windmill Hill), only 100 metres from Victoria Park - a beautiful park which covers half of the hill with amazing views and a great outdoor cafe. Some lovely local pubs (only a few minutes walk away) with good food and a fun friendly atmosphere.
host_about:
I am a friendly, sociable, but peaceful person. I love looking after our house and garden, and making it as homely and cosy as I can, and I enjoy welcoming guests to our house. I like to try to make your stay as relaxing and enjoyable as possible.  I do like to host guests who are happy to be considerate in return . Fortunately, for most guests , this comes naturally!

I love nature, and like to try to be as environmentally friendly as I can in the way that I live, and use environmentally friendly products in the house. I also try where possible to minimise plastic so  you will find there is soap rather than shower gel in the bathroom. I don't buy any food containing palm oil, as this product is instrumental in the widespread destruction of the rainforest habitat. However, that said, I do attempt to use up food and/or bathroom products left behind by guests, as I do not like waste, so if you see any non-environmentally friendly items around then these may have been left by guests. My garden is a wild garden, which I have designed to be good for biodiversity,  including birds, frogs, toads, spiders, insects and a fox ! So it often looks quite overgrown, as wildlife loves a good rambling garden :) 

I have two B&B rooms in the house , so you may find other guests staying here at the same time as myself and you. In the summer I also have the summerhouse on Air BNB.

 Please make sure you have read and are happy with all my house rules as some of them are quite specific and may be different to other Air BNB houses that you may have stayed in before. 

I give a minimum of 2% of my profits to charity every month, mainly animal welfare and environmental charities such as Marine Conservation  Society, Cruelty Free International, the Orangutan Foundation, but also the NSPCC and Womankind, a charity which works to reduce violence to women in certain countries which have a cultural history of violence against women. 

So you can be happy in the knowledge that the money you pay me will be spent wisely, on charities and  products which lead to the caring of our environment, animals, and humans, rather than contribute to our destruction.

 My hobbies are singing, music, dancing, gardening, writing, sewing, and many others!! I look forward to meeting you :)
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Condo in City of Bristol · ★4.90 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
Guesthouse in Bristol · ★4.89 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Our house is in the quiet and leafy area of Fishponds close to Eastville park. You will have easy access to the amenities of Fishponds Road where there are cafes, takeaways and a couple of really nice pubs serving delicious beer. We are a 20 minute walk down the cycle path to Greenbank/ Easton, one of the trendiest areas of Bristol with loads of lovely places to get a coffee or yummy food. We have endless recommendations for things to do and places to eat in Bristol - we love food and are very happy to share our experiences!
host_about:
I live with my husband Sam, our baby, Nancy and little staffie-cross, Nina. Having travelled all over the world, we're yet to find a place we love as much as Bristol. We feel incredibly lucky to live in our house in such an exciting, vibrant city. We want to share a slice of this and return some of the warm generosity we've experienced throughout our travels. 

I work as a family therapist in training and Sam is a children's social worker. We believe in social justice and equality and we are interested in what is going on in the world. 

In our free time we love walking through the countryside and gorgeous parks that practically back onto our house. We also enjoy spending time with family, cooking and hosting, travel, and making the most of what Bristol has to offer.

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Knowle is in South Bristol a couple of miles from the city centre,.  It has great transport links and is a 25 min walk to the centre.  The neighbourhood is a quiet local area, with good restaurants and bars.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Townhouse in City of Bristol · ★4.88 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: St Paul's and Stokes Croft is the heart of Bristol's permissive counter culture. It is a thriving and inclusive community. It is packed with places to eat, drink and dance and there are always plenty of friendly and eccentric characters around. This also comes with a level of hedonism and the streets are busy on a Friday and Saturday night with fun seekers and all that this brings. I would say that this does not impact on us within our home, but guests need to be aware of themselves and their possessions when they go out late at night and be a bit streetwise when they hit the town.
host_about: I am a community worker in Bristol...I also do loads of other creative and fun stuff like making clothes and music...
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Cottage in Bristol · ★4.96 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Yew Tree Farm is the very last traditional working farm in Bristol. Originally it was part of the Smythe estate from Ashton Court and was a diary farm until the 1950's. We keep a small herd of cattle, pigs and chickens in a sustainable and eco friendly way.
We love living here, it is quiet, charming and peaceful.

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.94 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Bishopston is a safe and quiet leafy neighbourhood, yet close to the City Centre.
While the Gloucester Road, known to be the longest independent shopping street in Europe with its buzzing cafes independent shops, music venues and pubs, is on your doorstop.
All amenities are easily accessible.
host_about: Im a self employed commercial artist,  and love living in this wonderfully diverse and creative city.

name: Townhouse in City of Bristol · ★4.91 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview:
This is a quiet area of Bristol on the Westbury on Trym/Southmead border with easy access to the M5/M4.

Southmead Hospital and St Peters Hospice (both walking distance). There is a bus stop just yards away with regular buses to the city, Filton, Cribbs Causeway and Hospital. bus no. 77, 76 and 2.

Good easy access to Filton and Aerospace.

Right next to the lovely Baddock woods.
host_about:
Thank you for looking at my rooms to rent. We brought this house in 2019 and have loved putting our own stamp on it. 

I am currently travelling so my sister, Beth, will meet you and answer any questions. She and the two dogs live in the house.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Townhouse in City of Bristol · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: If you turn left outside the front door,and walk down the road, there  is Victoria Park.If you turn right and walk up the hill you will find The Oxford pub,which often provides Djs and live music.Across the road from the Oxford is a delightful Florence where you can sit in our outside.The Florence has good coffee and pasta/pizza/salad dishes.The Banco Lounge Bristol is a relaxed place locally to eat.A bakery/cafe has recently arrived,next to the Oxford,called Artisan.I have lived in my house for 20years and can help guests enjoy their stay in Bristol
host_about: I am interested in the arts,being by the sea with my family,reading,drawing and making ceramics.My daughter Ruby is a professional cook,we are looking forward to making food with Cretan ingredients.My partner Brian loves fishing.My daughter Indigo and partner Rio are very happy with their first child Myla who will be 7months old when we are in Crete,they will be pleased to have time with us all together.It will be a rare treat.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.96 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Our apartment is located in one of the most up-market and sought after areas of the City.  Clifton Village is picturesque, very safe and friendly.  Dozens of artisan cafes, boutique shops and delightful restaurants and wine bars in the locality offering dine-in, takeaway and delivery.
host_about: I am a young professional Solicitor based in the UK with a love of food wine and travel.  I have been using AirBnB as a guest for many years, much preferring the comfort of a home-away-from home to a hotel.  I am delighted now to be able to host others in my own flat while I'm enjoying other parts of the world.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Condo in Bristol · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Surrounded by great independent shops and cafes, and the famous street art of Upfest. A short walk to buzzing waterfront Cargo and the city centre in one direction, and the countryside of Leigh Woods and Ashton Court the other (home of the annual hot air balloon fiesta). Plenty of small and medium size shops nearby (e.g. Co-Op, Lidl, Aldi), as well as independent grocers, delis, restaurants, cafes, vintage and record shops, etc. (including a great wine shop next door and esteemed restaurant below).
host_about: Bristol-based British. I work as a university researcher on food, agriculture and health. Anthropologist, traveller/adventurer, hiker, salsa dancer, foodie. Equally as happy camping in the wilderness as living it up in a 5* pad. Easy going but also reliable and clean, and appreciate the same in hosts/guests. I'm often co-hosting/travelling with my partner, Tom.

neighborhood_overview: Peaceful and quiet cul-de sac in a very safe neighbourhood.

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.94 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview: I have a map, books and lots of ideas that visitors to Bristol can mull over, also lots of suggestions.
host_about: I moved to Bristol seven years ago, after living in the country for most of my life. I love the friendly atmosphere here, which I relate to as I'm friendly too. So many places to visit, watch or take part in, it's a great place.Cinema and theatre especially the Cube, Watershed, The Old Vic and Theatre Royal in Bath. Walking anywhere and everywhere. I enjoy sewing, gardening, drawing, DIY. reading, visiting galleries and museums.

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.85 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: If you are looking for year round local festivals, harbourside festivities, the balloon fiesta, award winning local cycle tracks, walks and awe inspiring street art, Bristol is the place to be.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.53 · 1 bedroom · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Head north of the centre to find hip nightlife, independent traders and a bohemian vibe on Gloucester Road and Stokes Croft. Make a stroll around bohemian Stokes Croft, often referred to as Bristol's cultural quarter. Discover unusual shops, great pubs, real clubs, fabulous food and a wealth of artist studios and ever-changing exhibitions.

In fact the whole area resembles an outdoor gallery with colourful graffiti that continually transforms its walls and buildings. You might see some great artwork today – but by the time you want to show it to your friends tomorrow it has miraculously vanished or changed into a completely new picture. Keep your eyes open for some of Banksy's best known pieces, such as the famous Mild, Mild, West, which is next to The Canteen and also look out for the giant mural Breakdancing Jesus by Cosmo Sarson on the opposite wall.

Gloucester Road is credited as the longest street of independent shops in Europe.

Independent shops
host_about: Hi, come and enjoy Bristol’s independent and cultural quarter. Great cafes, bars and people.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.91 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Very lovely and respectable neigbourhood and pleasant neighbours. there is a park opposite the property.
host_about: I'm a working Professional, very calm and relaxed.

name: Religious building in City of Bristol · ★4.79 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Home in City of Bristol · ★4.69 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Our house is on a quiet street right next door to a park and community garden with a berry maze.

Supermarkets, high street shopping, restaurants and pubs are within easy walking distance.

Beautiful countryside, woodland and beaches are a short drive away.
host_about:
My partner Pete and I love travelling and can often be found adventuring with our young son and little dog in the camper van.

Pete is a photographer and sculptor, among other creative things, and I work in cinema exhibition supporting film festivals and independent cinema.

We are both passionate about animals, doing our best to look after the planet and  being open and kind to others.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · 4 bedrooms · 5 beds · 1 bath
host_about: A keen ecologist, teacher, videographer and adventurer. Our home in St Andrews is a retreat for us - quiet and spacious, combining modern technology (WIFI, Smart TV, central heating) with our love of retro furniture and art. The back of the flat overlooks our garden and Bristol city (as I'm atop a hill) and is extremely tranquil. Yet out the front we can leave our front door and be in central Bristol in under 10 minutes. There are plenty of local bars, award winning restaurants, deli's, and cafes here. Stokes Croft and its vibrant night life, or Gloucester Road ( longest independent high street in Europe) are less than a 10 minute walk. As a new Mum I can also attest to the many great spaces and places for babies and young children in Bristol. If you are planning a family trip message me and I can fill you in. Hope you enjoy Bristol whilst you are here as much as we do :D

name: Serviced apartment in City of Bristol · ★4.22 · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Elegant, leafy and filled with chic boutiques, cosy cafes, beautiful buildings and iconic attractions, such as Clifton Suspension Bridge and Bristol Zoo Gardens, Clifton is one of Bristol's most exclusive suburbs and picturesque quarters. Beginning with the Clifton Triangle and reaching into the area affectionately known as Clifton Village, this stunning Georgian area is always hugely popular with visitors.

The thriving hub of Clifton Village features pretty streets lined with boutiques and fine places to eat. For an unusual shopping experience, the Victorian Clifton Arcade houses some of the most unique shops in the city, selling everything from vintage jewellery to home interiors. Watch the Discover Clifton Village film here. There's also a great map to help you navigate, which you can download here, or pick up a copy from the Tourist Information Centre.
host_about:
Hello! and welcome to our profile.

Your Apartment- Bristol, is passionate about providing unique living spaces that make guests feel more at home than at a hotel. A family run business, we have established ourselves as Bristol’s leading provider of serviced apartments.

Offering a wide selection of boutique-style serviced apartments at affordable prices. These range from studios to 3-bedrooms, with each apartment interior individually designed by our in-house creative team.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Rental unit in Bristol City · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The immediate surroundings of this flat are full of high end shopping on one side and a park and river aspect on the other. Cafès , bars and restaurants all right there , you'll be spoilt for choice
host_about:
I take every opportunity to visit an unfamiliar place. There's nothing like getting deliberately lost and exploring the backstreets of an unknown town or city to give you a feel for what makes it tick.
Add to that the food, a vital component of any culture and I'm happy. 
Much as I wouldn't want to miss the obvious cultural highlights it's often the little bars and cafes, the people and atmosphere that are the most memorable part of travel.

name: Condo in City of Bristol · ★4.44 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
Rental unit in Clifton · ★4.98 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The flat is in a wonderful neighbourhood, with a great selection of independent shops, bars and restaurants on the doorstep and an Everyman cinema around the corner on Whiteladies Road. The Lido is also just a couple of minutes walk away, with its spa, poolside bar and award winning restaurant. We are moments away from both an M&S Food Hall and a much larger Sainsbury's. The vast expanse of the Downs, with stunning views of the Avon Gorge and Brunel's landmark Suspension Bridge, are a short walk away, as well as the charming Clifton Village. The University of Bristol, Park Street, Brandon Hill Park, the Docks and Harbourside are also within easy walking distance, and Bristol Airport is a short 20 minute car journey away.

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★5.0 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 4 baths
neighborhood_overview: Our home is in the area known as St Andrews, after the lovely Victorian park of the same name that is in the heart of the neighbourhood. Just 200 metres walk away you will find yourself on the Gloucester Road with its eclectic mix of independent shops, cafes, bars and boutique second hand clothing stores.
host_about: I love travelling, which is how I ended up on AirBNB! Hotels never truly give you the flavour of a place; staying in a real home in a residential area is much more likely to shed a light on how it feels to live and work somewhere, with all its quirks and qualities. Recently we realised we wanted to share this experience with others by renting out our home too, in the incredible city of Bristol. No matter where we go, this fabulous place is home.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Condo in City of Bristol · ★4.60 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Fill your belly or fix your bike at Mud Dock Café Run by ex-graphic designers with a love of cycling and eating, this bike shop-cum-restaurant is a one-stop-shop if you’re keen on either passtime. Take a break in Brandon Hill Nature Park A wildlife haven right in the city centre, this nature park is an ideal place for jogging or walking (or just laying on your back in the grass). Get a cider education at The Apple One of Bristol’s most legendary bars, this converted Dutch barge sells a tongue-tantalising range of cider and perry from the West Country and beyond. Work out whenever at Puregym Bristol Harbourside Pick up a day pass for this 24/7 gym packed with quality kit ranging from free weights to cardio machines. There’s 50 fitness classes a week, too.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Rental unit in Bristol City · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The street is quiet and set back from the main Fishponds Road in an area that's close to the independent shops and cafes of Fishponds and close to Eastville Park for lovely winter walks. Fishponds has great bus links to Bristol City Centre and close to the famous Bristol to Bath cycle path for any keen cyclists, runners or walkers.

name: Cottage in City of Bristol · ★4.95 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Clifton (BS8) is Bristol's most affluent and arguably most picturesque area. Grand Georgian townhouses line the streets, a mixture of boutiques, indie shops, buzzing bars and leafy green open spaces.  Home to the famous Clifton Suspension Bridge, Avon Gorge and Bristol Zoo. Whilst being a fantastic base, you are also close to cultural centres such as the Watershed, the Arnolfini and Bristol Museum and University. This is mixed with more restaurants in the Harbourside and City Centre. Bristol has endless sightseeing opportunities.

neighborhood_overview:
St Werburgh's is a thriving community with a high street that reflects the Bristolian spirit with its tasteful murals, cafes, breweries, and popular park. The house is just steps away from the local community centre which houses the cosy Neck of the Woods Cafe. Here, you can get excellent tea and coffee with good food (including cake)!

Tesco Extra is just a 15 minute walk or 6 minute drive away.

For the adventurous, two popular and well known climbing centres are within a 5 minute walk of the house.

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.93 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The Bedminster area is steeped in history and is a culturally vibrant hotspot. On the doorstep is East street which has convenience of common high street shops as well as a supermarket.

In the other direction is North Street with lots of independent shops, some stunning street art from Upfest (Europes largest street art festival) and Ashton Gate the home of Bristol City FC and Bristol Bears Rugby.

Whichever direction you head in there is also a cafe or pub to whet your whistle and it is only a short walk into town and the historic harbourside area, which is home to the SS Great Britain.

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.70 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: A 10 minute walk from the City Centre & the Bristol Royal Infirmary and 20 minutes’ walk to the University and Clifton.
host_about:
We lived in Bristol for 8 years before Jamie’s work took us to the Middle East.  After 11 years of living and working in the sunshine, we now live in Scotland.  We still use our home in Montpelier to take advantage of all Bristol has to offer and to meet up with friends and family.  We love to travel and have 2 young children, so we have tried to make our home as child friendly as possible and we have provided a travel cot and highchair.   
Montpelier is in the heart of the cultural quarter and a fantastic base to explore Bristol.  Despite being so close to the city centre, the house is on a quiet street and we have a lovely south facing courtyard garden at the back.  We are a 10 minute walk from the City Centre, 10 minutes’ walk from the Bristol Royal Infirmary and 20 minutes’ walk to the University and Clifton.   Car parking permits are available on request.  Parking in the street is not usually a problem, but it’s worth noting that part of Montpelier’s charm is that the streets are narrow!  There are lots of cafes, restaurants and pubs close by in Montpelier, Stokes Croft and Gloucester Road.

name: Condo in Clifton · ★4.81 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is in the heart of beautiful Clifton, with easy access on foot to all it has to offer. It's situated in a very quiet area in Clifton while being close to a wide range of places to visit, therefore is ideal for a relaxing city break.

There are a number of lovely walks both around Clifton and beyond, including more rural walks just five minutes drive over the Clifton Suspension Bridge in Leigh Woods, Ashton Court and Tyntesfield.

The apartment is just a 2 minute walk from Clifton Down, with its lovely open spaces and views over the Avon Gorge.

Whiteladies Road, which is brimming with character, is only a 6 minute walk away and has an Everyman Cinema and the Redgrave Theatre close by.
Both Whiteladies Road and Clifton Village offer a wide range of independent shops, bars, coffee shops and restaurants, while the city centre and harbourside can be reached in 40 minutes on foot.

Redland, Cotham, Gloucester Road and the City Cen
host_about: I live in Clifton, an area I love, close to the great amenities that Bristol has to offer & the countryside on our doorstep.  My hall floor garden apartment has a contemporary kitchen, 2 ensuite shower rooms, cloakroom, utility room, oak floor, south-facing, secure garden & private parking. On the edge of Clifton Village, my cosy cottage has a triple aspect bedroom with views over the Avon Gorge, a kitchen/dining room, shower room & sunny garden.

name: Serviced apartment in City of Bristol · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Bristol is a city packed with fantastic attractions, sports, culture and entertainment options for everyone. An exciting, vibrant, modern city it has a growing reputation for fine dining with visitors spoilt for choice. As well as local West Country flavours you can enjoy some of Britain’s best international restaurants in Bristol.
Discover the maritime past and visit Brunel’s SS Great Britain or unlock industrial secrets at the Blue Glass Factory, don’t forget to take time to visit Bristol’s most famous landmark the Clifton Suspension Bridge. There are plenty of things to do in Bristol with kids which are fun for the whole family including the ancient caves of Wookey Hole or take a Pirate Walk (plank not included).
Bristol is well known for its eclectic music scene as well as being home to superb venues such as Colston Hall, Bristol Hippodrome, St George’s Bristol and the The Canteen.
As renowned shopping destination, Bristol shopping centres, streets and markets featur

name: Condo in City of Bristol · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We have been in the neighborhood for eight years & cannot imagine leaving. North Street was once the main option for bites, nights & drinks, but with the arrival of Whapping Wharf (as well as great new shops on East Street & Bedminster Parade), you now have a superabundance of quality options within a 5 minute walk.

A quick run-down of some of the North Street hot-spots:
Cafes: *Mark's Bread - amazing bread, great atmosphere; *The Tobacco Factory - big space where community tends to gather; *Marlago - another lovely place for conversation or brunch; *Sweven - must-go for coffee enthusiasts

Bars: *The Old Bookshop - chill atmosphere and great cocktail menu; *KASK - wine & cheese with a fashionable yet inviting vibe; *Bristol Beer Factory Taproom - a neighborhood feel at a Bristol institution; *The Spotted Cow - beautiful garden and good crowd; *The Steam Crane - huge selection of indie beer, plenty of outdoor seating

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.95 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Clifton with its grand Georgian townhouses is one of the most affluent areas of Bristol. Home to what is believed to be the longest terrace in Europe, Royal York Crescent in Clifton Village enjoys some of the best panoramic views of Bristol. With its many upscale fashion boutiques, coffee shops and quirky retail outlets offering handmade pottery, jewellery and gift ideas - Clifton Village will make you feel like you’re on vacation any day of the week. Brunel’s Clifton Suspension Bridge straddling the Avon Gorge, Bristol Zoo, Clifton Observatory and Caves are amongst Bristol’s most iconic spots.

Cross the iconic Clifton Suspension Bridge to find Ashton Court Estate - a wedding venue, historic deer park and home to annual Bristol International Balloon Fiesta. Take a walk through the 850 acres of woods and grassland whilst enjoying stunning views of the city or go mountain biking. To truly escape the buzz of the city and discover a variety of veteran trees, immerse yourself in
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.81 · 4 bedrooms · 10 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview: The higgihaus@cheltenhamlane (#3a) sits in a hidden no-through lane and is a mere stone's throw from the Cheltenham and Gloucester Roads. Both are chock full of shops, restaurants, bars, coffee shops, pubs, supermarkets and all the transport options you’ll likely need when staying in our awesome city (including the train at Montpelier). Stokes Croft (famed for its street art) is a hop, skip and a jump away in one direction and the independent traders on the Gloucester Road (known locally as Bristol's Indie Shopping District) a couple of minutes in the other.
host_about:
At higgihaus we're on a mission to deliver the sort of accommodation we love to stay in when we're travelling - comfortable, convivial, achingly stylish and that somehow manages to capture that elusive 'it feels good, but I'm not sure why' feeling. 

Founded by Luke Spikes in 2017, higgihaus will be bringing its unique brand of 'place to stay' to urban locations across the United Kingdom. For now, we're focused on Bristol and Cardiff and would love for you to stay with us when you, your family, and friends visit these awesome cities.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, Bristol, United Kingdom

host_about:
Hello potential guests, I am Nina and I live some time in the UK and sometimes in Morocco and manage these 2 properties but am also a foreign language teacher.   I also used to have a beautiful apartments in Barcelona which I ran for 5 years on this site but now concentrate on the Riad in Fes Morocco which has reopened since the pandemic and we are excited to welcome guests back.

My aim is to make your stay fantastic, ensuring you enjoy your holiday to the max.

My philosophy is affordable luxury accommodation and I want you to feel you’re staying in exquisite surroundings where no corners are cut without feeling the pinch to your wallets.

The Riad in Fes is run with a fab team in Morocco. Between us all we speak 6 languages and can help you get the best from your stay. Be it being on the vip lists at the top clubs in the new town, get into an undercover sheisha bar, find a drink even in Ramadan, ride a donkey around the Medina or get a good deal on an awesome camel trek. The Riad in Fes is lively and fun and the place to meet other travelers, out of season it is more chilled out but it is still atmospheric and a place to chillax. Our guests range between 21-42 social media savvy and keen to socialize.
