name: Loft in Bristol · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Based right next to the City Centre, St.Paul's & Montpelier are one of the most diverse cultural areas in Bristol. It is a vivid local art scene where you will find various pieces by local street artists including world famous BANKSY.

Stokes Croft also recently known as Entrepreneurs mile hosts an array of local Food, clothing and Art.

There are many live music nights and no two nights are the same.

Bristol Harbour, Bristol Zoo, The History Museum, Bristol Cathedral are just a few of the attractions within easy reach of this flat.

Cabot Circus, Bristol's newest shopping Quarter is literally 3 mins walk, so you wont have to carry you bags full of shopping very far!!

Full of all major high street brands Cabot Circus also has its fair share of designer shops including Hugo Boss & Harvey Nichols.

We welcome long term guests and our property is also Family friendly.

If you have any special requirements please le
host_about: I'm what most people would call a 'MAN-CHILD'!! I believe in living, experiencing and enjoying life always...... I don't believe in waiting for permission to do so! Very keen snowboarder for almost 30 years, skater, skateboarder, BMX'r, artist, architecture and designer. My nickname is TINTIN....when you see me you will know why..

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.97 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: St Werburghs is Bristol's best kept secret, a charming spread of Edwardian streets with Mina Road, as it's 'high street'.  Award winning restaurants, cafes and lovely little local shops.  2 min drive from huge supermarket. 15 minute walk to Cabot Circus shopping centre. 25 minutes from the airport.  The area is brightened by the graffiti so beloved in Bristol (home of Banksy).    The curved exterior backs onto Mina Park with where children can play in a lovely playground.  Meet the locals out with their dogs and children.

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.80 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The area is gentrifying and has a gorgeous park just 5 minutes away (St George) and some great restaurants (The Lockup, Faraway Tree, Loaf and Volunteer Tavern are all close by). Old Market - recently voted in the Times as the “coolest" area - is just a 20 minute walk away. Easton is literally on your doorstep.

There is a lovely river walk to Beesees (only open in the summer) and Chequers Inn. Check out my Guidebook for all the things to do close to the house.

There are plenty of buses into town (bus stop is 2 minute walk away) & Lawrence Hill train station which takes you directly to Montpellier, Clifton etc is a 6 minute walk away. Bristol Temple Meads is 25 minutes on foot, or 10 minutes (if that) in a cab.

If you want total (and cheap) flexibility, I recommend signing up to the Voi scooter app before arriving as there is a station 3 mins from Conway House.
host_about:
Hello Fellow AirBnBer! 

I am a very laid back, experienced Air Bnb host obsessed with my guests’ comfort during their stay. I have bags of energy and live a busy life, and use Air BnB when traveling and at home. 

I love sports, languages, dance, multiculturalism and curious stories (and hosting!). I am open minded and inquisitive but a traditionalist at heart, and value good manners and kindness above all.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

The Michelangelo room is ideal for businesses, professionals, and anybody looking for peace and quiet away from the hubbub of the city because of its location in a residential complex. The famous 'Wilde Reserve Park' is only a two-minute walk from our building, and more parks may be reached in under ten minutes via foot or bike via the nearby walkway or national cycleway. In just 4 minutes, you can reach Tesco 24h, as well as Lidl, B&M, TKmax, HomeBargan, and PurGYm. McDonald's, Domino's, and other local restaurants all provide delivery options.
You are welcome to call the restaurant or place an order online and enjoy your meal in the comfort of your room.

North St is a bustling street within a few minutes walk and has a great vibrant feel to it.

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.80 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath

Our house is 2 mins walk from North Street where there is an array of pubs, bars, restaurants and cafés as well as the incredible street art produced from Upfest street art festival.

Ashton Gate stadium is a ten minute walk and the city centre is a very pleasant 20 minute stroll or 5 minute ride on a rental Voi e-scooter, which can be found just at the end of our road.

Bristol is the best city in the UK and you will have an absolutely fantastic time staying here.

I'd be very happy to point you in the direction of bars, restaurants, exhibitions, boat rides or walks, or anything else you might want to do!

name: Townhouse in City of Bristol · ★4.52 · 4 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The house is located in the heart of Clifton Village, the must-visit location of Bristol and the South West of England.
Clifton is the home of Isambard Kingdom Brunels spectacular Suspension Bridge - not to be missed !! Following the terraces, crescents and squares of Georgian and Regency architecture you are led temptingly from Clifton Triangle to Clifton Village along a trail of award winning cafes, bars, restaurants, pubs, shops, chic boutiques and leafy squares.
Boredom will never set in as you share a postcode with some of Bristol’s most famed attractions – Bristol City Museum and Art Gallery, Bristol Observatory and the sprawling green Durdham Downs (great for walks, runs, or picnics if you’re feeling more relaxed).
Key shopping roads include Whiteladies Road, Princess Victoria Street and Regent Street.
host_about: We are a family of five, Richard and Rebecca, and our three children George, Lottie and Teddy... Although we may be traveling in any combination of the above, depending on our trip.

name: Townhouse in Knowle · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Backing onto Arnos Court park and the woods linked to the beautiful Arnos Vale, you can feel far away from city life here. However, we are only a stones throw away from Totterdown with local cafes, bars, vegan-dining and of course, the traditional British pub. We know all of our neighbours and we are part of the little community at this end of the street, having regular street parties in the summer and singing carols around Christmas time.

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.51 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Whiteladies Road is one of Bristol's premier shopping areas. Beautiful Georgian buildings house a range of independent shops and an array of cafes, bars, pubs and restaurants.

There is everything you could need, from up-market furniture shops to hi-fi, deli, book shops, estate agents, galleries, musical instruments, fashion and gift shops.

There is also Whiteladies Road Market every Saturday, a community favourite and the place to buy seasonal produce from local food and drink traders. The Downs is only a short distance away, a great space for a walk or run. There are great bus links into the centre of Bristol and Clifton Village.
host_about:
I’m a freelance translator and spend my time between Bristol and Brittany.
I’ve had the flat for 5 years. 
It had a coal fire and no central heating when I moved in so I installed a wood burner and radiators to make it more comfortable.
I also put in a skylight to let light more into the hall and show off the period stairway.
The most beautiful thing here for me is the light that floods into the flat from morning to evening, even when the sun’s not out.

name: Townhouse in City of Bristol · ★4.93 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
St Werburghs is a hub of artisan cafes, such as Napolita for coffee and pizza and the award-winning Better Food Company organic supermarket. Local pubs The Miners and Duke of York are both relaxed and welcoming.
Regarding activities, the community-orientated City Farm, with pigs, goats and ducks is just up the road. There are two climbing centres in St Werburghs - Bloc (bouldering) and The Church (roped and bouldering). Being Banksy's hometown, there are several (legal) graffiti walls and ever-changing urban art.
St Werburghs is close to the independent shopping quarters of Stokes Croft and Gloucester Road, as well as the more central Cabot Circus and Broadmead. Ikea is a stone's throw away at Junction 2. Plenty of options if you need a bit of retail therapy!
host_about: STR manager/ co-host from Bristol, UK. name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.34 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Just round the corner from Old Market, the apartment is in a great central location.

Old Market is full of independent and quirky shops, bars, pubs and cafes. There's plenty of furniture, antiques and vintage shops. The Old Market Assembly is a great place for a drink and also has the Wardrobe Theatre for live performances, comedy and music.

Cabot Circus shopping centre is just a 10-minute walk away and has a great choice of restaurants and shops.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Rental unit in City of Bristol · ★4.80 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The flat is located on Portland Square which is a beautiful Grade 1 listed 18th century square, itself located in the heart of vibrant St Paul's and minutes from the city centre.

Stokes Croft, known as Bristol's cultural quarter, is just a five minutes walk away and offers a range of independent businesses including cafes, bars and nightclubs, as well as street art including works from Banksy.

Cabot Circus is also just five minutes walk away and is Bristol's main shopping precinct offering a range of restaurants as well as shops and entertainment.

The rest of Bristol's city centre, including the Old City, the Harbourside, the Cathedral and the University are just 15-20 minutes walk away.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.44 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Excellent transport links, both business and leisure travellers alike will be perfectly placed to get around
host_about: We feel our place is an ideal base from which to explore this fabulous city. It’s a short hop to the city centre (ask for a three-stop hop on any local bus and you’ll be in Cabot Circus in no time). We have free on-street parking right outside our door, so you don’t have to worry about pay and display or the parking permits which now place restrictions on motorists in many other parts of the city. If you don’t have a car, that’s no problem, as there is a regular bus into town that stops on our street, or you can take the train from Stapleton Road station and be at Temple Meads or Clifton in no time. If you like a good walk, you can get to Broadmead in around 40 minutes by following the Bristol and Bath Railway Path into town. However, if you want to feel like a real Bristolian, the preferred way to get about Britain’s first ‘cycling city’ is by bike, of course. Our house is handily located next to the Bristol and Bath Railway Path, so why not bring your bikes? The ride to Bath through the Avon Valley is stunningI am a Bristolian born and raised; my wife and I met here at university. Bristol really is a beautiful city. We love taking walks around the Floating Harbour, ensuring we take time to stop for coffee at the Olive Shed, a swift half at the Nova Scotia Hotel, or maybe even a delicious bite to eat at the containers on Wapping Wharf. We also enjoy taking in the stunning views from the top of Brandon Hill before checking out the quirky, artsy shops on Park Street. We always like to look in at the Boston Tea Party on Park Street, where the ‘secret garden’ provides perfect respite from the hustle and bustle of the city. We’ve owned our house in Easton since July 2019. Recently voted one of the top 50 coolest neighbourhoods in the world by TimeOut Magazine (September 2019), Easton really does have something for everyone. You will find trendy cafés selling excellent coffee and home-made cakes, world-beating curry restaurants, and plenty of friendly local boozers. We like to visit the gorgeous Este Kitchen for coffee and brunch. Just opposite, the Greenbank pub is a great spot for lunch or an evening pint or two; their guest ales change all the time and they have a decent selection of board games. If you’re planning a quiet night in, G Bros Pizza will do you a perfectly baked pizza. The M’Sala Library truly is one of the best curries I’ve ever eaten; be sure to ask for the vegetable samosas which are to die for. For the discerning foodie, the famous Bristol Sweet Mart on St Mark’s Road is a five-minute walk away. There you’ll find ingredients for sale from all four corners of the globe. Worth a trip, even just for a browse. We look forward to hosting you soon in beautiful BS5. Chris, Justine and baby Louis.
neighbourhood: City of Bristol, England, United Kingdom

neighborhood_overview:

There are three local pubs, a super little cinema, an very good Indian restaurant, a deli serving wine/tapas early evening and brunch as well as several coffee shops. Booking is advisable for eating out in the evening.

The house is 15 mins walk from Clifton Downs and 20 mins from the Clifton Suspension Bridge. It is an easy car journey to the famous Wave - a simulated surfing centre.

Please note this is a quiet residential area and the accommodation is most suitable for families, couples and weekend breaks. Guests planning to return late at night/am need to consider the quiet, residential area! Not suitable for serious early hours party goers or nightclubbers!!

host_about:
I love dancing, intelligent conversation, wild swims, healthy food & lifestyle, theater, good music, especially Latin, Afrobeat, classical, soul, various but not heavy metal. My favourite books are by Marquez, Kingfisher, Coelho and Arundhati Roy.
I don't like to be around smoking or heavy drinking, love healthy lifestyle, cycling, exercise, nature.
I have enjoyed Morocco, especially the desert; Canadian open spaces and snowshoeing, European Capitals at weekends, lake districts, San Francisco, Yosemity National Park and planning to go to the carnival in Brasil.

I enjoy wholesome food, prefer white meat and fish, with minimum gluten.
Live music in small and cosy settings, poetry and good company are my favourites too. I enjoy meeting local people, wherever I am;  detest all-inclusive settings. I am flexible and respectful of differences.

My life motto is to be be at peace and tuned in to one's heart. Being at the right place , at the right time, doing the right thing with the right people is  my definition of happiness. Being a contributor to the world and enjoying life!

name: Townhouse in Bristol · ★4.83 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Head north of the centre to find great nightlife, independent traders and a bohemian vibe on Gloucester Road and Stokes Croft. Take a stroll around bohemian Stokes Croft, often referred to as Bristol's cultural quarter. Discover unusual shops, great pubs, real clubs, fabulous food and a wealth of artist studios and ever-changing exhibitions.
In fact the whole area resembles an outdoor gallery with colourful graffiti that continually transforms its walls and buildings. You might see some great artwork today – but by the time you want to show it to your friends tomorrow it has miraculously vanished or changed into a completely new picture. Keep your eyes open for some of Banksy's best known pieces, such as the famous Mild, Mild, West, which is next to The Canteen and also look out for the giant mural Breakdancing Jesus by Cosmo Sarson on the opposite wall.

Gloucester Road is credited as the longest street of independent shops in Europe.
Independent shops and busine

name: Home in City of Bristol · ★4.74 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Step out of Cabot Circus, cross the main road (Temple Way) and through the old Victorian park, and you will land in the heart of one of the most historic areas of the city. This was the first part of the city to be built around the castle and today is a thriving bohemian shopping quarter in Bristol.

Old Market Quarter is home to a great selection of shops from vintage fashion and antique shops, independent furniture stores to specialist climbing and motorcycle stores. As you peruse the shops on street level, be sure to look up at the array of architectural designs of the buildings.

This area is known for its LGBT-friendly shops, pubs, bars and clubs.

If you're looking for a traditional pub to stop for a drink or bite to eat then hunt out The Phoenix, which has a great far east inspired menu as well as pub classics.
host_about: I'm a keen traveler, loving city trips as much as country breaks. Put me in a kayak or treat me to oysters fresh from a local catch and I'll be very happy!

Offering a wide selection of boutique-style serviced apartments at affordable prices. These range from studios to 3-bedrooms, with each apartment interior individually designed by our in-house creative team.

name: Serviced apartment in Redcliffe · ★4.47 · 3 bedrooms · 7 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The City Centre and Old City of Bristol are the heart of the city and offer a superb taste of culture, food, history and fantastic shopping opportunities. A trip to Bristol would not be complete without a visit to its central area.

There's a lot crammed into one space including Central Bristol and the Bristol Hippodrome, Bristol Shopping Quarter, Bristol's Old City and Bristol Old Vic, Park Street and College Green and Christmas Steps Arts Quarter. Making this an area to explore to its fullest on your visit.
host_about:
Hello! and welcome to our profile.

Your Apartment- Bristol, is passionate about providing unique living spaces that make guests feel more at home than at a hotel. A family run business, we have established ourselves as Bristol’s leading provider of serviced apartments.

name: Rental unit in Bristol City · 1 bedroom · 1 private bath
Home in Knowle · ★4.25 · 1 bedroom · 1 bath
host_about:
I love dancing, intelligent conversation, wild swims, healthy food & lifestyle, theater, good music, especially Latin, Afrobeat, classical, soul, various but not heavy metal. My favourite books are by Marquez, Kingfisher, Coelho and Arundhati Roy.
I don't like to be around smoking or heavy drinking, love healthy lifestyle, cycling, exercise, nature.
I have enjoyed Morocco, especially the desert; Canadian open spaces and snowshoeing, European Capitals at weekends, lake districts, San Francisco, Yosemity National Park and planning to go to the carnival in Brasil.

I enjoy wholesome food, prefer white meat and fish, with minimum gluten.
Live music in small and cosy settings, poetry and good company are my favourites too. I enjoy meeting local people, wherever I am;  detest all-inclusive settings. I am flexible and respectful of differences.

My life motto is to be be at peace and tuned in to one's heart. Being at the right place , at the right time, doing the right thing with the right people is  my definition of happiness. Being a contributor to the world and enjoying life!

name: Townhouse in Montpelier · ★4.94 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Our home is located close to Bristol's city centre, a short distance (15 minutes) from Cabot Circus shopping centre and Gloucester Road, Europe's longest stretch of independent shops, cafes and restaurants.

Our local pub is The Star and Garter, renowned for its historical links to the Bristol music scene. Nearby Picton Street and Stokes Croft offer a stretch of great cafes, restaurants and late night dancing spots for those who are looking to venture further.

For those with little ones (like us!) we are a 20 minute walk from St Werberghs city farm, which has goats, pigs chickens and rabbits and a lovely cafe with a playground.

name: Home in Greenbank · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: This area is unique and loved for its multicultural abundance of restaurants, cafes, shops. People travel all over Bristol to experience the vibrant communities that live here. It is an area not to miss whilst spending time in Bristol and allows you to access everywhere so easily from the moment you walk out of the front door.

name: Rental unit in Clifton · ★4.88 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Whiteladies road has many restaurants, coffee shops and bars. Sainsbury supermarket and Tesco supermarket. BBC tv, Bristol University, Southmead Hospital, Bristol Royal Infirmary, Hippodrome theatre, Cribbs causeway shopping centre and Cabot  Circus.

Westbury Hill is also on the cusp of Durdham Downs, with plenty of space to run or explore.

name: Townhouse in Bishopston · ★4.91 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
Gloucester Road is a great street with many independent shops restaurants and cafes. 5 mins walk to park or county cricket and frequent buses to the centre and beyond. Stokes Croft is nearby with even more food and music.

This is the best part of Bristol.... it is rich with independent unusual and creative businesses of every sort. There is live music in several venues most nights, and great food inspired by the world, and by localism and seasonality. The shops are quirky, with fabulous gifts (some made locally) as well as essentials. Gloucester Road morphs into Stokes Croft- the artistic and creative hub of North Bristol- on its way to the centre with the river, and the SS Great Britain.
Bristol is a good base for touring about...it is near Bath, and not too far from Stonehenge and Longleat or the seaside at Weston Super Mare or Clevedon. It is also a good stopping off point if on a long journey from North to Southwest or from west Wales to the South East.
St
host_about: My name is Prue, a keen cook who likes crosswords, Scrabble, paintings and red wine in any order. I love Bristol. It is friendly and quirky and interesting. After more than 10 years here, I realise I will never get it properly, as it is so many things to different people.... I am a few minutes' walk from the Gloucestershire County Ground (cricket, Neville Road) in the middle of a long road of mostly independent shops, galleries, cafes, restaurants and pubs. Who could ask for more?

name: Rental unit in Clifton · ★4.84 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Situated a stone’s throw away from Clifton Village, the apartment is conveniently located within walking distance of many independent shops, bars, cafes and restaurants. It is also just a 10-minute walk away from Clifton Suspension Bridge, The Observatory and The Downs.

name: Rental unit in Hotwells · ★4.91 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Shops in Clifton Village (5-10 minutes up the hill) including Tesco, Co-op, Delis, Late store/Post Office, Charity shops, restaurants (Fish'n'chips, Indian, Thai, Fish, Pizza..)
Brunel's Suspension Bridge (of course) about 5 minutes walk up the hill and round the corner.
Clifton Downs start at the Bridge and extend miles along the River Avon, which meets the harbour exit at the bottom of the hill (5 minutes).
You can cross the harbour and walk along the river, stroll along the harbour side into the Centre, Watershed, restaurants, clubs,
Bus stops in Clifton Village for the City Centre, Redland, Zoo, bus and railway stations and University campuses.

name: Home in Whitehall · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
St George is a family-friendly, community-driven neighbourhood with a fantastic park, award-winning cafes, buzzing restaurants, music pubs and independent shops.

Bonuses:

- A short walk from the trendy neighbourhood of Easton, St George.
- A 15-minute cycle, 40-minute walk or short drive/taxi into town centre.
-Close to the M32 and the Bath Road

name: Home in Greenbank · ★4.74 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: Easton is a great place to visit, and very easy for exploring Bristol from. lots of lovely shops, cafes, pubs and venues nearby, and a friendly community.

name: Condo in Hotwells · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The Garden Flat is situated in a pretty crescent and communal garden, tucked between Clifton's iconic squares and Brunel's historic harbour. The light is always changing with beautiful sunrises and sunsets over the hills and river. The neighbourhood is much loved by artists and is full of visual surprises, winding ways and secret gardens. We're hidden away and close to everywhere, a deer park, observatory, tall ships, Norman gatehouse and contemporary galleries and cafes! It's a very vibrant and happening community where visitors are warmly welcomed.
host_about: Hi, I'm Bruno and I love to bake for my family and friends. I grew up in a really big family, so cooking and socialising are part of who I am! I've been lucky enough to travel a lot with my job and I’ve always appreciated warm and genuine hospitality. It would be my pleasure to welcome you to Bristol and our sunny garden flat!

name: Home in Bristol City · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Terraced house close to the airport with beautiful views of the city.
host_about: Hi I am Sarah and live with my husband Jim and our toddler Ernesto. We love travelling and when we were 40 we took a year out to go see some places and ended up visiting 16 countries in one year. On our return we were shocked but also delighted to welcome our little boy Ernesto into the world. We would like to welcome people into our home to learn and encounter different people from all walks of life.

name: Rental unit in Saint Paul's · ★4.97 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Set within  a beautiful leafy Georgian square, that is close to the city centre and the very trendy, culturally diverse Stokes Croft. Here you will find a variety of independent businesses from bakeries, coffee shops, bars and restaurants to vintage shops.
host_about:
I have lived in Bristol for over 10 years, it is a city that has well and truly become my home. My wife and I are foodies, so what better place to live then the foodie capital of the UK. We can certainly give you all the best tips for your stay. 

I also love to travel and explore countries all over the world with my wife, immersing ourselves into different cultures. If you have any recommendations for places to visit please let us know.

name: Home in Bristol City · ★4.81 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The location of the Orange factory really does offer it all.

It is incredibly close to the Children’s Hospital and BRI, offers a five minute walk to Central Bristol and a ten minute Walk into Clifton.

Theatres are very close by with the ‘Bristol Beacon’ (formerly the Colston Hall) and the Bristol Hippodrome just two minutes down the road.

It doesn’t matter if you are doing the Banksy trail, living it up in Clifton or getting in some well needed retail therapy in the Cabot Circus
shopping centre. Getting around is more fun and easier than ever with the introduction of the Vio electric scooter network that is now freely available in Bristol.

The property is a very short walk from the bus station, Trenchard Street NCP and a cab ride from Bristol Templemeads station
host_about: Hello ! We live in Bristol and absolutely love hosting visitors in our lovely Air B&Bs

name: Rental unit in Saint Werburgh's · ★4.30 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The property is 2.1 miles from Bristol Zoo Gardens and 3.1 miles from Ashton Court.

Bristol Cathedral is 1.7 miles from the apartment, while Clifton is 1.9 miles away. The nearest airport is Bristol Airport, 8.1 miles from 56a Mina Rd.

name: Rental unit in Redland · ★4.91 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath

name: Home in Bishopston · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Our road is a quiet culdesac just minutes from the vibrant Gloucester Road which is known for it's independent shops, restaurants, cafes and pubs. We are also a stones throw from Horfield common which is a great green space and has a playground. There's a big Tesco supermarket close by as well as countless smaller 'local' supermarkets. Buses frequently run down Gloucester Road into town. We love it here!
host_about:
Hi,
My partner and I live in Bristol with our toddler. I work in television on documentaries ranging from science to observational 'real life' issues, Bob is a data scientist and both of us enjoy meeting new people.

name: Home in Bristol City · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The incredible art works of the popular  Upfest graffiti art festival are all within walking distance. Have fun exploring the art works big and small on buildings and homes, a great way to explore the neighbourhood and be sure to stop for coffee or a pint from one of Bristol’s local brewery’s along the the way. North street is close by with great independent coffee shops, restaurants and shops. We are a 25 minute walk from whapping wharf which has some of Bristols best independent eating and drinking.

name: Condo in Bristol City · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
It is ideally situated in the BS1 postcode across the water from the SS Great Britain. This is city centre living on your doorstep. It is within walking distance of a wide range of bars restaurants, theatres, independent cinemas, museums and cafes. Cabot Tower is literally across the road. It has all the essentials needed for your stay. There is also a small supermarket within waking distance. Clifton, Cabot shopping centre are all nearby.
This is a great location and will make your stay enjoyable.
host_about: I like music , meeting nice people , culture , travel . Making things out of wood .

name: Rental unit in Bristol City · ★4.60 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
St george park is a 2min walk from the flat which I would highly recommend going for a walk or taking a picnic/bbq to.
Church road is where you can find some great pubs and restaurants which is only a 10min walk through the park.
The river Avon is very easily accessible and a great walk if you want see the more picturesque side of Bristol.

name: Home in Bristol City · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
An arm of River Frome is only a 3 minute walk from your front door! A stunning forest walk leads you to the Frome Valley Walkway. Head south to Eastville Park which houses a lake, football pitches, bowling green and 1 mile running circuit. Or head north and you reach the stunning Snuff Mills with it's woodland and riverside walks, community garden and tea house.

Access to the Bristol and Bath Railway Path is 3 minutes bike ride away! Cycle on the relatively flat path to Bath - 1 hour 15. Or cycle into town - 18 minutes.

Fishponds Rd, a 3 minute walk from the house, is home to pubs, cafes, take-aways and some restaurants. A list of gems will be included in the info pack.

name: Townhouse in Montpelier · ★4.93 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The accommodation is in Bristol's cultural quarter, packed full of independent restaurants and shops. Stokes Croft is within walking distance where you can grab a coffee or find a good spot for lunch or dinner. Cabots Circus (town centre) is a 10 minute walk.
host_about:
Hi! 
I am a British-Venezuelan boat-dwelling, kitesurfing, climber person who loves to travel and meet good people. Living in Bristol, Uk but travelling the WORLD! I share my world with Monkey - a mad little Spanish Water Dog.

Soy una Ingles-(Vene)Zolana viviendo en Bristol, UK. Me encanta viajar y conocer a gente buena. Estoy obsesionada con el kitesurf y quiero vivir un dia en Chile! Tengo una cachorra que se llama Monkey y es una encantadora con gente nueva.

Je suis une actrice Anglo - Venezuellienne. Je parle français mais je aucun idee comment l'écrit! jeje

name: Rental unit in Bristol City · ★4.98 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: It's a quiet and safe neigbourhood, in an area called St George, which is north east Bristol. St George is not central Bristol but it is very easy to get into town, with regular buses which stops up the road
host_about: I'm a full time professional.  Interested in music and travel. I'm friendly and enjoy meeting people.

name: Home in Southville · ★4.83 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
host_about: Hi! I live in Bristol, in a large house in Southville. Which is close to North Street, the harbourside, city centre and Ashton court which pretty much has anything you could want from Bristol on your doorstep or walking distance!

name: Rental unit in Redland · ★4.99 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Redland is a leafy suburb with tree lined streets in the heart of Bristol close to Clifton and the Downs parkland. Although it is an inner city location it is quiet and family orientated, boosting numerous trendy independent shops and restaurants all within walking distance. There are endless great restaurants cafes and bars for you to choose from, including the hotly tipped Michelin-starred Bulrush and Paco Tapas. Bib Gourmand retuaranit include, Marmo, and BOX E. Other fantastic restaurants worth a visit that are close by include Pasta Loco and Wilsons and Bravas, to name but a few. The local pub, "the Kenny" also serves good food.  There is also camera award winning micro pub, Chums, and a Micro-brewery pub,  The Good Measure as well as plenty of great pizza, tapas and pasta restaurants - all within a 5-10 minute walk.
host_about: Claire and I live and work in Bristol and have backgrounds in the education sector. We enjoy cooking, entertaining and travelling. We also enjoy and spend much of our time restoring houses back to their original glory but adding all the modern conveniences.

name: Home in Saint Andrew's · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: My house is between St Andrews Park and Gloucester Road - known nationally for it's independent shops, including bakers, greengrocers, butcher, fishmonger, Spanish shop and small supermarkets. There's a wide range of pubs  restaurants and cafés to choose from too.
host_about: I'm an active retired nurse who loves travelling independently, experiencing local transport and small B&Bs rather than 5 star luxury.  My partner Bill and I both enjoy gardening, long distance treks, tall ship sailing and are involved in folk festivals.   When at home, I'm a volunteer steward at a local music venue and work at the Bookshop for Amnesty International.  I love being outdoors and I'm also a volunteer warden at small youth hostels.

name: Rental unit in Bristol City · ★4.48 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The property has excellent local amenities and easy access to the city and commuter links. The city centre is walkable and there is direct and frequent public transport. There are trains from Montpelier station to Temple Meads and Bristol Parkway and the M32 is easily accessed.

name: Home in Cotham · ★5.0 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview: The higgihaus@cheltenhamlane (#3b) sits in a hidden no-through lane and is a mere stone's throw from the Cheltenham and Gloucester Roads. Both are chock full of shops, restaurants, bars, coffee shops, pubs, supermarkets and all the transport options you’ll likely need when staying in our awesome city (including the train at Montpelier). Stokes Croft (famed for its street-art) is a hop, skip and a jump away in one direction and the independent traders on the Gloucester Road (known locally as Bristol's Indie Shopping District) a couple of minutes in the other.
host_about:
At higgihaus we're on a mission to deliver the sort of accommodation we love to stay in when we're travelling - comfortable, convivial, achingly stylish and that somehow manages to capture that elusive 'it feels good, but I'm not sure why' feeling. 

Founded by Luke Spikes in 2017, higgihaus will be bringing its unique brand of 'place to stay' to urban locations across the United Kingdom. For now, we're focused on Bristol and Cardiff and would love for you to stay with us when you, your family, and friends visit these awesome cities.

name: Rental unit in Bristol City · ★4.80 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Located right where the action is, you’ll find a good slug of the best restaurants, bars, pubs, clubs & coffee shops right on the doorstep. Cabot Circus shopping quarter is but a stone’s throw away (and a short one at that). The theatre, cinema, concert hall, St Nicholas Market, Castle Park and the floating harbour can all be reached in less than a minute's walk. The BBC, Bristol Royal Infirmary and Bristol University are all nearby.

name: Home in Redland · ★4.80 · 5 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: higgihaus@hampton (#46) is a mere stone's throw from Cotham Hill and the Whiteladies Road, both chock full of shops, restaurants, coffee shops, leisure facilities (including a cinema and gym) and all the transport options you’ll likely need when staying in our awesome city (including the train at Clifton Down). The Downs (400 acres of amazing parkland) is a hop, skip and a jump away in one direction and the city centre is a short walk in the other. Clifton Village, the Gloucester Road, Stokes Croft and the Harbourside are all easily reached on foot. The BBC, Bristol Royal Infirmary and Bristol University are all nearby.

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
The flat is located just behind the Old Market area of Bristol, close to Castle Park.

Old Market has a range of pubs, bars and cafes which have a uniquely Bristol feel to them.

The delights of Bristol’s Harbourside is within easy walking distance.
The University of Bristol Campus' are around 25 minutes walk away along with Bristol’s main hospitals, the BRI and St Michael’s around a 15 minute walk away.

There are lots of great restaurants nearby, including Three Brothers Burgers, Thr Glass Boat and the Cargo containers at Whapping Wharf (multiple street food outlets).

The nearest supermarkets are Sainsburys and Tescos (please note these are small versions of these stores).

name: Home in Bristol City · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 shared baths
host_about: #7966 381976All genders welcome.

name: Home in Bristol City · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The old Stables is by a main road and is only a few minutes’ walk downhill to the endearing small village of Westbury on Trym, with its shops, takeaways, restaurants and pubs catering for all tastes.

Westbury Hill is also on the cusp of Durdham Downs, Badocks Woods and Blaise Estate with plenty of space to run or explore.

The Old Stables is a completely annexed building from the main house, enabling private use for our listed guests, should you wish to self-isolate or just have your own space while staying away from home.
host_about: Hi there, we very much look forward to having you to stay! Stephanie

name: Rental unit in Southville · ★4.80 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
host_about: Serviced Accommodation Provider and Web Developer living in Bishopston, Bristol

name: Rental unit in Easton · ★4.71 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This is in the great neighbourhood of Easton, with local parks and bustling streets moments away.

With the popular St Marks Road around the corner, you'll find plenty of choice for eating or takeout, like Dela (incredible Swedish inspired bowl food), Thali Cafe (award winning Indian restaurant and Eco Tiffin takeaway), the East Bristol Bakery (real bread, no preservatives, lots of Sourdough) and loads more (No. 12, Este Kitchen, Greenbank Pub and so on).

For groceries there's the generation-spanning behemoth Bristol Sweet Mart, selling all kinds of incredible produce from around the world, or Matter Whole Foods which does all things organic.
host_about:
Hello we are Hopewell and welcome to our profile. We are dedicated to making sure you enjoy your stay in one of our many homes, be that in the city centre, Clifton or beyond.
We are here to help you enjoy your time with us and get the best out of what Bristol has to offer. 
Our team really has great knowledge of the area so please feel free to ask us any questions.  We are all really passionate about our great city, and are excited about others coming to explore all it has to offer.
Everyone has a role to play in the team, so there is always someone to look after you.
We are experts in Airbnb which started from looking after our own properties, to friends, to the whole of Bristol and beyond. 

We look forward to having you to stay!

name: Rental unit in Clifton · ★4.90 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Our apartment is located on a quiet residential street, set back slightly from the hustle and bustle of the Clifton Triangle.

The harbourside is an easy 15 minute walk down Park Street, which offers a great range of shops, cafes and restaurants. Alternatively, by walking 15 minutes in the other direction you will find yourself in the lovely Clifton Village, known for its boutiques, delis and other independent businesses, as well as the iconic Clifton Suspension Bridge.

name: Bed and breakfast in Bristol · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Only 2.5 miles away from the city centre.
The imperial sports ground with its new bar/bistro is across the road.
The Knowle pub is just up the hill ( great food and gins)
Tesco is walking distance
The nature reserve is just around the corner.
South Bristol Community Hospital, Hengrove park and leisure centre are 1.5 miles away.
Bus stops are close by.
Broadwalk shopping centre is just up the hill.
property_type: Private room in bed and breakfast

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.83 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Just over the river from Temple Meads station, the area is very tranquil, but with easy access to the centre. Cabot Circus shopping centre and the lovely Castle Park are only ten minutes walk away. There is a Starbucks, Wetherspoons and Veeno wine bar nearby, in addition to local pubs like the Barley Mow and the Old Market Assembly.
host_about:
Hello!

We are Ana (Spanish living in UK for six years) and Guy (British). Ana is a documentary filmmaker and Guy is an animator. We usually live in Bristol where we are Airbnb hosts but we LOVE to travel the world. Message us if you have any questions! :)

name: Home in Bishopston · ★4.97 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: Bishopston is a quiet residential area, benefitting from walking distance access to the vibrant Gloucester Road (shops, restaurants, bars) and bustling Henleaze High Street. It is also a 30 minute (1.5 mile) walk to Southmead hospital and a short bus ride to the city centre.

name: Villa in Southville · ★4.88 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
host_about:
Hello! and welcome to our profile.

Your Apartment- Bristol, is passionate about providing unique living spaces that make guests feel more at home than at a hotel. A family run business, we have established ourselves as Bristol’s leading provider of serviced apartments.

Offering a wide selection of boutique-style serviced apartments at affordable prices. These range from studios to 3-bedrooms, with each apartment interior individually designed by our in-house creative team.

host_about:
Hey I'm Summer, born in Bristol and proud to call it my home. Gym, Coffee and anything dog obsessed!
I love to travel and try new things, there is so much of the world to see and always something new to try!
my favourite quote - 'A comfort zone is a beautiful place but nothing ever grows there'.

name: Townhouse in Fishponds · ★4.67 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The property is ideally placed for those seeking to walk to local shops, supermarkets, as well as some exciting pubs and cafes.
Tucked away behind the cul-de-sacs, the Railway Path is a beautiful walk or cycle route running from just behind Temple Meads in Bristol to the Pultney Bridge in Bath. The Fishponds stretch includes an old railway tunnel hidden amidst the trees, an abandoned rail station surrounded by damson trees (well laden in the summer) and long, tangled banks of blackberry bushes.

Get down there at the right time of year and you can enjoy a peaceful countryside meander without venturing too far from the city, and do some urban scrumping while you’re at it.

Venture to the end of Fishponds High Street, and not far beyond you’ll find The Cross Hands pub.
Like most of Fishponds, this lovely unpretentious local is easily overlooked due to it’s unassuming location at the fork between two dull-looking roads. However, the pub offers a lovely cosy a

name: Home in Bristol · ★4.90 · 5 bedrooms · 5 beds · 3.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The house is in a leafy suburb and still only 10 minutes from the city.

It's really a hidden gem, we are in the city but with the privacy of a private house at the end of a cul de sac that isn't overlooked.

The famous Bristol Downs is a 5 minute walk and you are just 5 minutes away from a choice of bus routes.

We are so lucky to have so many restaurants, cafes and great shopping just a stone's throw away and Bristol Zoo and Clifton Village and Clifton Suspension Bridge is just a 15/ 20 min walk away.

name: Home in Bristol · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
Knowle is in South Bristol, five minutes from Temple Meads station by car/taxi.

Our house is right next to Redcatch Park a very cute little park with a fab Community Garden which has a cafe open every day. Knowle is perched on top of one Bristol's many hills and is on the way to historic Bath and Wells which are both about ten miles away. We're right next to the historic coloured houses of Totterdown. The views from the top of Redcatch Road are amazing- you can see the whole of Bristol including the Clifton Suspension Bridge, Cabot Tower, the University Wills Building and Bristol Cathedral.

Knowle is perfectly placed to get to Bristol Harbour and the city centre attractions and venues including the Bristol Beacon, Hippodrome and the 02 Academy, within a ten minute car or cab ride (or a twenty minute downhill walk). There are also e-scooters available in nearby roads, if you're feeling extra adventurous.

Nearby is the award winning Arnos Vale Cemetery,
host_about:
I'm Sian and my husband is Steve. 

We have a pampered pug called Rachel and four grown up kids between us. We moved to Bristol in 2021. We're both designers and we love cinema, art, and our new home. We've been restoring it since we arrived, honouring its Victorian bones while adding our own eclectic taste. The guest room and accompanying bathroom have been lovingly redesigned and created.

We hope you'll love them.

name: Rental unit in Saint Paul's · ★4.56 · Studio · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Based right next to the City Centre, St.Paul's & Montpelier are one of the most diverse cultural areas in Bristol. It is a vivid local art scene where you will find various pieces by local street artists including world famous BANKSY.

Stokes Croft also recently known as Entrepreneurs mile hosts an array of local Food, clothing and Art.

There are many live music nights and no two nights are the same.

Bristol Harbour, Bristol Zoo, The History Museum, Bristol Cathedral are just a few of the attractions within easy reach of this flat.

Cabot Circus, Bristol's newest shopping Quarter is literally 3 mins walk, so you wont have to carry you bags full of shopping very far!!

Full of all major high street brands Cabot Circus also has its fair share of designer shops including Hugo Boss & Harvey Nichols.

We welcome long term guests and our property is also Family friendly.

If you have any special requirements please le
host_about: I'm what most people would call a 'MAN-CHILD'!! I believe in living, experiencing and enjoying life always...... I don't believe in waiting for permission to do so! Very keen snowboarder for almost 30 years, skater, skateboarder, BMX'r, artist, architecture and designer. My nickname is TINTIN....when you see me you will know why..

name: Home in Knowle · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Because Somerset Road forms the top edge of Arnos Vale's beautiful Victorian cemetery, there are no 'cut through' roads between Wells Road (A37) and Bath Road (A4), and no passing traffic at all. So, despite it's proximity to many useful major routes into and out of Bristol, the area is extremely quiet. Because of the elevation (it sits at the top of a hill), and the fact that we border the 48 acre nature reserve at Arnos Vale, the air quality is also excellent.

There is a very well stocked local corner shop a couple of minutes walk away (literally round the corner!), and nearby Wells Road offers restaurants and shops. Major supermarkets etc also within walking distance.

Through Arnos Court park you can get to Paintworks with the super cool Bocabar for drinks, coffee, cocktails and excellent food and pizzas. Beyond there are several craft beer taprooms, the new Wake The Tiger interactive art installation, and other interesting venues in the rapidly developing St
host_about: I'm a freelance media producer, so a lot of the time I'm working from home. I'm also a musician, photographer, cook, writer, philosopher and all round renaissance man! Lived in Bristol for 25 years, and it's a city I love and I know well, so if you're new to town I can give you some tips for finding interesting and uniquely Bristol-style culture.

name: Condo in Bristol City · ★4.86 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
A stylish Grade II listed apartment in central Bristol. Extremely close to bars, restaurants, shopping, and museums. The perfect place to explore Bristol Old City and the surrounding areas. The apartment is located on St. Nicholas Street. has been used for filming on BBC productions.

My apartment is close to parks, art, and culture. Moments from the river walk and few minutes to harbourside and best sights, culture, and nightlife of Bristol. It’s also the next street from Bristol’s historical St. Nicholas Market.
host_about:
I'm Zowie,

Mother of two beautiful children and business woman in the hospitality industry of independent restaurant, bar and afternoon tea parlour.

Travelled a few bit before, one of the many reasons I love about visiting other countries is to experience the culture of it; foods, music, shows (different types - theatrical, comedy, concerts etc), insanely beautiful views and for the magical memories made in each journey.

Lived in Bristol for almost 6 years now and before that in South Wales (mostly Cardiff) for almost 10 years. So I know both areas really well.

name: Rental unit in Clifton · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Clifton Village is the heart of Bristol full of artisan shops, stylish delis and independent bakeries. There are also many delicious places to dine out including The Ivy Clifton Brasserie, Fishers is a wonderful independent fish restaurant, The White Lion Bar in the Avon Gorge Hotel overlooks the suspension bridge and The Clifton Albion which does 5 Star Award winning Roasts on a Sunday.

name: Home in Bristol City · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Best part of this place is that it is next to the biggest leisure centre of the city which has a swimming pool, gym, and lots of other activities.
Hengrove park with cinema and restaurants is just a 5min walk. Imperial park shopping centre is 10min walk.
Aldi supermarket is a closest one and there are Co-op and Asda supermarkets just 15mins away.

name: Tiny home in Ashley Down · ★4.82 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview:
Ashley Down is just above a thriving local pub and city farm, you can see the allotments from my back garden, and also a 20 minute walk from Cabot Circus shopping, Stokes Croft and it’s lively bars etc. There is also a bus into town right outside the building, and a parking spot for e-scooters you can hire just outside the flat, for a quick 5 minute trip into town.

Also round the corner from the cricket ground and Memorial Stadium, very close for sports and events.
host_about:
I've been a user of Airbnb as a guest for years now and had some great stays in great places. I'm a keen traveller and loved to get away to the outdoors and different places. 

I've decided to list my space now I have a spare bedroom and a cosy guest cabin in the garden in my 2 bed apartment in central Bristol. I'd love to help make your stay as comfortable and easy as you like, so just let me know anything you need, also happy to let you have your own space and freedom to enjoy the awesome city on my doorstep!

name: Guest suite in Clifton · ★4.87 · Studio · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We think Bristol is the coolest place on earth and the Green Room, is brilliantly placed to explore it all from.

Close to home, the local area has cafes, restaurants and local shops for almost anything you could need. The Downs and the Botanic Gardens are on the doorstep.

A half hour walk can take you to the Centre and Harbourside, with their theatres, Waterside restaurants and bars, aquarium, We the Curious, M shed and the SS Great Britain.
Walk the same distance in a different direction and find yourself in the heart of alternative Bristol in Stokes Croft and the Gloucester Road, Europe's longest Street of independent shops.
Another direction again and a half hour's walk will take you to classy boho Clifton Village, with its cafes, antique shops, little independents and of course the world famous Suspension Bridge and visitor centre, Observatory and the Avon gorge.
The BBC, University and BRI are also close by.

neighborhood_overview:
We are located in an industrial inner suburb of Bristol. It is bounded by River Avon and Harbour feeder canal

We share our warehouse with Kingsland Studios, a creative hub of over 50 independent craft businesses. Our location is not residenital and whilst actually is a safe area, if walking at night - can feel lonely due to majority of buildings being used during the day.

We love our quirky industrial home and think you will too, it is a brilliant base to explore Bristol and all this wonderful city has to offer.

We are very close (0.5mile, 10minute walk to be exact!) to Temple Meads train station, Within a mile of us (15minute walk), there is a large shopping centre, a number of restaurants, a theatre and Motion nightclub as well as many other things.

name: Home in Shirehampton · ★4.79 · 4 bedrooms · 8 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Plenty of green parkland, a bustling High Street, village pubs, a church, a greengrocer and only around four miles from the centre of Bristol. Is it really possible to live on the edge of the city and yet still feel part of a genuine village community.
The next thing any local worth his or her salt will tell you is that it is not actually Shirehampton, but ‘the Shire’. The name, of course, speaks volumes: this is no ordinary district of Bristol, but a closely-knit community immensely proud of its traditional, village-like feel.
Tucked away in the far northwest corner of the city, the Shire sits on the edge of the River Avon, close to Avonmouth Docks and separated from the rest of Bristol by the beautiful Blaise Castle Estate. The location presented early residents of the Shire with something of a headache – until the completion of the Avonmouth Bridge in 1974, the only way of getting across the River Avon to neighbouring Somerset was in a small row ferry that ran between a l

name: Rental unit in Bristol City · ★4.33 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
Home in Bedminster · ★4.98 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Located just off Bristol's popular North Street with pubs, theatre, bars, restaurants, cafes, supermarkets and a fantastic selection of independent retailers.

A short walk to Bristol Harbour with boat trips, museums, aquarium, cinema and its new Cargo development offering a host of Bristol's tastiest eateries.

Bristol's Park Street, Cathedral, Cabot Circus Shopping Centre and St Nicholas Market are all within reach by foot, bus or e-scooter.

South Bristol has wonderful parks and green spaces including Ashton Court Estate, Leigh Woods and Windmill Hill City Farm.

North Somerset and the Mendip Hills are an accessible 20min drive.

name: Home in Bristol City · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The Downs, a large open parkland, is walkable from our house.

Henleaze high street has lots of shops and Whiteladies road and Westbury on Trym village are also close by. The Westbury Park Tavern and The Cambridge Arms are our nearest pubs. Prego and Little French restaurants are both worth a visit we also have a lovely local deli - Little Shop and Pantry.

Clifton village and the famous suspension bridge are nearby as well as Leigh Woods and Ashton Court which are great for walking and mountain biking.

There is lots to see and do and some fabulous places to eat and drink around Bristol harbourside.

name: Home in Southville · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview:
Street art, street parties and street food - just a few reasons to visit this vibrant corner of South Bristol. It’s a quick and easy walk from Southville to Wapping Wharf and the Harbourside across Gaol Ferry Bridge. Before you hop over to the other side of the river, take your time exploring the quiet streets.

As you walk around Southville you’ll notice that we have a lot of amazing street art and that’s mainly due to the fact that Upfest, Europe’s largest street art festival, takes place here every year. Make sure you look up and down every side street you pass by, as you never know where you might spot a fantastic mural by a world-renowned artist.

name: Tiny home in Bristol City · ★4.90 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Windmill Hill is an eclectic, friendly and vibrant part of Bristol.
There is plenty to do and see in the local area: The City farm, The Harbourside, Wapping Wharf, The Malago river, Victoria Park, Perretts Park and North st shopping to name a few!

Annually there are some amazing events in the vicinity: Art on the Hill (The Arts trail) Balloon Fiesta and Upfest.

There are some good local pubs: The Victoria, The Distillery, The Rising Sun and The Brunel. Lots of great eateries too: Souk Kitchen, The Sundial, The Toast room, Yafo, The Lounge, The Tobacco factory, Mc Donald's, Acapella's and Florence pizzeria.

name: Condo in Montpelier · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Rental unit in Clifton · ★4.62 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This beautiful studio apartment is tucked away on a quiet street in Clifton. Bristol is well-known for being a Georgian city with pretty architecture, and Clifton village is one of the city's most desirable locations. Within five minutes you can walk to a plethora of independent shops, cafes, pubs and restaurants as well as handy convenience stores such as Waitrose and Sainsbury's.

Clifton village is famous for its iconic Suspension Bridge, which stands out dramatically against the striking Avon Gorge. Straight over the bridge is Ashton Court Estate, a beautiful park spanning over 850 acres. There are numerous walking and cycling trails, as well as a Rose Garden, Deer Park and Mansion.

Some of our favourite spots in Clifton village include The White Lion rooftop bar, as well as The Fringe Jazz Bar, The Albion Pub, Bosco Pizzeria, Chandos Deli and East Village Cafe. You're also in a great spot to explore further afield: including Whiteladies Road, Park Street
host_about:

After using Airbnb as a guest and host for many years, we decided to put our experience to good use and founded Guesthoo - Cornwall & Devon's first Airbnb management company. Now managing properties all over Cornwall, Devon & the South West, we are wholly committed to ensuring our guests have the best experience possible when staying with us. Search 'Guesthoo' online for more information.

name: Condo in Clifton · ★4.95 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Clifton is Bristol's most stylish neighbourhood, lined with grand Georgian homes and beautiful architecture. Brunel's iconic Suspension Bridge is a 10-minute walk from the flat and is a must-see. The village itself is bursting with independent shops and chic eateries (Clifton Arcade is well worth a visit), from the famous Clifton Lido (where you can also have a swim and a massage) to The Ivy or more relaxed Primrose Cafe. If you prefer to eat at home, there is a Sainsbury's and Waitrose within 5-minutes' walk, plus a fishmonger, wine shop, two delis and two excellent greengrocers in the Village.
host_about: I moved to Bristol last summer after 31 years in London, and am a full-time journalist (and wannabe interior designer!). Since I arrived I've been busy renovating my Clifton flat and getting to know the area, which I already adore. There is so much to discover in Bristol - especially in Clifton, which is particularly beautiful - that I'm confident you'll fall in love with it just like I have.

neighborhood_overview:
Stokes Croft - A vibrant multicultural area with lots of independent shops, cafes and bars.

Cabot Circus - Bristol's main retail hub with a mix of high street and high end brands as well as lots of Restaurants.

Gloucester Road - A famous Bristol street, running north from the centre and lined with independent shops, restaurants and bars. The vibe of this iconic street has been replicated in many areas around the city, none more so than North street in Bedminster.

North Street Bedminster - Many independent shops and bars line this thriving South Bristol street all the way down to Ashton gate stadium the recently redeveloped 27,000 seat capacity home of Bristol City & The Bristol Bears.

Clifton - Streets lined with beautiful Georgian buildings, home to multiple museums and galleries as well as the world famous Clifton Suspension Bridge, the Avon Gorge Hotel has a huge terrace with fantastic views of the bridge. The place to go for high end res

name: Townhouse in United Kingdom · ★4.86 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Redcliffe is an historic district of Bristol, with strong maritime links. A nearby house in the street featured in a recent BBC documentary A House Through Time.
A couple of great traditional pubs are very close; the Golden Guinea and the Ostrich are under a minute's walk away. Two Michelin starred restaurants (Casa and Paco Tapas) are just at the end of the street. Wapping Wharf, home to restaurants, street food take-aways and bars is under 5 minute's walk away.

neighborhood_overview:
Montpelier is an area just north of Bristol’s city centre that is well known for its bohemian vibe. In fact, in February 2018, it was named the hippest area in the UK.

It is a wonderful area to visit in Bristol, and it has its own distinct feel with its beautiful terraced houses, many of which are painted in pastel colours. As such, Montpelier is a decidedly cool residential area that is a popular choice when it comes to choosing a location to visit in Bristol.

Shops
There are a few good shops in Montpelier, most of which are on Picton Street. These include Radford Mill Farm Shop, which has been operating for decades. It specialises in whole foods and organic vegetables, and it’s a great place to shop for all your local, ethically sourced foods.

C & T Licata & Son is an Italian deli that has also been around for many years. It is located on Picton Street, and good food and wine are sold in the delicatessen.

There is also a Tesco Express
host_about: We are your professional property manager that cares about giving the best guest experience: that’s why our friendly, round-the-clock Support Team is here to help! We’ll tell you everything you need to know before check-in, and answer any questions during your stay.

name: Rental unit in Redland · ★4.48 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Situated just a 2 minute walk from the vibrant Cotham Hill and Whiteladies Road, our light and spacious flat is the perfect spot for your Bristol getaway! The flat is well connected by public transport, and there is a Voi scooter parking spot very nearby if you want to scoot around the city instead. The city centre is around a 25 minute walk from the flat and filled with shops, restaurants and other attractions. 25 minute walk to the stunning harbourside, and 20 min walk to Clifton Village.
host_about: We are a family of 3 and live in London. We are delighted to share our Bristol home with you where it is our beloved holiday home. The flat is situated in one of the most desirable part of Bristol. Lots bars, restaurants and shops nearby. We love the beautiful period features of the flat, especially the big bay windows in the living room. We treat our Bristol home with love and care, hope you will enjoy your stay in our home too!

neighborhood_overview:
Our house is in a residential area, 6 miles from Bristol City Centre. Interestingly, we are near Cossham Memorial Hospital which is officially the highest point in Bristol .

A Coop Food Store is 5 minutes walk away and there is a corner shop 5 minutes walk in the opposite direction. There is a leisure centre and swimming pool 10 minutes walk away and near to that, is a pub which offers good value food including vegetarian and vegan.

Kingswood has a shopping centre which is one mile away and has free parking. It has well known High Street Retailers, alongside smaller shops. It also has a Wetherspoons, local pubs and wine bars, restaurants and cafes.

We enjoy exploring both near and far.

name: Condo in Bristol City · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
Home in Bristol City · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This is a unique and quirky neighbourhood. It began as a self-build eco-project, and has grown into a strong and supportive community which cares passionately about our community and environment. We are a mile from the city centre, but surrounded by green spaces - a nature reserve, allotment gardens and the City Farm (kids love petting and feeding the animals) with the excellent Farm cafe and playground. We have Mina Park and playground, a great butcher/baker (Popti & Beast), fab Italian cafe (Napolita), organic grocers (Chaya Veggies), and Better Foods organic supermarket nearby. There are several excellent pubs within 5 mins walk - The Farm has a great garden and live music, the Duke of York is a famous fave. The Climbing Academy and Bloc indoor climbing centres are nearby.

The area has a very relaxed and alternative feel, with lots of fabulous street art which constantly changes, and because we are so centrally located many great Bristol locations are just a walk away -
host_about: Hi, I'm a young retiree, I love travelling, alone or with my partner, meeting people, having new experiences. I enjoy staying in friendly places and shared homes, so I love Airbnb, both as a guest and hosting others in my own home. I know what makes a good guest and a good stay, and I’m delighted to have been accepted as a Superhost.

Condo in Bristol City · ★4.97 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
I have always lived in Westbury on Trym, it’s safe, respectable and so conveniently located for everything you might need.
There is free & unlimited 24/7 on street parking, which is priceless now in Bristol.
It is great having so much within a stone’s throw, local shops, banks, cafes for breakfast or afternoon tea & cake.
Canford Park, is a couple of minutes walk away, if you want to chill & relax outdoors.
The two iconic Westbury pubs, The Prince of Wales & Black Swan, are seconds away!
I would recommend Al Fresco Italian restaurant, or just pick up a Chinese takeaway from Chim’s.
There are many more restaurants, from Thai to Indian, or just good old pub grub from the other pubs in Westbury Village.
Fish & Chips and Turkish Kebabs, all nearby.
And also the bus links to get to the city centre or Cribbs Causeway, for daytime shopping, or a good night out!

name: Condo in Bristol City · ★4.93 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Located at the ‘top’ of Gloucester Road you are spoiled for choice when it comes to nearby pubs, restaurants, take aways and independent shops. Decent sized Tesco, Co-op, Lidl and Aldi supermarkets each about a 10min walk. Bobby’s convenience store, Domino’s Pizza, Bristol Fryer chippy, a 24hr petrol station and the rather excellent Dalton’s Butchers are reached in a couple of minutes.
Southmead Hospital with it’s A&E is 10-15mins walk, local medical centre and attached pharmacy is by the petrol station.
For sports fans the location could not be better as you have the Memorial Stadium across the road (parking can be tricky when a match is on!), the Gloucestershire County Cricket ground is 10-15mins walk, and Horfield Sports Centre, with it’s Olympic sized pool is just as close.

name: Home in Southville · ★4.91 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
My space is in an ideal spot from which to explore Bristol, visit family/friends or provide a base during one of the city's many festivals. Stackpool Road is a main walking/cycling route for people who live in Southville into the city centre. It's a fantastic location, just south of the city centre.

I live in an urban, family neighbourhood, which is very quiet at night despite its proximity to the city centre and has a steady flow of foot traffic during the day. Southville has a strong community spirit and people are friendly. Our 'corner shop' is Better Foods (an organic mini-market), a 24-hour ASDA is five minutes walk away or you can shop at independent stores on East Street and North Street.

Old Market was the first part of the city to be built around the medieval castle (sadly now gone) and today is a thriving bohemian shopping quarter in Bristol.

Old Market Quarter is home to a great selection of shops from vintage fashion and antique shops, independent furniture stores to specialist climbing and motorcycle stores. As you peruse the shops on street level, be sure to look up at the array of architectural designs of the buildings.

This area is known for its LGBTQ+ friendly shops, pubs, bars and clubs and detailed listings can be found on the Old Market Quarter website.

name: Home in Bedminster · ★4.79 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The house is in a prime location for exploring Bristol and its surrounding areas, just a 10-minute drive from the hustle and bustle of the city centre and all of the must see attractions.
North Street is a 15-minute walk from the house, known to be a mini Stokes Croft, it has of lots bars and restaurants as well as cool independent shops and cafes. It is also where Upfest takes place, one of Europe’s largest street art festivals, where you will find the works of many talented artists displayed across the buildings.
A 20-minute walk from the house you will find Ashton Gate Stadium, home to Bristol City FC and Bristol Bears Rugby, the venue also holds concerts during the summer.
The house is located opposite Parson Street train station allowing guests to easily hop on a train to many of the surrounding areas, it is also on a direct bus route into the city centre.

Culture Calling says: “Gloucester Road in Bristol is famous among locals and visitors alike for encapsulating the relaxed yet vibrant atmosphere of the city. Here you'll find a welcoming selection of cosy cafes, small shops, street art, lovely pubs and traditional independent businesses like butchers, hardware stores and newsagents.”

name: Home in Bristol City · ★4.82 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The stylish family home is situated in a very friendly neighbourhood of Victoria Park in South Bristol. It is a residential area of Bristol, so there are lots of welcoming families and young professionals. The best part of the house is the location. It is situated about 100m from Victoria Park, one of the biggest and best parks of Bristol. This is perfect for anyone wanting a daily walk, run or to relax in the sunshine over the weekend.

There are local corner shops, plus an amazing bakery about 3-5 minutes walk from the house, plus 2 amazing pubs (The Victoria Park Pub and The Star & Dove) within 5-10 minutes walk. There are also larger shops including Tesco Express, Asda, Lidl all within 5-10 minutes drive away from the house.

Victoria Park is beautiful and a perfect spot to watch the sunset over Bristol. It is also walking distance from Southville, Bedminster, Wapping Wharf & Harbourside and Bristol city centre.

name: Home in Baptist Mills · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
St. Werburghs has a lovely community feel, with bags of green space within walking distance, from Narroways, which has one of the best views of the city, to Mina Road park, which is full of neighbourhood pooches. St.Werbs has an amazing ability to make you forget you're in the city, whilst being on the doorstep to all that vibrant Bristol has to offer.

Mina road (2 mins walk) has some excellent fruit, veg, butchers, bakers and convenience shops, and some delicious options for eating (wraps, Indian, Italian and more).

Locally you can enjoy a fresh pint at the Wiper and True taproom (3 mins walk), home of one of Bristol's most exciting breweries, or stop in at the delightful Duke of York pub, about 30 seconds from the front door.

neighborhood_overview:
Coalshed is located in Southville, Bristol. It’s an area of rich coal mine history and backs onto Dame Emily Park, which is a local skatepark with tons of green space, play area, community garden and ball courts

Bristol was named as the best place to live in the UK in a guide by the Sunday Times and Southville is regarded as one of the most sought after areas within it.

Independent cafes, restaurants and shops fill North Street, which is a few moments stroll away from Coalshed.

Each Year Southville hosts a number of events, including UpFest, Europe’s largest Street Art and Graffiti Festival, Bedminster Winter Lantern Parade and North Street Summer and Christmas Fairs.

Coalshed is about a 10-15minute walk away from the City Centre, Harbourside, Southville life has everything you could wish for...

name: Condo in Bristol City · ★4.95 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Located at the ‘top’ of Gloucester Road you are spoiled for choice when it comes to nearby pubs, restaurants, take aways and independent shops. Decent sized Tesco, Co-op, Lidl and Aldi supermarkets each about a 10min walk. Bobby’s convenience store, Domino’s Pizza, Bristol Fryer chippy, a 24hr petrol station and the rather excellent Dalton’s Butchers are reached in a couple of minutes.
Southmead Hospital with it’s A&E is 10-15mins walk, local medical centre and attached pharmacy is by the petrol station.
For sports fans the location could not be better as you have the Memorial Stadium across the road (parking can be tricky when a match is on!), the Gloucestershire County Cricket ground is 10-15mins walk, and Horfield Sports Centre, with it’s Olympic sized pool is just as close.
For some open space you can enjoy Horfield Common (a few minutes walk) with it’s city views, cafe and tennis courts. The nature reserves of Stoke Park and Badock’s Wood are a little further but b

name: Condo in Ashley Down · ★4.41 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Ashley Down borders Bishopston, Horfield and St. Werburghs (so you can easily take a stroll around the allotments and city farm). In recent years, it's become an extremely popular area, partly because of its excellent schools. It's also perfectly positioned near the local delights of Gloucester Road and benefits from easy access to both the city centre and all major travel links - see Bishopston.

Ashley Down has a vibrant mix of young professionals, families and a small student population.

Many of the two-bedroom period houses in the predominantly Victorian terraced streets have been extended with loft conversions. There's also a number of large, detached villas on and around Ashley Down Road.

There are also modern townhouses of all sizes following the development of the old Bristol College buildings. Beautiful apartments are available in the recently-converted Muller House, a former grand old orphanage dating from 1849, and the adjacent developments.

Hello we are Hopewell and welcome to our profile. We are dedicated to making sure you enjoy your stay in one of our many homes, be that in the city centre, Clifton or beyond.
We are here to help you enjoy your time with us and get the best out of what Bristol has to offer. 
Our team really has great knowledge of the area so please feel free to ask us any questions.  We are all really passionate about our great city, and are excited about others coming to explore all it has to offer.
Everyone has a role to play in the team, so there is always someone to look after you.
We are experts in Airbnb which started from looking after our own properties, to friends, to the whole of Bristol and beyond. 

We look forward to having you to stay!

name: Home in Southville · ★4.93 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Vibrant Southville is a laid-back residential area and cultural hub on the River Avon’s south bank. At its heart is the dynamic Tobacco Factory Theatres, staging contemporary plays in converted industrial buildings. On lively North Street, the Upfest Gallery organises a popular summer street-art festival. Hip eateries, delis, and craft-beer bars dot the street, and bay-windowed Victorian terraces line nearby roads. The Docks and city centre are just a short walk away where you'll find and abundance of things to entertain you.
We're close to nature, nightlife, shopping, boat rides, air balloon rides, mountain biking and so much more.
host_about:
Welcome to Bristol. 
We are your hosts, Ken and Angelique. 
Thank you for booking your stay with us. Bristol is a wonderful destination and we hope you enjoy your stay in our beautiful city. 
We hope you have a great stay.
