name: Home in Bristol City · ★4.89 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Local Pubs and Restaurants

20 minute walk away from trendy North Street with lots of excellent bars, restaurants, coffe shops, etc. Nearest good pub is The Victoria Park Tavern (5 mins away). The Rising Sun (up on Windmill Hill) is also a nice pub.

25 minute walk to the south side of Bristol docks and the Cargo containers at Whapping Wharf which is packed full of excellent independent bars, shops and restaurants.

Transport Links

Bus stop outside house with frequent buses into city centre. Bristol Temple Meads train station 5 minutes by car/taxi or 20 minute walk. Bedminster station 10 minute walk (30 minutes from here to Weston-Super-Mare and then on to beautiful Devon).

Nearest Shops

Local shop/newsagent/post office 5 minute walk away on St Johns Lane. Bakery 5 minutes walk away. Local Tesco Metro 15 minute walk away in Totterdown. Nearest Supermarket (Lidl) 15 minute walk away.

Nearest high street 20 minute

name: Condo in Saint Paul's · ★4.81 · 2 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 baths
Home in Brislington · ★4.80 · 3 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
There are some of Bristol’s hidden gems on the doorstep. Short walk to local amenities on bustling Sandy Park Road; deli, greengrocers, post office and independent coffee shops.

If you want a break from the city centre, there are a choice of green spaces within a short walk; Arnos Vale Park and Cemetery, Nightingale Valley, Callington Road Nature Reserve.

name: Condo in Bishopston · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The flat is located in St Andrews Park, just two streets back from Gloucester Road - the longest street of independent shops in Europe! You'll find lots of great restaurants, bars and cafe's here.

We're also right next to St Andrews Park. A little leafy oasis. We'll leave out some ping pong bats and balls if you fancy using the table in the park!

COOP is the nearest grocery shop. It's about 15 second walk. You won't miss it.

There is free street parking on all the streets around the house. It's usually pretty easy to find a space. Except perhaps on a sunny Saturday morning.

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
Home in Bristol City · ★4.92 · 4 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Thingwall Park is a leafy street of Edwardian houses, in an oasis of calm from the city. Our house backs onto allotments and then the Frome valley, so it doesnt feel like being in the city. There are several footpaths that lead directly down to the river. From it is easy off-road walking or cycling to Snuff Mills, Oldbury Court and Purdown. Eastville Park is a 5 minute walk away at the end of Thingwall Park. Our closest children's playground is here.
Bristol is a charismatic city offering lots of its own food and culture to explore.
From the house, within easy walking distance is the Star pub, Gorilla Thai take-away, and supermarkets.
There are plenty of buses into Bristol City Centre with a bus stop 2 minutes from the house on Fishponds road. The journey to the harbourside and cathedral takes 15-20 minutes.

name: Home in Shirehampton · ★4.0 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
Condo in Bristol City · ★4.22 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are situated at the bottom of the road close the all the fun and water front
Literally cross over the road and you are at the waterfront take a right and you can jump on the Grain Barge a floating pub which serves great food and local beers too
They have quiz nights curry nights pie and a pint night it’s fabulous
If you sit on the deck with the trestle tables you always get chatting to people it’s my happy place

Take the left stroll along the water front and you will soon be able to find a cluster of eateries bars and seating areas Spoke and Stringer i highly recommended
If you carry on walking your soon and Millennium Square @Bristol is a must
pop over the bridge and SS Great Britain is waiting for you to board for a historical educational trip on this Iconic piece of history
You will fall in love with the City i guarantee as i did

name: Condo in Redland · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 5 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Tucked in a quiet side street just off the bustling Whiteladies road this apartment is perfectly set for relaxing and exploring.

Whiteladies road is home to an array of bars and restaurants such as:
The Spiny Lobster
Pizza Workshop
Bosco Pizzeria
Clifton Thai
Alter ego
Pasta loco
Bravas
Kings arms To name a few

Clifton downs are just a short walk up whiteladies road where you can take scenic walks and attend a variety of organised festivals and events throughout the year.
A short walk down Whiteladies road and you will come to The Clifton Triangle. Here there are many more shops bars and restaurants as well as Bristol University and Bristol Royal infirmary, from here you can walk down Bristol's most famous street - Park street and take in the views of the centre and the Christmas lights if you're lucky enough to be visiting in December!
The bottom of park street leads you to Bristol's iconic waterfront area.

name: Home in Bishopston · ★5.0 · 5 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Located in Bishopston, a leafy residential area close to Bristol City Centre. Walking distance to Westbury Park (restaurants, cinema, delicatessens, shops and Waitrose supermarket) and Gloucester Road (alternative shops and great restaurants and pubs). Beautiful Clifton village with its boutique shops and restaurants close by.

The house is also walking distance from Durdham Downs with views to Brunel's suspension bridge, Avon Gorge and out to the Bristol Channel.

Bristol City centre with shops, galleries, museums and nightlife is a short drive, bus or taxi ride away.

Mendip Hills and the Cotswolds within 45 minutes as well as lots of beautiful countryside locations for walks.

Regional attractions Bath City Centre, Bristol Zoo, Wild Place, Longleat, The Wave (surfing lake), Cheddar Gorge, Wookey Hole and Chepstow Castle all within 1 hour drive time.

name: Home in Clifton · ★4.90 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: A stone's throw from Whiteladies Road, you'll be ideally located for the excellent local shopping and food, as well as tourist attractions such as the Clifton Suspension Bridge and the museum. Additionally, those visiting the University of Bristol would find the location very convenient.
host_about: STR manager/ co-host from Bristol, UK. I manage a variety of different types of listings across Bristol and Bath, and believe an attentive, personal touch is what makes for an unforgettable stay. I love meeting new members of the Airbnb community as they pass through my city, or as I pass through theirs!

Hello we are Hopewell and welcome to our profile. We are dedicated to making sure you enjoy your stay in one of our many homes, be that in the city centre, Clifton or beyond.

name: Home in Bristol City · ★4.83 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Totterdown is a lovely area in South Bristol with a community feel. There are great restaurants, pubs and a Co-op within 5-10 minutes walk. The house is also walking distance to several parks, Temple Meads station, the city centre and Bedminster/North Street which has many independent shops, bars, restaurants and a great market every Sunday.
On our street is Arnos Vale cemetery, a unique heritage site with 45 green acres of spectacular Victorian Garden Cemetery. It is very peaceful and full of history and we enjoy walking there most days.
host_about: Hello we are Ellie and Adam, Bristol based and often looking for new places to escape for long weekends and trips. We have recently decided to put our home on Airbnb when we are away and look forward to sharing our love for Bristol and Totterdown with others!

name: Rental unit in Redland · ★4.78 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This is a lovely neighborhood to walk around in. We recommend coffee from either Burra or Tradewind.

We are a short uphill walk to the Downs, a 450 acre space in the middle of Bristol.

There are assorted supermarkets nearby. Wild Oats an organic supermarket and Tesco and Sainsburys locals. There is also a Good Food on Whiteladies Road.

The Spiny Lobster on Whiteladies Road is a restaurant and fishmonger, and there are plenty of other eating options within walking distance.
host_about: Just a person

name: Home in Bristol City · ★4.67 · 5 bedrooms · 5 beds · 1 shared bath
host_about:
Dear Guest,

Welcome to a modern, stylish and newly renovated house. We tried to think about every single detail that you would need during your stay. There are three double and one single room in our house. It is close to public transportation for city centre and all other locations in and around Bristol. 

Most importantly Metrobus which takes you very quickly to your target destination is in short walking distance. Wifi connection, garden sitting area, study and work space is available in every room. We would really appreciate if you help us keep the house sparkly clean by strictly applying no shoes, pets and smoking policy during your stay. 

This just a very short description, a lot more comfort and relaxing night is just a click away.

Feel free to ask any questions you have.


Looking forward to host you soon.


Many thanks,

Meryem

name: Home in Bishopston · ★4.73 · 4 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The coolest neighbourhood in Bristol. We’ve written a guide to the stuff that is within a 5 minute walk (or occasionally 10). Loads of cafes, bakeries, restaurants and pubs. The Gloucester Road is also famed for it's independent shops. A couple of minutes from the house and you have book shops, fruit and veg, chocolate makers... Music and clubs are further down the road (around 15 to 25 minutes walk). There are two lively parks 10 minutes walk away.

The town centre isn't far.

name: Vacation home in Easton · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
Townhouse in Bedminster · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
A quiet residential area, just a 5 minute walk from the popular North Street. North Street in Bedminster has many independent shops, cafes and bars and is home to the Tobacco Factory Theatre.

Ashton Gate Stadium is a short 10 minute walk away.

In 30 minutes or less, you can walk to the beautiful Ashton Court, which boasts beautiful views or take a wander over to Bristol Harbourside.

There are great transport links in this area. Parson Street station is a 10 minute walk from the house.

name: Home in Saint Werburgh's · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
Home in Saint Werburgh's · ★4.90 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: There are lots of independent cafes, restaurants, shops, pubs and brewery’s all within a 5 minute walk of the house. As well as the city farm and nature reserve. It’s also on the cycling route in to the city centre should you have bikes.

name: Townhouse in Hotwells · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is a quiet backwater of Clifton, close to Bristol harbour and close to Clifton village, with its lively scene of independent shops, bars and restaurants, and the impressive suspension bridge.
host_about: From UK

name: Condo in Bristol City · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
A stylish, modern apartment close to MOD, UWE, Southmead Hospital, Rolls Royce and Airbus (walking 20-40mins/direct bus routes 5-10mins). Perfect if you are looking for an extended stay with somewhere to work, or just to explore Bristol and its surrounding areas of outstanding beauty.

A quiet neighborhood with no passing traffic. The outlook at the front has playing fields with the occasional dog walker.

Take an early morning walk over the golf course! 👣🚶‍♂️Take a big circular walk around the whole of the perimeter of the golf course. On top you will find a couple of lakes and terrific views of Bristol. It's a wonderful tranquil place to be - but watch out for the golfers! ⛳🏌️

Enjoy the trees and the bird song!

host_about: My husband and I have lived and worked in Bristol for over 20 years, where we've also raised our two daughters, a couple of cats and the occasional chicken. name: Rental unit in Saint Andrew's · ★4.81 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We're tucked behind Gloucester Road, giving you access to all of the vibrancy of this part of the city but with considerably less noise!
You can take advantage of the restaurants, pubs & cocktail bars in the area without an expensive taxi ride at the end of the night
The area has a combination of students, young professionals & families. From time to time there's some noise from children or people getting ready to go out, but for the most part, it's peaceful & friendly and outside of the clean air zone

name: Condo in Bristol City · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Stokes Croft has everything you need, with vibrant bars and restaurants and an array of independent shops. The city centre is a short walk away with easy access to Broadmead and Cabot Circus.
host_about: Hey I'm Ben, a music producer from Bristol. I love travelling the world and meeting new people!

name: Home in Easton · ★4.23 · 3 bedrooms · 5 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:

Bristol Zoo Gardens is 2.6 miles from the apartment, while Ashton Court is 3.7 miles away. The nearest airport is Bristol Airport, 8.7 miles from Fosters Street.

name: Tiny home in Stockwood · ★4.57 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The area really does deliver the best of the country with all the convenience of easy & quick links to both Bristol & Bath without the rush hour traffic.

By day you can take a wander through the nature reserve & view numerous birds (look out for buzzards) & even deer or forage for apples, walnuts and blackberries. By night you can see foxes & badgers.

As far as local amenities are concerned there are the normal pizza, Indian, chippy and cooperative supermarket up the road or you may choose to order a Just Eat, Uber Eats or Deliveroo. In Keynsham (10 minute drive) there are great Indians and a lovely pizza restaurant as well as a Grounded and Bonzo Lounge.

Within driving a 10 minute driving distance we have:
* 24 hour Tesco
* 24 hour Asda
* Lidl
* Aldi
* Waitrose
* Sainsburys

Only being a 20 minute drive to Bristol & a 30 minute drive to Bath, you may want to consider these options:

* 1 minute walk to t

name: Condo in Clifton · ★4.93 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Serviced apartment in Bristol City · ★4.44 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: 4 Berkeley Square, Your Apartment,  is located ideally amongst coffee shops, independent restaurants, grocery stores, and boutique shops. A stone's throw away from the iconic Clifton Suspension bridge and Bristol Zoo Gardens, Clifton is one of Bristol's most exclusive suburbs and picturesque quarters. Beginning with the Clifton Triangle and reaching into the area affectionately known as Clifton Village, this stunning Georgian area is always hugely popular with visitors.

name: Rental unit in Bristol City · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
Living here you benefit from the city centre location that brings the best of the city right to your doorstep. Whatever it is that you need from restaurants, shops, entertainment and most important a whole host of local amenities are also within easy reach for you.

From your prime city-centre location, you can explore Bristol with ease. The city’s shopping quarter, which includes a Harvey Nichols department store, Primark and Nando’s restaurant, is under five minutes away on foot, and cool and quirky Stokes Croft is just a few minutes in the opposite direction. Here you’ll find independent cafes, live music and graffiti.

Vibrant Stokes Croft is minutes away, where indie shops, eateries, galleries and clubs thrive.

There is plenty around the property too if you are looking.
host_about: Hello from Staykeepers Homes! We are a group of people who love traveling and sharing their experiences with others. But more so, we like to think of ourselves as people who constantly search to challenge and improve themselves.

neighborhood_overview:
When looking to get out and about, you can take a stroll to Park Street, the harbourside, Corn Street, O2 Academy and vintage shops, restaurants and bars.

You’ll love living in this thriving student community where you’ll have a lit social life but also find much-needed privacy in your room and study space.

We are just a stone’s throw away from the city centre and it’s surrounded by some of the most hip pubs and cafes. The foodie in you will also be delighted with the wide variety of multi-cuisine restaurants here.
host_about: Hello from Staykeepers Homes! We are a group of people who love traveling and sharing their experiences with others. But more so, we like to think of ourselves as people who constantly search to challenge and improve themselves.

name: Camper/RV in Bristol City · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
host_about: I live in Bristol. I love traveling and generally getting away as much as possible. I often camp or use my van to go away in and prefer to be somewhere that's not too busy or touristy.

name: Home in Montpelier · ★4.96 · 5 bedrooms · 6 beds · 3.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Montpelier is an area just north of Bristol’s city centre that is well known for its bohemian vibe. It is a wonderful area to visit in Bristol, and it has its own distinct feel with its beautiful terraced houses, many of which are painted in pastel colours.
There is loads to see and do in Montpelier. One of the first things you’ll notice is the street art. The Silent Hobo mural at Montpelier Station is one of the most well-known murals in Bristol.
Much of the best things about Montpelier can be found on the busy, bustling Picton Street. Here you’ll find a fine array of independent shops and restaurants, as well as an excellent family-run Italian delicatessen. Enjoy coffee and cake at The Bristolian, go for dinner at Thali Restaurant or Bianchi's!

name: Home in Bristol City · ★4.83 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This is a quiet cul de sac with lots of greenery on our doorstep, great for walks and cycling, yet still within 5 mins walk of a lively high street.

Fishponds high street has plenty of choice for supermarkets, great pubs and places to eat or get a coffee.

The Bristol to Bath cycle path is 5 mins away, a beautifully green and flat route taking you straight to Temple Meads railway station in one direction (18 mins cycle), or all the way to Bath in the other (1hr 15min cycle), via gorgeous countryside, river swims, and pub gardens. Great for walkers, runners and cyclists alike.

There are also lovely parks on our doorstep.

name: Rental unit in Clifton · ★4.46 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Staying here means you’re close to the popular Whiteladies Road and only a short walk from Clifton Village and Park Street, where you can find plenty of things to do, see, shop and eat.

We recommend visiting Racks Bar & Kitchen, the Lido, and Starlings.

From here you can conveniently access most of Bristol via either car, bus, or train.
host_about:
Hello we are Hopewell and welcome to our profile. We are dedicated to making sure you enjoy your stay in one of our many homes, be that in the city centre, Clifton or beyond.
We are here to help you enjoy your time with us and get the best out of what Bristol has to offer. 
Our team really has great knowledge of the area so please feel free to ask us any questions.  We are all really passionate about our great city, and are excited about others coming to explore all it has to offer.
Everyone has a role to play in the team, so there is always someone to look after you.
We are experts in Airbnb which started from looking after our own properties, to friends, to the whole of Bristol and beyond. 

We look forward to having you to stay!

name: Bed and breakfast in Redland · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: A popular tree-lined street in Redland close to all amenities.
host_about: Steve and Kaz love to travel and their home is full of interesting artefacts from around the world. Steve has lived in Bristol for over 20 years and will gladly recommend great places to eat and visit during your stay.
property_type: Private room in bed and breakfast

name: Home in Bristol City · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · Half-bath
neighborhood_overview: Friendly and very quiet and peaceful

name: Condo in Bristol City · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Home in Redland · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2.5 baths
Rental unit in Bristol City · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
Living here you benefit from the city centre location that brings the best of the city right to your doorstep. Whatever it is that you need from restaurants, shops, entertainment and most important a whole host of local amenities are also within easy reach for you.

From your prime city-centre location, you can explore Bristol with ease. The city’s shopping quarter, which includes a Harvey Nichols department store, Primark and Nando’s restaurant, is under five minutes away on foot, and cool and quirky Stokes Croft is just a few minutes in the opposite direction. Here you’ll find independent cafes, live music and graffiti.

Vibrant Stokes Croft is minutes away, where indie shops, eateries, galleries and clubs thrive.

There is plenty around the property too if you are looking.
host_about: Hello from Staykeepers Homes! We are a group of people who love traveling and sharing their experiences with others. But more so, we like to think of ourselves as people who constantly search to challenge and improve themselves.

The city’s shopping quarter, which includes a Harvey Nichols department store, Primark and Nando’s restaurant, is under five minutes away on foot, and cool and quirky Stokes Croft is just a few minutes in the opposite direction. Here you’ll find independent cafes, live music and graffiti.

Vibrant Stokes Croft is minutes away, where indie shops, eateries, galleries and clubs thrive.

There is plenty around the property too if you are looking.
host_about: Hello from Staykeepers Homes! We are a group of people who love traveling and sharing their experiences with others. But more so, we like to think of ourselves as people who constantly search to challenge and improve themselves.

name: Rental unit in Redland · ★4.96 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Victorian properties on tree lined roads, with access to a local park (2 mins walk) and the popular Downs open space which is 5 mins walk. Local pubs and restaurants, cinema, supermarkets are all within 10 mins walk. It is a very sought after location for families and couples
host_about:
Hi, I love to travel and do so often. I like to explore new cities and places of interest, including historical building and lively markets etc.. I am professional, respectful and love to chat and meet new people.

Steve

name: Rental unit in Bristol City · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
When looking to get out and about, you can take a stroll to Park Street, the harbourside, Corn Street, O2 Academy and vintage shops, restaurants and bars.

You’ll love living in this thriving student community where you’ll have a lit social life but also find much-needed privacy in your room and study space.

We are just a stone’s throw away from the city centre and it’s surrounded by some of the most hip pubs and cafes. The foodie in you will also be delighted with the wide variety of multi-cuisine restaurants here.

name: Home in Cotham · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2.5 baths
host_about: We're a family of 4 from Bristol and are very interested in travel, exploring new cultures and tasting new food. We're also pretty active and all like cycling, walking and freshwater swimming.

name: Home in Clifton · ★4.78 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: The property is set right at the heart of beautiful Clifton Village, surrounded by boutique shops and cafes, and lovely restaurants and eateries. Clifton is a colourful and friendly place, and we have loved this part of Bristol for years - we cannot wait to share it with guests. The property is located on a quiet residential street, tucked away near the Suspension Bridge, but with restaurants at the end of the road (which is very long!) Feel free to ask us more about the area if you like!
host_about:
Hello! Myself and Carly have lived in Clifton, Bristol, for the past 20 years. It's a great area to enjoy coffees on sunny mornings, pub gardens & loads of great places to eat. It is right in the heart of the village & everything is walking distance. 

We won't be using our beautiful Clifton house for the forseeable future, so we want to share it with those visiting Bristol - the best city!! Please message us with any questions about your trip, we can't wait to host you.

name: Bed and breakfast in Bishopston · ★4.97 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: Residential area, very safe. Quiet but a few minutes away from the Gloucester Road.
host_about: I am a Paediatric nurse working in Bristol, having lived here for 40 years. I have  3 grown up children and two grandchildren and  love spending time with family and friends. Living near to the Gloucester road and its eclectic mix of shops  and having a coffee at the docks are my favourite pastimes, whereas sharing my home with others, meeting new people and  helping visitors to enjoy Bristol is my passion.
property_type: Private room in bed and breakfast

name: Condo in Speedwell · ★4.64 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
Home in Bristol City · ★4.79 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: A friendly and vibrant leafy green area to the East of the city centre. A host of local cafes and restaurants as well as the whole of Bristol and all the city has to offer on your door step. Easy access to the motorway or Bristol Temple Meads for visiting other places in the local area or onward travel.
host_about: Hello! We are 2 married junior doctors who love exploring and the great outdoors. We live in a small terrace house in Bristol and enjoy meeting new people. We look forward to welcoming you into our home.

name: Condo in Hotwells · ★4.84 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Hotwells is a district of the English port city of Bristol. It is located to the south of and below the high ground of Clifton, and directly to the north of the Floating Harbour. The southern entrance to the Avon Gorge, which connects the docks to the sea, lies at the western end of Hotwells.

The multicoloured terraces of Hotwells, as lurid as M&M’s, cling to the hillside like a hipster favela. They have become a symbol of the city, reproduced on promotional material and social media posts celebrating nu-look Bristol.

It is a Ten-minute ferry ride into the city; 15-minute walk to fabulous countryside; colourful dockside pubs like the Nova Scotia; Brunel’s Bridge and a ship on the doorstep.

name: Home in Redland · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 private bath
host_about: Steve and Kaz love to travel and their home is full of interesting artefacts from around the world. Steve has lived in Bristol for over 20 years and will gladly recommend great places to eat and visit during your stay.

name: Home in Saint Werburgh's · ★4.85 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 3 baths
host_about:
Bespoke Cultural Escapes (BCE)

We are a professional serviced accommodation superhost with properties in Bristol and Bath. 

We specialise in providing great accommodation for leisure stays, business and contractor stays as well as relocation stays.

Looking for a place to stay in Bristol, Bath or North Somerset? Book with us! 

Our team will be more than happy to help you :)

Check out our Insta - @airbnb_bce

name: Condo in Hotwells · ★4.69 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Clifton is a beautiful area to explore with many restaurants, shops, coffee shops and bars. We are 20 minutes from Brunel's famous suspension bridge.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Charlotte

I'm a British woman who has recently moved back to the Uk after many years living in Amsterdam. home for the last 7 years. For me, travel is the best way to add the missing jigsaw puzzle pieces to my understanding of our fascinating world. I'm a big fan of using Airbnb as both a guest and a host as I believe it allows for a far more authentic travel experience.

name: Home in Easton · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
host_about:
Like to keep busy, work on house, allotment.
Practical outlook, attend gym and kickboxing when possible.
Prefer to cook in than eat out.
Love for all things natural and creative. 
Work to live, not live to work :)
Cash is king and freedom to all!

neighborhood_overview:
St. Werburghs is a vibrant and diverse neighborhood located in the city of Bristol England. It is situated in the northern part of the city and is known for its unique character and strong sense of community.

One of the defining features of St. Werburghs is its rich industrial history. In the past the area was home to a variety of manufacturing industries including flour mills tobacco factories and distilleries. While many of these industries have since closed down their legacy can still be seen in the form of converted industrial buildings that now house a range of creative and artistic endeavors.

St. Werburghs is also renowned for its strong focus on sustainability and environmentalism. The community actively promotes eco-friendly initiatives and is home to many eco-conscious initiatives including community gardens local food co-operatives and renewable energy projects. The neighborhood hosts regular events and workshops centered around sustainability which cont

name: Townhouse in Brislington · ★4.93 · 5 bedrooms · 7 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Brislington is a vibrant and historic district located in the south eastern suburbs of Bristol, England. The area is known for its unique blend of modern amenities and historical charm, and there are plenty of interesting things to discover and explore.

One of the most iconic landmarks in Brislington is the Arnos Vale Cemetery, a sprawling Victorian-era cemetery that is home to many notable figures from Bristol's history. The cemetery is a popular destination for walkers and nature lovers, and it is also a hub for cultural events and community activities.

For those interested in history, the Brislington Conservation Area is home to a wealth of architectural treasures, including the Grade II-listed St. Luke's Church. The area is also home to several other historic buildings, including the purportedly haunted Arno's Manor Hotel.

Brislington is also home to The Paintworks, a former industrial site that has been transformed into a creative hub, is particul

Coalshed is about a 10-15minute walk away from the City Centre, Harbourside, Southville life has everything you could wish for..

neighborhood_overview:
St Anne's is a lovely, quiet village-like neighbourhood not far from Bristol City Centre. There are plenty of green spaces around, including St Anne's Park, St Anne's Woods, Nightingale Valley and the footpath running either side of the River Avon.

There is a great local pub, the Langton, and a decent sized Coop supermarket 10 minutes walk down the hill or an even larger Sainsbury's supermarket 5 min drive.

St Annes has an Anglican church with regular Sunday services.

"St Annes House" is a nearby community arts space and frequently hosts art exhibitions and events, run by the arts organisation Bricks.

name: Serviced apartment in Clifton · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Elegant, leafy and filled with chic boutiques, cosy cafes, beautiful buildings and iconic attractions such as the Clifton Suspension Bridge, Clifton is one of Bristol’s most exclusive suburbs and picturesque quarters.

Clifton Village boasts an array of luxury boutiques and is well known for its many coffee shops and pubs. Clifton Down Shopping Centre also offers a good variety of shops, as does Whiteladies Road.

Clifton College, Clifton High, Bristol Grammar and QEH, as well as Christchurch and St John’s are all based close by.

Clifton has a lovely mix of Edwardian, Victorian and Georgian houses as well as popular town house flat conversions throughout.

Main roads – Princess Victoria Street (Clifton Village), Whiteladies Road, Pembroke Road and Queens Road.

Main attractions – Bristol Zoo, Clifton Suspension Bridge, the Observatory and the Downs.

Restaurants – You are spoilt for choice when it comes to fabulous restaurant

name: Condo in Clifton · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
host_about:
Hey!

I'm Bahram, originally from Afghanistan. My family decided to immigrate to the UK when I was 7 years old, and for the next 18 years London was the place I called home. Mid-2017 I decided to move to sunny Barcelona and here I am now.

I work in digital marketing in an amazing tech startup with some incredible people. 

I love meeting new people, sharing stories, experiences and maybe a recipe or two - but don't expect recipes from me just yet, i'm still finding my feet living away from mum's amazing cooking.

I work Monday to Friday, and like to explore Barcelona or relax on the beach during the weekends (weather permitting). My hobbies include photography, biking, climbing (bouldering really, but climbing sounds cooler), martial arts and reading.

name: Cottage in Bristol City · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
A quiet, safe, suburb in South Bristol.
A local licensed convenient store is just a 5 minute walk away.
Bristol Airport is a 15 minute drive away.
Clifton Village and Suspension Bridge 10 minutes in the car.
5 minute drive to Ashton Gate Stadium and 15 minute drive to Cabot Circus shopping centre.
The buzzing North Street area of Southville is bursting with cafés, pubs, restaurants, live comedy/theatre, and stunning street art is 10 minutes by car.
And for those who love the countryside, Dundry, Ashton Court, Chew Valley Lake, and the Mendips are just a short drive away. What’s more, day trips to Bath, Glastonbury (and the outlets at Street) are totally doable.

name: Rental unit in Redland · ★4.60 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Redland (actually Tudor house is on the border of Redland with Cotham) together with Clifton are probably the nicest parts of Bristol to live in. With its tree lined streets, parks and large Victorian and Georgian houses it has a wonderful character. However it still is close to all the amenities you may need and sights you will want to see whilst visiting. Just around the corner from the flat on Whiteladies Road are number of friendly restaurants, such as the ,The Townhouse ,the Cowshed  or great Thai restaurant, with genuine Thai food. There are many more restaurants and pubs just around the corner on Cotham Hill, with covered outdoor seating, but the immediate environment of the flat is quiet and homely. My particular favourites are the Highbury Vaults pub on St Michael's Hill, just up the Cotham Hill and to the right, The Lido restaurant close by in Clifton off Oakfield Road.  Clifton Down Shopping Centre is withing 5 minutes walking distance with a Sainsbury's supermarket, Pharmac
host_about: I love Art, travel, good food,people and my work as a designer architect... For my leisure I keep fit swimming and gymming, I love sailing, skiing when I can find the time and try to enjoy life as much as possible in hopefully healthy way. When travelling I prefer to do it not as a tourist but try to imagine what it is like to live in the place... I have lived in Prague, London, Hong Kong, Dubai and for the past 12 years in Shanghai... and travelled extensively in Europe, US, Middle East, Asia and SE Asia. I have stayed in apartments through Airbnb  and have had a great experience of the city this way. My permanent home is Bristol, the city I always love to return to from my travels.

name: Rental unit in Bristol City · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The studio is in the lively Bristol City Centre! You have great access to Bristol Temple Meads station, local bus stops on Baldwin Street and tons of pubs and restaurants!

Baldwin Street is a pedestrian street, so you can not drive down here as you may get a ticket!

If you are driving, the best places to park are in the surrounding areas; The Galleries, Prince Street NCP, Queens Square.

Some amazing places we would recommend to eat and visit are:
- Owee Vegan - Approx 2 minute walk
- St Nicks Market- Approx 3 minute walk
- Mugshot- Approx 3 minute walk
- Franco Manca- Approx 2 minute walk
- Cabot Circus- Approx 10 minute walk
- Stokes Croft- Approx 15 minute walk
- Revolution Bristol- Approx 2 minute walk
host_about:
Hello we are Hopewell and welcome to our profile. We are dedicated to making sure you enjoy your stay in one of our many homes, be that in the city centre, Clifton or beyond.
We are here to help you enjoy your time with us and get the best out of what Bristol has to offer. 
Our team really has great knowledge of the area so please feel free to ask us any questions.  We are all really passionate about our great city, and are excited about others coming to explore all it has to offer.
Everyone has a role to play in the team, so there is always someone to look after you.

name: Home in Bristol City · ★4.75 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
Home in Easton · 3 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Easton is renowned for its distinctive character and community spirit, and boasts a host of local amenities, attractions and community events that draw many visitors from outside the area.

Situated just off St Marks Road are Bristol Sweet Mart, Thali Café, East Bristol Bakery, and The Garden of Easton. Also close by are No 12 Café, The Greenbank pub, Este Kitchen, Matter Wholefoods, and Public Market.

The area offers a beautiful wealth of green spaces including the Greenbank Cemetery, the parks at Eastville and St George, and riverside walks along the nearby Frome Valley, and just minutes from the house is the locally cherished Bristol to Bath Cycle Path, ideal for commuting quickly into the city centre or just for weekend strolls, long runs or bike rides.

Easton truly is the throbbing heartbeat of multicultural Bristol!
host_about: Building brands that I believe in!

name: Home in Bristol City · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
Home in Henbury · ★4.75 · 4 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Located within 10 minutes of The Wild Place Project, and with in 15 minutes of The Downs, the historic Clifton Suspension Bridge, the SS Great Britain plus hundreds of bars and restaurants.

The Mall at Cribbs Causeway is a large indoor shopping centre, along with a leisure complex with multi-screen Vue cinema, ten-pin bowling and a large number of restaurants for you to enjoy & is a 10 minute drive away from the house.

There are live play theatres in Bristol , like the Bristol Hippodrome and the Bristol Old Vic where you can enjoy a show of your choice after a fabulous local pre-show dinner.

Bus stops are no more than a 5 minute walk away with routes that can take you to Broadmead where you can find plenty of shops and entertainment.

name: Townhouse in Montpelier · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
We live in a vibrant and fun area of Bristol called Montpelier. Montpelier is a littered with beautiful Georgian houses, terraced streets and overspilling gardens, it is often described as 'bohemian' with a city village feel, and lovely to stroll around.
Easily accessible by train, Montpelier train station links directly to Temple Meads, the bus station, a 15 minute walk, or car, 4 mins from the M32.
Famous for its street art, Montpelier is full of creative surprises.
We have a number of food shops, a well stocked corner shop, Ashley stores, an organic supermarket, Better Food Company, and in the heart of Montpelier the amazing Italian Deli, Licata, all a few minutes walk from the front door.
In the evening you can cruise down York Road for some fine dining at the amazing Bianchi's (worth booking ahead), or if you prefer a more relaxed meal pop into our local Indian restaurant the Thali. In the morning you can either pop to the Bristolian, fall into Stokes Cr

name: Townhouse in Saint Werburgh's · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
St werburghs is a laid back vibrant area with local shops, health-food supermarket, butcher, bakers, nice takeaways, cafes and restaurants. Also there are loads of parks and green spaces right on our doorstep. Plus bike paths and easy access into the centre.

Shopping…
We recommend Better food around the corner on York st for your local bits and bobs, or Sonny’s opposite the park. Theres also a butchers on minor road and the fruit and veg shop is great and does great sourdough bread, vegan pastries and cheap juices. There’s also a M&S and Tesco in eastville, 10 minute walk or 2 minute drive away. And Lidl and Audi are also walking distance.

Walks…
Local walks from the door step (which are all good for dogs) would be up the lane behind the church to the narroways/ mound. You can also go through the tunnel towards the farm and carry on through Boiling Wells and continue on to Purdown if you want a bit more of a treck. There’s loads of paths and loops so
host_about: Laid back, respectful guy, love the outdoors, love to swim and love to travel.

name: Home in Redfield · ★4.67 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath

neighborhood_overview: Clifton & Cotham is a popular and picturesque suburb of Bristol known for its Georgian architecture, cafe culture, and green spaces. Bristol's independent and thriving, Gloucester Road, is reputedly the longest independent shopping street in Europe. The famous  Whiteladies Road is only a few minutes walk away and offers much more including major supermarkets and retail outlets. The beautiful wide open parklands of Clifton Downs is a 15 minute walk away.

name: Home in Bristol City · ★4.83 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Stokes Croft, the beating heart of Bristol's cultural and artistic scene! This vibrant neighborhood is bursting with creativity and energy, offering visitors a unique and eclectic experience that's unlike anything else in the city.

From colorful street art and live music performances to independent shops and trendy cafes, Stokes Croft has it all. Whether you're looking for a night out on the town or a quiet afternoon exploring local boutiques, you'll find plenty of options to suit your style and taste.

The community here is diverse and welcoming, with a strong sense of pride and camaraderie that's infectious. There's always something new to discover in Stokes Croft, whether it's a hidden gem of a restaurant or a pop-up art exhibit.

So come and experience the vibrant energy of Stokes Croft for yourself - you won't be disappointed!
host_about:
We moved back to Bristol in 2013, and have really enjoyed living and working in Stokes Croft. Bristol's such a friendly, easy going city with a great creative vibe. 

We have fully renovated this property from a deserted derelict to our own flat, the rental flat we let on Airbnb, and our own art and gift shop. 

We now have a wonderful son and are able to enjoy the family aspects of the area now as well as its wonderful social side.

name: Condo in Westbury on Trym · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Condo in Bristol City · ★4.91 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Within a 300m radius there are three great independent pubs. Down the hill in Stokes Croft, you have a wide selection of restaurants and cafes, including excellent Korean, Sri Lankan, Jamaican, Cuban and even British (nearby Pie Minister is in my opinion as good as it gets!). Plenty of vegan options too.

If you like street art, this is your Mecca. The earliest works of Banksy are all nearby and there's one really small one nobody knows about just round the corner. If you don't like street art, no problem, just walk in the opposite direction and head for Redland and Clifton, where you'll find prisitine sandstone walls, boutique shops, more excellent food and drink options, an incredibly comfortable and luxurious cinema experience at the Everyman, and the splendour of Clifton Downs.

It's all easily walkable from here, as is Cabot Circus, the main shopping district.

name: Home in Bristol City · ★4.75 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The area really does deliver convenience with quick links to both Bristol & Bath without the rush hour traffic.

As far as local amenities are concerned there are the normal pizza, Indian, chippy all just up the road, or you may choose to order a just eat. You can also find a small Tesco supermarket a 6 minute drive away.

In Keynsham (10 minute drive) there are great Indians and a lovely pizza restaurant as well as a Grounded and Bonzo Lounge.

Within driving a 10 minute driving range we have:
* 24 hour Tesco
* 24 hour Asda
* Lidl
* Aldi
* Waitrose
* Sainsburys

Only being a 20 minute drive to Bristol & a 30 minute drive to Bath, you may want to consider these options:
* 1 minute walk to the number 2 bus terminal which goes straight down the bus lanes to Bristol city centre every half hour or so.
* 10 minute drive to Keynsham train station where you can get to Bristol or Bath in less than 10 minutes.

neighborhood_overview:
The location of our space is a massive bonus. We live in a friendly, bohemian, family community with lots of lovely cafes and restaurants with outdoor seating, pubs, parks, a climbing centre and an organic supermarket.

The site sits in the heart of the unusual Ashley Vale, next to a city farm and surrounded by allotments on one side and a nature reserve on the other. You'd be forgiven for forgetting that you're in the middle of a city with easy access to both the centre and the M32, to get out to surrounding areas.

host_about:
We are Ross and Olivia - husband and wife team. We do all of our travelling together and love meeting new people in new places.

name: Home in Totterdown · ★4.88 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Totterdown is an iconic Bristol neighbourhood of colourful little houses, steep streets and great views. It's full of lively pubs and eateries, and Victoria Park is one of the city's best green spaces. Intrepid visitors can also explore leafy Arnos Vale cemetery, or the crazy steep banks of Perrett's Park (a favorite for winter sledging!).

For a longer walk, follow the river path from behind Temple Meads station on a loop round the harbour, taking in Queen's Square, the SS Great Britain and the spectacular St Mary Redcliffe church along the way.

name: Treehouse in Saint Paul's · ★4.89 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Stokes Croft is a buzzing, vibrant and eclectic area of Bristol with cafes, bars and nightclubs all within a stone's throw of your Eco Pod as well as heaps of insta-worthy street art for you to discover. Cabots Circus and Broadmead shopping areas are just a five minute walk.

Britain's longest street of independent shops begins at the top of Cheltenham Road, where it meets the legendary Gloucester Road. Here, you will find even more great eateries as well as a myriad of shops with homewares, houseplants, books, gifts and clothes.

The Waterfront with all its bars and eateries is a twenty minute stroll across town - you can swing past St Nicholas Market and Corn Street to take in the history (and the great vibes) on your way.

Backfields, the road outside your Eco Sleep Pod, is for access, it's not a through road, so there's usually no significant traffic.

name: Condo in Clifton · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: One of the most beautiful and sought-after areas in Bristol, Clifton is an affluent neighbourhood on the banks of the River Avon known for its picturesque streets, convenience to the city centre, amenities the neighbourhood has to offer, great schools, and low crime rate. The streets of Clifton are lined with Georgian and Victorian townhouses and villas, and many of the buildings have been converted into flats. Clifton is home to the Clifton Observatory and the famous Clifton Suspension Bridge, as well as many of the most famous restaurants and shops in the city. The University of Bristol is on the eastern side of the area, with most of the campus being categorised as Clifton, although given the price of housing, it’s not the most popular area for students to live.

neighborhood_overview:
Airpoint is well known within the Bristol area for its unique rooftop 2 lane 200m running track, sky garden and roof top BBQ area. There is also outdoor gym equipment on the roof.

It is recommend to visit the roof top during your stay to enjoy the amazing views of Bristol including of Brunel’s famous Clifton Suspension Bridge which is lit up nightly. There are table benches so you can also enjoy the views with a drink or some alfresco dining.

You can walk in an approximate straight line to North Street Southville within 2/3 minutes where you will find a vibrant, busy day and night restaurant, pub/cafe bar economy with somewhere to suit everyone’s tastes. There is a theatre on North Street at the Tobacco Factory and a popular cafe bar and Sunday market at the same location within a 15 minute walk from the flat. name: Home in Bristol City · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
host_about:
I have been living in Bristol, for over twenty years now. Tried to leave a few times for the countryside - but always get drawn back by my friends. Now i've found my beautiful urban/rural village I'm settled. 

 I'm 43. I run an international charity three days a week and the rest of the time I write songs, do yoga and bring up my 8 year old daughter.  So I'm a funny mixture of super organized and professional and kind of laid back. 

As a host I aim to make you feel as comfortable as possible. The house is well loved and well lived in which makes it cosy - but as a new build it has a modern spacious design feel to it as well. I've traveled a lot myself and I have had a stream of international guests renting out another flat of mine so I am used to the kind of information and support that guests might need. 

Airbnb suggests sharing my life motto. I reckon its got to be,

 "Relax, Nothing is under control!"

name: Condo in Clifton · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Clifton village is famous for its iconic Suspension Bridge, which stands out dramatically against the striking Avon Gorge. Straight over the bridge is Ashton Court Estate, a beautiful park spanning over 850 acres. There are numerous walking and cycling trails, as well as a Rose Garden, Deer Park and Mansion.

Some of our favourite spots in Clifton village include The White Lion rooftop bar, as well as The Fringe Jazz Bar, The Albion Pub, Bosco Pizzeria, Chandos Deli and East Village Cafe. You're also in a great spot to explore further afield: including the foodie-haven Cotham, Whiteladies Road, Park Street and The Harbourside. Gloucester Road, Stokes Croft and Bedminster are also all within a 30-minute walk or 10-minute taxi - boasting micro-breweries and theatres as well as brilliant eateries and delis. Brunel's famous suspension bridge is just a short walk away and is a must-see for history lovers.
host_about:
Originally from Clifton in Bristol but have lived and travelled in many destinations around the world. Been using Airbnb since 2012 and stayed in destinations from Abergavenny to Australia as often prefer being able to stay in a home as opposed to a hotel.
I'll be on hand to advise on things to do, restaurants etc if required.

name: Townhouse in Saint Werburgh's · ★4.84 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
St Werburghs is a hub of artisan cafes, such as Napolita for coffee and pizza and the award-winning Better Food Company organic supermarket. Local pubs The Miners and Duke of York are both relaxed and welcoming.
Regarding activities, the community-orientated City Farm, with pigs, goats and ducks is just up the road. There are two climbing centres in St Werburghs - Bloc (bouldering) and The Church (roped and bouldering). Being Banksy's hometown, there are several (legal) graffiti walls and ever-changing urban art.
St Werburghs is close to the independent shopping quarters of Stokes Croft and Gloucester Road, as well as the more central Cabot Circus and Broadmead. Ikea is a stone's throw away at Junction 2. Plenty of options if you need a bit of retail therapy!

host_about: So far I've really enjoyed the experience of hosting the varied and interesting selection of people who have visited my home. I'm calm and friendly, respectful, easy to get along with person. When I travel, I like to stay in places that offer me privacy and space but helpful and friendly if I need anything. I like a clean, clear space, that I can call my own, so I aim to offer the same to my guests, I'm also open to a friendly chat and cuppa if you need that. I'm told people feel relaxed and at ease in my company. I am well traveled including time spent in West Africa and Europe. I've lived in Central and South America and the Caribbean. I love the arts and culture, I'm a practicing writer, photographer and therapist. I love music and dancing and for many years I worked alongside world music artists, working and traveling with artists from all over the world; I think this has given me a broad understanding, appreciation and acceptance of different people and different customs. I relate well to others and am told by people who have limited grasp of the english language that my spoken english and diction is clear and easy to understand. I speak a little spanglish! I like walking, nature and yoga.

neighborhood_overview:
Totterdown is a diverse and vibrant area of Bristol, with some fab independent restaurants, great pubs, a local bakery, deli and an award winning fish and chip shop too.

There is also lots of green space if you fancied a stroll around the local parks, with Perretts Park, Victoria Park and Arnos Vale all on the doorstep.

If you wanted to explore a little further afield, Totterdown is a great location for getting to Bath, Wells and The Mendips, and they can be easily reached within approx. 1 hour drive.

Totterdown is quite hilly in places, so, be prepared for some inclines!

I live in Totterdown with my partner Tom, my step son, and our dog Louis. We love our quirky three story home and have gradually been putting our own stamp on it since we moved in a few years ago.  I am a trained Reflexologist and love anything related to health, wellbeing and happiness :) .

name: Home in Southville · ★4.98 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Vibrant Southville is a laid-back residential area and cultural hub on the River Avon’s south bank. At its heart is the dynamic Tobacco Factory Theatres, staging contemporary plays in converted industrial buildings and hosting a weekly Sunday food and crafts market. On lively North Street, the Upfest Gallery organises a popular summer street-art festival. Street art, hip eateries, delis, and craft-beer bars dot the street, and bay-windowed Victorian terraces line nearby roads.
Ashton Gate stadium, home to Bristol City Football team, lies at the end of North Street. A walk through Greville Smyth Park at the end of North Street will take you to the bottom of the Gorge over which stands Brunel's Clifton Suspension Bridge.
In walking distance from North Street is Ashton Court, a mansion with 850 acres of woodland and grassland. Ashton Court boasts stunning views over Bristol, fantastic mountain bike tracks and a public golf course. In the summer it hosts the internationally famo

neighborhood_overview:
Montpelier is an area just north of Bristol’s city centre that is well known for its bohemian vibe. In fact, in February 2018, it was named the hippest area in the UK by TravelSupermarket.

It is a wonderful area to visit or to live in Bristol, and it has its own distinct feel with its beautiful terraced houses, many of which are painted in pastel colours. As such, Montpelier is a decidedly cool residential area that is a popular choice when it comes to choosing a location to live in Bristol.

The theatre, cinema, concert hall, St Nicholas Market, Castle Park and the floating harbour can all be reached in less than a minute's walk. host_about:
At higgihaus we're on a mission to deliver the sort of accommodation we love to stay in when we're travelling - comfortable, convivial, achingly stylish and that somehow manages to capture that elusive 'it feels good, but I'm not sure why' feeling. 

Founded by Luke Spikes in 2017, higgihaus will be bringing its unique brand of 'place to stay' to urban locations across the United Kingdom. For now, we're focused on Bristol and Cardiff and would love for you to stay with us when you, your family, and friends visit these awesome cities.

name: Home in Bristol City · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Our road overlooks the Frome Valley, which is North Bristol’s ‘green lung”. Beyond our garden about six acres of council allotments separate us from the River Frome, and a small lane about 200 metres from our front door leads down to the Frome valley walkway. This gives us access to several miles of paths that link Eastville Park (with its children’s playground), Snuff Mills river and woods, Oldbury Court Estate, Stoke Park Estate and Purdown. We regularly do a 2 hours circular walk from the house to Purdown and back that involves only a few hundred yards on roads, the rest being footpaths along the river through woods and fields and over hills.

There is plenty of wildlife to be seen in season. There are resident buzzards and sparrowhawks in the valley along with jays, jackdaws, crows, magpies and the inevitable seagulls. In summer we await the arrival of swifts and occasionally see a peregrine falcon flying over from the Avon Gorge on the other side of Bristol. Down b
host_about: Hi there,  I am British and live in Bristol UK with my wife Matilde, who is Swiss-Italian but has lived here in UK since 1976, she speaks Italian and French as well as English.  We have two grown up children and three grand-daughters of 8, 6 and 5 who we are mad about.  We love to travel and here in Europe that usually means our 6 metre Adria camper van.   When the kids left home we had an adult gap year and travelled through Europe to Turkey then back to Morocco, Senegal and Gambia, crossing the Sahara desert twice in our old Mercedes camper.  Then a few of years ago we took the whole family to Southern India for a month which was amazing (I spent a year there in the 80's and hadn't been back since).  So anywhere new pushes all our buttons and we love to explore, meet new people, eat, drink, walk, cycle and generally enjoy what the world has to offer.  We also love music and play piano and accordion (Matilde) and guitar and banjo (me).  So there you are, we look forward to meeting you and enjoying your home and city, wherever it may be.  Now we are hosts too and if you book our lovely home we hope you enjoy staying here and exploring Bristol and the West of England.

name: Home in Southville · 4 bedrooms · 7 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Our place is set in the heart of Southville, which is a lovely quite neighbourhood just over the river from central Bristol.
It's a short stroll from North Street, which is famous for its array of independent shops, including butcher, fishmonger, greengrocer, and many cafes, pubs and bars. It's also just a short walk to the Bristol's Harbourside. Once a busy dock where sailors and merchants would trade goods and set sail for voyages of discovery, Bristol's Harbourside is now a gorgeous area filled with cafes, bars and shops and waterside restaurants. You can sit and let the world pass you by while watching the boats head in or swans swim past, while dangling your feet over the edge with a cold glass of cider in your hand. There are also sports and activities including yachting, paddle boarding, cycling and rowing on offer. Stroll around the water’s edge and you will find Millennium Square, with its fountains and big screen, as well as Brunel’s SS Great Britain, We The Curious, Br
host_about: Thirty something mother of two. Love the outdoors, good food and a good book.

Scenery wise, visit Troopers Hill Park just a ten minute walk away. At the bottom of the hill you will find yourself at the River Avon which despite being in the city, has a green country feel. name: Home in Bedminster · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Bedminster, our neighbourhood, is one of the most vibrant and exciting areas in Bristol, we feel so lucky to live here. The area benefits from having lots of independent shops, cafes, restaurants and pubs- we are spoiled for choice when going out for a coffee or a drink! Bristol is famous for its food scene and many of those award-winning restaurants are within a 15-minute walk of No. 49.

Another huge bonus is how easy it is to walk to Wapping Wharf, the harbour side and Bristol City centre- we tend to walk everywhere and never feel the need to get the bus.

We are also blessed with being surrounded by lots of great parks and with easy access to the countryside beyond.

Bedminster is a fantastic base to visit all the festivals the city and the south west has to offer, most notably the International Balloon Fiesta in August, they come right over our house!
host_about: Architect from Bristol

name: Home in Redland · ★4.88 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: The house is set in a quiet tree-lined road in Redland. The garden backs on to Redland Green (with an excellent playground for kids). Whiteladies Road, with a host of cafes, pubs, restaurants and shops is 10 to 12 mins walk away, as is the wide-open spaces of The Downs. Catch a bus on Whiteladies Road to the city centre (and docks) or to Clifton Village, or walk to either in 30 to 40 mins. There is an excellent pub at the top of the road, as well as an authentic pizzierra that does great takeaways. The university is 20 mins walk away. For the more adventurous, there is an electric scooter park at the top of the road. Redland station (diect line to Temple Meads) is 10 to 15 minuits walk away.

name: Home in Bristol City · ★5.0 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The home is located just 10 minutes from the heart of Bristol and Clifton giving you a great central location perfect for families, couples, remote workers and contractors.

Explore the city's rich maritime history at the M Shed museum or head into Clifton and walk across the Clifton Suspension Bridge, which offers stunning views of the Avon Gorge and the city.

Take a stroll down the iconic Clifton Village, with its colourful Georgian buildings and independent shops, cafes, and restaurants then make your way to the Observatory and Caves, which houses a camera obscura that offers panoramic views of the city.

Bristol is home to a thriving art scene, with the Arnolfini Gallery and Bristol Museum and Art Gallery both showcasing a range of contemporary and historic works.

For those looking to enjoy the outdoors, the Bristol Zoo Gardens and Ashton Court Estate offer plenty of green spaces and wildlife to discover.

Meander thro

Within a minute you can be at Avon View Cemetery for a walk in the grounds, or the popular St George's park with lots of activities such as a skate park, tennis courts, children's play area, and a coffee kiosk.

Our favourite things to do on Church road (which joins our road) are:

The Old Stillage and Dark Horse Pubs for a drink

Poco Dehli, Grounded and Bristol Loaf for coffee and snacks

The Red Church, Siam Smile and The Lock Up for eating out


Aldi, Tesco and Preserve zero waste shop are nearby for food shopping.

The Treatment rooms - Massage and Beauty

Various hair and nail Salons and Barbers

neighborhood_overview:
Lawrence Weston is a neighbourhood in the northwest part of Bristol, UK.
It is situated approximately 5 miles away from the city centre.
Lawrence Weston is known for its residential character and green spaces.
Primarily a quiet residential area, it is ideal for those working in Avonmouth.

Lawrence Weston has a few local shops, convenience stores, and amenities to cater to the everyday needs of its residents. However, residents often travel to the city centre or nearby areas for more extensive shopping or entertainment options.

The distinct look of Lawrence Weston stems from its post-war construction using Laing easy-form materials. This area is gaining popularity due to its proximity to motorways, local industries, and excellent transport links. Residents benefit from various amenities, including shops, schools, and community centres that provide essential services and social activities.

Transportation is convenient, with regular bus

neighborhood_overview:
St Werburghs is a charming suburb in central Bristol yet with a village feel. It has numerous independent shops, restaurants, parks and excellent pubs. The Duke of York is along the road from the house and is renowned as one of the best pubs in Bristol and The Farm does great Sunday roasts.

The house is next to Ashley Park and 2 minutes from Mina Park, you can also enjoy walks around local nature reserves and large green spaces.

There are 2 train stations less than a 15 minute walk away and offers easy access to the M32.

It is an excellent base for exploring Bristol being only a 15 minute walk to central Bristol, Stokes Croft and the Gloucester Road. You are also able to explore other parts of the city using the regular train service with Clifton 2 stops away in one direction and Temple Meads in the other.

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is a short walk from the Bristol Bus station and Temple Meads train station. Situated within easy reach of Cabot Circus and Stokes Croft. Cabot Circus is a modern shopping centre with a large selection of designer shops, chain restaurants and a Cinema, its next to Broadmead shopping district with over 100 independents. A short walk through town Bristol’s Old City, including St Nicholas market, and the Bristol famous Old Duke where you can enjoy a drink and live Jazz music. You’re in easy access to Bristol harbour area, visit the SS Great Britain, check out the M shed Museum, or jump on a boat tour of the harbour which I highly recommend, or drink in the night live with a selection of Nightclubs, pubs and restaurants including millennium square and the Aquarium.
The train station is a 15 minute walk just remember to use the rear train station entrance.
In the other direction waling past Lakota Night club and the ever-changing graffiti you will find Stokes Croft

name: Rental unit in Brislington · ★4.36 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Brislington is a couple of miles to the South East of the city centre. The property is located on the main Bath Road giving you easy access out of the city to explore places further afield such as Bath, Taunton and Shepton Mallet. You can reach Bristol's main train station Temple Meads in 30 minutes by foot or a 5 minute car journey.

Bristol, the largest city in the South West of England is a cultural hub with the Harbourside, where the M Shed museum explores local social and industrial heritage. The harbour's 19th-century warehouses now contain restaurants, shops and cultural institutions such as contemporary art gallery The Arnolfini.

There are a huge selection of bars, restaurants and cafes to suit any taste along with a wide range of shopping centres including the Galleries, Cabot Circus and The Mall.

I love coffee, beaches, great food and making happy lifelong memories with my family and for my children, we treasure each and every precious moment together.

name: Condo in Cotham · ★4.92 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The flat is located very close to the centre of Bristol. Stokes Croft and Gloucester Rd are popular shopping, dining, and socializing areas. There is a history of street art in the area.
The location of my flat is in a quiet area called Kingsdown, but technically, the postal district is called Cotham. The housing in the area is late Georgian/ early Victorian townhouses, which are terraced housing, usually four floors.
The flat is close to Bristol City Centre. It is within walking distance of Bristol University, the Bristol Royal Infirmary, and a bus ride to Southmead Hospital. The Hippodrome, The Old Vic and Saint George's, which are all popular entertainment venues, are all within walking distance from the flat.
host_about:
I am Norman,  and I  am your host. 
 I have lived in Bristol for 24 years.   I am easy going, I enjoy life, and I enjoy living in Bristol. I have a 13-year-old son and a beautiful family. The paintings on my walls are painted by my dad and the rugs are my mum`s gift to me. I love art, but my creativity has come through more in my music. Hope you enjoy my garden,  5 different varieties  of roses and when in season, the blooming is spectacular.

I live with my husband, Jonathan, our daughter & our black Labrador in the house above the flat. Jonathan and I both work as barristers and are members of Chambers in Bristol.  
Before we moved to Bristol we lived in an old farmhouse in the depths of West Somerset & before that we were in London.  Bucking the trend, we returned to city life just after the Covid pandemic, in time for our daughter to start secondary school!

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.87 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
St Pauls has easy access to the M32 and all major transport links

Home to one of the biggest and best street parties in Europe, a strong sense of community and a thriving shopping street, this is one of Bristol's most vibrant, creative and colourful areas of Bristol.

St Pauls has a wealth of independent shops that sell food, drink, fashion and music from around the world.

name: Rental unit in Henleaze · ★4.80 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Henleaze Village is a upmarket suburb adjacent to Clifton in Bristol with a great coffee culture and an array of delightful local shops. It has a quality butchers, green grocer, bakery, fish mongers, a couple of deli's and even a speciality cheese shop, all a couple of minutes walk way! There are also some lovely gift shops, a mini spa and a yoga & fitness studio and Waitrose is just a 10 minute walk away! Right by Waitrose there is a fantastic pub called the Westbury and 2 really good restaurants which we love, Little French & Prego.

It's a stones throw from Clifton Downs and a 15 minute walk to Whiteladies road where there are some more great pubs and restaurants. There are bus links at the end of the road - taking you in to town or up to Cribbs Causeway if you fancy hitting shops.

It's a great spot to be!

name: Home in Bedminster · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
7 minute walk to lively North street full of independent bars, restaurants and shops - our highlights include Kask (natural wine bar), Yafo (Middle Eastern falafels) and the North street cheese company.
25 minute walk to the harbourside - museums, restaurants, art galleries
A short drive out to the beautiful Ashton Court and Leigh Woods - perfect for picnics and walks

name: Rental unit in Hotwells · ★4.89 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is just a short walk from the famous SS Great Britain and the M shed museum, making it ideally placed for exploring Bristols Maritime history.

There are also an array of bars and restaurants along the harbour serving everything from craft ales and pizzas to cocktails and fresh sea food. There’s something for everyone!

Head 10 minutes south of the harbour and you will find yourselves in Soutvhilles famous North street area where again you will find an eclectic mix of restaurants and bars. As well as Bristols premier sports venue - Ashton Gate stadium. Home of Bristol City and The Bristol Bears as well as big summer concerts.

Just a short walk North into Clifton and you will be able to explore high end shops and restaurants located in beautiful Georgian buildings as well as the iconic Clifton suspension bridge.

name: Rental unit in Bristol City · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
Home in Redland · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Home in Bristol City · 4 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Bedminster, our neighbourhood, is one of the most vibrant and exciting areas in Bristol, we feel so lucky to live here. The area benefits from having lots of independent shops, cafes, restaurants and pubs- we are spoiled for choice when going out for a coffee or a drink! Bristol is famous for its food scene and many of those award-winning restaurants are within a 5-minute walk of the house.

Another huge bonus is how easy it is to walk to Wapping Wharf, the harbour side and Bristol City centre- we tend to walk everywhere and never feel the need to get the bus.

We are also blessed with being surrounded by lots of great parks and with easy access to the countryside beyond.

name: Home in Brislington · ★4.97 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview:
Nearby, there is a great local pub called the Langton, which does good food and sometimes has live music at night.

You could also take a nice stroll up to Beeses, which is a tranquil riverside pub featuring lush gardens and outdoor seating, overlooking the river.

In Sandy Park, 10 minutes walk away, there are convenience stores, coffee shops, hair dressers, post office, etc, and free cashpoints .

A 15 minute walk, in the opposite direction, towards the Feeder Road, you have the Avonmead Retail Park where you will find The Range, Wilko, Boots, M&S Foodhall, Iceland, Lidl, Poundland, MCDonalds, Costa, Hollywood Bowl and the Showcase cinema.

If you do want to go into Bristol City Centre, you can take a bus, No.1, from Sandy Park or the No.36 from the Wick Road.
host_about:

name: Home in Bristol City · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
Home in  Clifton · ★4.64 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The cottage is located on the edge of beautiful Clifton Village, with easy access on foot, by car, by bike or by scooter to all that Clifton and the surrounding areas have to offer.

It's situated in a quiet area, down a footpath which is a 2 minute walk from Granby Hill, while being close to a wide range of places to eat, drink and visit, making it ideal for a relaxing city break or a longer stay.

The cottage is a short walk up Granby Hill into the centre of Clifton Village, with its boutique shops, pretty parks, independent restaurants and the iconic Clifton Suspension Bridge

With its leafy roads and crescents, picturesque streets and Victorian and Georgian architecture, Clifton is a wonderful place to stay and the perfect location from which to explore Bristol. Please note that Clifton is on a hill, so some walking is hilly!

If you're driving you will require a visitor's parking permit for every day except Sunday, as Clifton operates a par

On the edge of Clifton Village, my cosy cottage has a triple aspect bedroom with views over the Avon Gorge, a kitchen/dining room, shower room & sunny garden.

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★4.54 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The area surrounding the apartment in Bristol's City Centre is a bustling and vibrant part of the city. It has many attractions, including museums, historic buildings, shops, restaurants, and bars. The streets are lined with a mix of old and new buildings, with various architectural styles on display. The atmosphere is lively, especially during the day when the area is busy with shoppers, tourists, and office workers. In the evening, the area comes alive with various entertainment options, including cinemas, theatres, and music venues. The site is well-connected by public transportation, with bus stops and train stations nearby, making exploring the rest of the city and beyond easy. Overall, the City Centre area of Bristol is a vibrant and exciting place to stay, with plenty to see and do for visitors of all ages.

Home in Bedminster Down · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Our house is in the quiet leafy suburbs of South Bristol, and it's only a five minute walk to local nature reserves and public footpaths into the countryside. There's also a park, just around the corner with a playground and football pitches, plus regular transport links into central Bristol and to the Airport if needed.

The nearby green spaces offer panoramic views over Bristol towards Clifton Suspension Bridge, and Ashton Court Estate where the Bristol International Balloon Fiesta takes place during August. Ashton Gate stadium is also located nearby, offering sporting and musical events throughout the year.
host_about:

When we’re away, we can still be contacted and we have professional support on hand, in the unlikely event there are any issues.

We will remove all of our personal belongings before the start of any reservation, and where possible, we can alter the layout of rooms to suit your needs - just ask and we’ll see what we can do.

Home in Bristol City · 4 bedrooms · 7 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Lawrence Weston is a neighbourhood in the northwest part of Bristol, UK.
It is situated approximately 5 miles away from the city centre.
Lawrence Weston is known for its residential character and green spaces.
Primarily a quiet residential area, it is ideal for those working in Avonmouth.

Lawrence Weston has a few local shops, convenience stores, and amenities to cater to the everyday needs of its residents. However, residents often travel to the city centre or nearby areas for more extensive shopping or entertainment options.

The distinct look of Lawrence Weston stems from its post-war construction using Laing easy-form materials. This area is gaining popularity due to its proximity to motorways, local industries, and excellent transport links. Residents benefit from various amenities, including shops, schools, and community centres that provide essential services and social activities.

Transportation is convenient, with regular bus

name: Home in Bristol City · ★5.0 · 4 bedrooms · 6 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Lawrence Weston is a neighbourhood in the northwest part of Bristol, UK.
It is situated approximately 5 miles away from the city centre.
Lawrence Weston is known for its residential character and green spaces.
Primarily a quiet residential area, it is ideal for those working in Avonmouth.

Lawrence Weston has a few local shops, convenience stores, and amenities to cater to the everyday needs of its residents. However, residents often travel to the city centre or nearby areas for more extensive shopping or entertainment options.

The distinct look of Lawrence Weston stems from its post-war construction using Laing easy-form materials. This area is gaining popularity due to its proximity to motorways, local industries, and excellent transport links. Residents benefit from various amenities, including shops, schools, and community centres that provide essential services and social activities.

Transportation is convenient, with regular bus
