You could also take a nice stroll up to Beeses, which is a tranquil riverside pub featuring lush gardens and outdoor seating, overlooking the river.

In Sandy Park, 10 minutes walk away, there are convenience stores, coffee shops, hair dressers, post office, etc, and free cashpoints.

A 15 minute walk, in the opposite direction towards the Feeder Road, you will find the Avonmead Retail Park where you have The Range, Wilko, Boots, M&S Foodhall, Iceland, Lidl, Poundland, MCDonalds, Costa, Hollywood Bowl and the Showcase cinema.

If you wanted to go into town, there is a no.36 bus stop about 5 minutes walk away on Wick Road, or you could get the No.1 from Sandy Park, 10 minute walk.

name: Rental unit in Redland · ★4.65 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
This beautiful apartment is tucked away on a quiet street in Redland, one of Bristol’s best neighbourhoods. You’re in the prime spot to enjoy all that this vibrant city has to offer, and best yet it’s all reachable by foot! From Clifton's iconic suspension bridge to Brunel's SS Great Britain, Bristol is a city bustling with history. Not only has it been named the happiest city in the UK and a top food destination, it’s also been hailed as Britain’s first Green Capital.

Stroll alongside the harbour, hopping in and out of art galleries, coffee shops and the renowned M Shed Museum. Or enjoy a bite to eat in the unique Wapping Wharf - this cultural quarter boasts eateries and independent shops all housed in refurbished shipping containers. In summer, there’s nothing better than sitting on the water’s edge and soaking up the lively vibe of this vibrant city.

With so many different neighbourhoods to explore, you can spend days exploring Bristol’s city centre. Wander th

Home in Saint Werburgh's · ★4.86 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
St Werburghs is a centrally located and highly desirable neighbourhood in North East Bristol. With a laid back and liberal atmosphere, the area feels like a village within the vibrant and cultural city of Bristol. Right on the doorstep within St Werburghs there is a wonderful array of pubs, restaurants, cafes and vegan friendly grocery/corner shops. The renowned brewery Wiper & True have their flagship taproom, with an extensive range of craft beers. There is even a climbing centre in the church at the bottom of our road and the bouldering centre Bloc is only a 10 minute walk. Just around the corner is St Werburghs City Farm which makes for a enjoyable trip to see the animals and enjoy delicious local produce at the Farm cafe.

Beyond St Werbughs is the buzzing Gloucester Road, only a 20 minute walk away. Here you will find an abundance of restaurants, independent shops, cafes and cocktail bars.

We rarely drive in Bristol as our house is walking distance to most
host_about: As a couple we are very clean, respectable and friendly. I am a teacher and my husband is a garden designer.

name: Home in Knowle · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview: The area is quiet and family friendly. So many green spaces within easy walking distance... Redcatch Park with children's playground and community garden, Perretts Park with stunning views over the city, Arnos Vale cemetery for wonderful woodland walks and Callington Road Nature Reserve. We live in a small, quiet cul de sac with established families all around us who are very welcoming and friendly and will keep an eye on your vehicle. There is a Tesco Express, Iceland and Co-Op within walking distance, as well as a Poundland, Greggs, Parsons Bakery, Superdrug, Select, a few charity shops, cafes, takeaways and if you drive then there's a Tesco extra within 5 mins drive of our home. We live very central to Bristol, so it is easy to explore the area but equally as easy to get out into the countryside and visit places such as Stanton Drew stone circle, Pensford Viaduct, Wells, Glastonbury, Bath, etc.
host_about: I live with my husband and our three young boys. We absolutely love making new friends and are passionate about our city so have lots of places to recommend on your travels. If we are free and you're game, we will even show you some local gems ourselves or give you a free lift wherever you'd like to go! We love exploring in nature, all kinds of vehicles, animals, and I work in the heritage sector.

The views from the house towards Purdown are really something special and you can watch the sun set and forget that you are just 2 miles from the thriving centre of Bristol. We are a stone’s throw from the gorgeous Bristol to Bath cycle path- Bristol is a short 15-minute cycle, but there are also regular buses (48 and 49) into the city centre from the nearby bus stop. There is free parking on our road and of course you can get around Bristol by car but remember there is now a clean air zone in the centre.

Home in Brislington · ★4.78 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Brislington is a charming suburb located in the southeastern part of Bristol, England. Known for its rich history and picturesque surroundings, Brislington offers a delightful mix of residential areas, green spaces, and local amenities.

One of the notable features of Brislington is its abundance of greenery and open spaces. The area is home to several parks and recreational areas, such as Arnos Vale Cemetery, which offers serene walking paths amidst beautiful Victorian architecture and well-maintained gardens. The sprawling Netham Park is also a popular spot for outdoor activities, with expansive fields, playgrounds, and a tranquil riverside setting.

Broadmead is a vibrant and bustling neighbourhood located in the heart of Bristol city centre. Known for its excellent shopping opportunities, cultural attractions, and lively atmosphere, Broadmead offers a range of experiences for locals and visitors alike. Here's a guide to help you navigate and explore this dynamic area:

Shopping: Broadmead is a shopper's paradise, featuring a variety of high street stores, independent boutiques, and shopping centers. Explore Cabot Circus, a modern shopping complex that houses a wide range of shops, restaurants, and entertainment options. From fashion to homeware, you'll find everything you need for a memorable shopping experience.

Bristol Galleries: Visit the Bristol Galleries, located in Broadmead, to experience the city's vibrant art scene. name: Home in Bristol City · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Although we have neighbours close by, our street is very quiet with little traffic, and the area is peaceful and friendly.

Westbury Park is a fantastic location from which to explore the Bristol and the surrounding area. We are just five minutes walk from Durdham Downs, 400 acres of open green space perfect for walks, sports and picnics. A few minutes further on is Whiteladies Road, with a huge choice of shops and restaurants. A two minute walk in the other direction brings you to Waitrose, our nearest pub and a local cinema. Bus links into the centre of Bristol, for visits to the Docks, museums and Cabot Circus shopping centre, are also a short walk away.

name: Home in Saint Paul's · ★4.86 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
St Pauls is situated in the heart of central Bristol. The neighbourhood holds important historical and cultural significance which locals and visitors alike celebrate each year during St Pauls carnival.

It's an excellent base to explore central Bristol by foot and has easy access to the rest of what the city has to offer via easy public transport links; making it a great option for those coming to the city for work.

Visit Co host Maizees "Bristol Guidebook" for some of the local hot spots to visit and hidden gems of the city.

name: Rental unit in Saint Andrew's · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is a few minutes away from Gloucester Road, which is an amazing high street - everything from brilliant cafes, to bakeries, gift shops, toy stores, green grocers, vintage shops, charity shops where many a bargain can be found. In the other direction, you will find Stokes Croft, and then a little further along you'll be in the City Centre of Bristol with a huge range of shops to choose from.
A very short walk from St Andrew's park, with a fantastic playground, little cafe truck and a splash pool in the summer.
The Harbourside is also really worth a visit, with museums, boat rides and the SS Great Britain to visit. For more recommendations don't hesitate to ask.

name: Townhouse in Montpelier · ★4.87 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
This beautiful townhouse is tucked away on a quiet street in Montpelier, one of Bristol’s most-loved neighbourhoods. Known for its bohemian vibe, Montpelier feels like a village more than a city suburb. Find vibrant local pubs, incredible restaurants, artisan delis and cafes all a short walk away. Plus, you’re in the prime spot to enjoy all that this vibrant city has to offer, and best yet it’s all reachable by foot!

Stroll alongside the harbour, hopping in and out of art galleries, coffee shops and the renowned M Shed Museum. Or enjoy a bite to eat in the unique Wapping Wharf - this cultural quarter boasts eateries and independent shops all housed in refurbished shipping containers. In summer, there’s nothing better than sitting on the water’s edge and soaking up the lively vibe of this vibrant city.

With so many different neighbourhoods to explore, you can spend days exploring Bristol’s city centre. Wander through Stokes Croft to see colourful graffiti by Brist
host_about:
We love welcoming new guests to stay with us. As keen travellers ourselves, we always take note of the things we love about our trips and try to bring those elements to our own spaces. Whether that's through little touches in the house or always being available should you need help or local advice.

After using Airbnb as a guest and host for many years, we decided to put our experience to good use and founded Guesthoo - Cornwall & Devon's first Airbnb management company. Now managing properties all over Cornwall, Devon & the South West, we are wholly committed to ensuring our guests have the best experience possible when staying with us. name: Home in Pill · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 0 baths
neighborhood_overview: Pill is a village in North Somerset, England, situated on the southern bank of the River Avon. The village offers a small selection of pubs, restaurants and shops for fine food and local produce. Visit a number of historic homes with stunning country gardens in the immediate area, or take long walks or cycle along the riverbank. Situated just under 7 miles from the magnificent city of Bristol, which boasts a variety of historical sites, such as the Clifton Suspension Bridge, Brunel's SS Great Britain museum and the Bristol Museum and Art Gallery. Discover a wide-range of attractions within easy reach, including the thriving city of Bath, just under an hour's drive away.

name: Condo in Bedminster · ★4.83 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The flat is at the heart of North Street, opposite the world famous Tobacco Factory Theatre and popular Sunday food market - and amongst Bristol's most popular cafes, restaurants, galleries and independent shops. It is also right at the epicentre of the Upfest Street Art Festival with large scale artwork to be found on buildings and walls in all directions around the property.

It is just a few yards to the Comedy Box comedy club, or the very first of what is now 200+ award winning Lounge cafe bars in the UK. It is also minutes away from Ashton Gate Stadium, the biggest sports and concert venue in the South West, and just a short walk from the popular Ashton Court estate, a very large country park which hosts the annual Bristol Balloon Fiesta.
host_location: London Borough of Lewisham, United Kingdom

name: Home in Brislington · ★4.91 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: The house is easy walking distance to Sandy Park Road and Wells Road, both of which have plenty of amenities including cafes, bars, gyms and local shops, including greengrocers. There are two large supermarkets nearby - Tesco (24 hr) is less than 10-minutes away by foot and Sainsburys is around a 15-minute walk.  There is also a Lidl nearby, about a 15-minute walk away.  There are three green spaces within close walking distance, the nearest being Arnos Court Park / Arnos Vale.  There is a lovely local pub for food and drink within a 5-minute walk, and the house is only a 10-minute walk from a nice bar in an old industrial building which serves really good pizza and beers.
host_about: I work as an environmental consultant in the waste and resources sector - helping local councils to improve their recycling. We've spent a lot of time renovating our house, restoring period features and creating a warm and welcoming home.

name: Home in Montpelier · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Montpelier is one of the most vibrant parts of Bristol to stay in. There is incredible street art at every turn, and countless things to see, do, and listen to within a few steps from the front door, including a lovely array of local shops, eateries, bars and clubs along nearby Stokes Croft and Gloucester Road. It's close to much of the University of Bristol campus, and has several green spaces nearby despite being so close to the centre - my personal favourites being St Andrew's Park and Castle Park. The street can be lively, which can sometimes mean some noise, but for the most part is fairly tranquil. Local events like St Paul's Carnival and Picton Street Christmas Fayre are very nearby. There's a great music scene in Bristol, with something for every taste, and I'd say similar about the food culture!
Feel free to ask if you have questions about any of the above.
host_about:
I'm easy-going and I like to keep it simple. I'm a musician, counsellor and CELTA (English) teacher by trade. I love music, nature, people, food and drink, games/sports/anything playful, and diving deep/connecting with people. 
I'm really passionate about Bristol, especially the food, music and history, and I try to fill my life (and those of people around me I hope!) with as much laughter, connection and creativity as possible.

neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to the vibrant neighbourhood surrounding Bruton House. This prime location offers a perfect blend of history, charm, and excitement, making it an ideal choice for your stay in Bristol. Let us guide you through the highlights of this remarkable neighbourhood:

Clifton Village:
Immerse yourself in the picturesque streets of Clifton Village, just a short stroll away. This historic neighbourhood is known for its Georgian architecture, quaint boutiques, and charming cafes. Explore the local shops, indulge in delicious treats, or simply soak up the village's unique atmosphere.

Clifton Suspension Bridge:
Don't miss the opportunity to visit the iconic Clifton Suspension Bridge, a symbol of Bristol's engineering prowess. Take a leisurely walk across the bridge and marvel at the stunning panoramic views of the Avon Gorge and the cityscape below.

Bristol Zoo Gardens:
Nature enthusiasts will delight in a visit to Bristol Zoo Gardens, locate

name: Condo in Clifton · ★4.91 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Clifton ( literally 'Cliff town' as it is perched on the cliff overlooking the Avon Gorge), is one of the most beautiful and exciting areas of Bristol. The great Georgian terraces (our flat is in one of the oldest ones) and the fine wooded gardens make it one of the pleasantest areas to walk around. Clifton features the famous Birdcage Walk, the pleached lime walkway immortalised in Helen Dunmore's last novel, and the park in Victoria Square has countless different kinds of mature oak.
Clifton also has some of the most stylish shops and restaurants in Bristol. You are also just ten minutes walk from the city centre and the groovy Harbourside. The university is close by, so too are the main art galleries.

name: Rental unit in Southville · ★4.67 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Southville, located in the city of Bristol, is a vibrant and sought-after neighbourhood known for its unique character and strong sense of community. Situated just south of the city centre, Southville offers a blend of residential charm, cultural attractions, and convenient amenities.

The area is renowned for its rows of colourful Victorian terraced houses, which lend a distinctive and picturesque charm to the neighbourhood. Southville is a popular choice for families, professionals, and creatives alike, thanks to its proximity to the city centre and its thriving arts and music scene.

Southville is home to a diverse range of independent shops, boutiques, cafes, and restaurants. North Street, the main thoroughfare, is a bustling hub of activity, offering a wide array of dining options, trendy bars, and local businesses. The community's commitment to supporting local enterprises creates a vibrant and unique shopping and dining experience.

For those seekin

name: Home in Bristol City · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Condo in Clifton · ★4.93 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Clifton is architecturally very beautiful with its Georgian and Regency terraces. Clifton village has a vast range of excellent restaurants and eateries from Michelin starred and The Ivy brasserie to healthy budget options such as Eat a Pitta. The village also offers some lovely independent store shopping, as well as the very useful Tesco Express. There are some beautiful local garden squares locally and it is a short walk to the iconic Clifton suspension bridge and Clifton Down - which is part of the large open space known as the Downs. The suspension bridge leads to Ashton Gate park, which is yet another beautiful green space nearby. Clifton observatory by the bridge is worth a visit, as is the Royal West of England art gallery and historic Wills memorial building. Whiteladies Road restaurants and Clifton Lido with its renowned brasserie and Bristol Everyman cinema are all just 5-10 minutes walk from the flat. There is also a very useful mini Waitrose just three minutes from the flat

name: Home in Bristol City · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
Rental unit in Redland · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Elegant, leafy and filled with chic boutiques, cosy cafes, beautiful buildings and iconic attractions such as the Clifton Suspension Bridge, Clifton is one of Bristol’s most exclusive suburbs and picturesque quarters.

Clifton Village boasts an array of luxury boutiques and is well known for its many coffee shops and pubs. Clifton Down Shopping Centre also offers a good variety of shops, as does Whiteladies Road.

Clifton College, Clifton High, Bristol Grammar and QEH, as well as Christchurch and St John’s are all based close by.

Clifton has a lovely mix of Edwardian, Victorian and Georgian houses as well as popular town house flat conversions throughout.

Main roads – Princess Victoria Street (Clifton Village), Whiteladies Road, Pembroke Road and Queens Road.

Main attractions – Bristol Zoo, Clifton Suspension Bridge, the Observatory and the Downs.

Restaurants – You are spoilt for choice when it comes to fabulous restaurant

name: Home in Knowle · 3 bedrooms · 6 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Totterdown/Knowle is really a fantastic place to be, and a wonderful area to enjoy Bristol from.

Having grown up in the area since I was four, I've seen it blossom over the years and have learned to appreciate what a charming and convenient place it is.

Situated on one of Bristol's hills, it has great views over the city, and is a classic spot to view the famous balloons of the International Ballon Festival.

The area has the rows of vibrant, pastel-coloured houses that line the hilly streets. As you wander through the neighbourhood, take in breathtaking panoramic views of Bristol's cityscape and beyond. Don't miss the chance to enjoy a leisurely walk along the famous "The Paintworks" trail, where you can experience the neighbourhood's unique charm.

Parret and Redcatch park are both close by, and lovely community spots to grab a coffee and stroll. In the summer Perret Park is a particularly good spot to watch the famous Bristol Balloons go b
host_about:
Hi :)

I love travelling, whether it be city breaks or extreme adventures. I get a lot of enjoyment from exploring and understanding different people and cultures, which is one of the reasons I love AirBnB. 

I've lived in London since 2014 and spend my time building businesses to make things better.

I am a professional living in Bristol, in the south west of the UK. I enjoy the outdoors - cycling, gardening and hiking.

I'm a considerate guest and would always treat your home as I would treat my own.  As a host, I hope to make you feel at home and always happy to give tips of things to do to help you enjoy your visit to Bristol!

name: Rental unit in Southmead · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1.5 baths

neighborhood_overview:
Perfectly situated beautiful 2 bedroom house in the heart of Southville. Only a stones throw from some fantastic local amenities on North Street, where you can find a variety of great independent shops, delis, restaurants, cafes, bars and pubs.
Within easy waling distance from all of Bristol’s major attractions.
10 minute walk to the town centre, where you can enjoy Bristols famous vibrant harbourside and selection of more shops, bars and restaurants
20 minute walk to Temple Meads train station
15 min drive from Bristol Airport
20 minute walk to the beautiful open Ashton Court, where you can get away from the city and spot some wild deer.
Free parking on our road

The road is very quiet and peaceful, with a friendly local vibe and a green common area at the bottom where you can enjoy a coffee, picnic or a game of table tennis.

name: Home in Montpelier · ★4.85 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Picton Street is right in the heart of the district, just off Stokes Croft and Cheltenham Road, and within comfortable walking distance of the shopping district, University, Floating Harbour, Downs and everything else that Bristol has to offer. host_about:
Originally from Marlborough and Abergavenny, Tom and Abi recently moved back to the UK after 7 years in South East Asia. 

They chose Bristol as their family base because it is the most vibrant and culturally interesting place in the West of England, and almost exactly halfway between their respective parents. 

Tom and Abi’s work takes them away from Bristol for long periods of the year so the house is available to let for visitors to the city.

name: Rental unit in Bristol · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
Rental unit in Redland · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Elegant, leafy and filled with chic boutiques, cosy cafes, beautiful buildings and iconic attractions such as the Clifton Suspension Bridge, Clifton is one of Bristol’s most exclusive suburbs and picturesque quarters.

Clifton Village boasts an array of luxury boutiques and is well known for its many coffee shops and pubs. Clifton Down Shopping Centre also offers a good variety of shops, as does Whiteladies Road.

Clifton College, Clifton High, Bristol Grammar and QEH, as well as Christchurch and St John’s are all based close by.

Clifton has a lovely mix of Edwardian, Victorian and Georgian houses as well as popular town house flat conversions throughout.

Main roads – Princess Victoria Street (Clifton Village), Whiteladies Road, Pembroke Road and Queens Road.

Main attractions – Bristol Zoo, Clifton Suspension Bridge, the Observatory and the Downs.

Restaurants – You are spoilt for choice when it comes to fabulous restaurant

name: Rental unit in Bishopston · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The flat is located in St Andrews Park neighbourhood just two streets back from Gloucester Road - the longest street of independent shops in Europe! You'll find lots of great restaurants, bars and cafe's here.

We're also right next to St Andrews Park. A little leafy oasis. We'll leave out some ping pong bats and balls if you fancy using the table in the park!

COOP is the nearest grocery shop. It's about 15 second walk. You won't miss it.

There is free street parking on all the streets around the house. And an off-road private parking space for the flat.

name: Home in Bristol City · ★5.0 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Ours is a quiet, residential street in an East Bristol neighbourhood. Fishponds itself offers a number of eateries, both independent and chain. There is also a selection of licenced premises close by, including the Star where you can hear see some great live music most nights. There is a range of popular supermarkets within walking distance of the house as well as plenty of independent stores selling produce from around the world. On St Marks Road in Easton, you can not only access the local train station, but you can also find a number of recommended restaurants and cafes and as well as the infamous Sweet Mart.

name: Home in Speedwell · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Home in Bristol City · 6 bedrooms · 6 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
The property is located right on Gloucester Road, known for its vibrant atmosphere and excellent selection of independent shops and eateries. You'll find a diverse range of cuisines, cafes, and trendy bars within walking distance. Famous sights like Bristol Zoo Gardens, SS Great Britain and Clifton Suspension Bridge are just a short drive away.

Other places to go:
Bristol Harbourside: Once the heart of the city's industry, now a hub of restaurants, shops, and cultural institutions.
SS Great Britain: Step aboard the world's first great ocean liner designed by Isambard Kingdom Brunel.
Clifton Suspension Bridge: An iconic symbol of Bristol, designed by Brunel and offering panoramic views of the Avon Gorge.
Bristol Zoo Gardens: One of the oldest zoos in the world, housing a diverse range of animals.
Bristol Cathedral: A stunning example of Gothic architecture.
M Shed: This museum tells the story of the city's history, from prehistoric times to the p

name: Rental unit in Bedminster · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Shopping, Restaurants and Cafés:
You are spoiled for choice and budgets from the trendy converted shipping containers of Wapping Wharf five minutes walk west along the river side and across the footbridge by Saint Paul's Church to an eclectic mix of cafés and diners just around the corner on Bedminster Parade. For groceries Asda couldn't be any closer but for something truly upmarket there is the fabulous Loaf/Hugo's greengrocer, baker vintner and deli the other side of Bedminster parade. Cross the river, walk north up Redcliffe Hill and in five minutes you reach all that central Bristol has to offer!

name: Home in Southville · ★4.13 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Southville, a trendy and vibrant neighbourhood in Bristol, offers an eclectic blend of contemporary living and historical charm. Known for its artistic flair, Southville boasts colourful street art, independent boutiques, and a thriving cultural scene. Its tree-lined streets and elegant Victorian architecture add to the neighbourhood's character. Explore the vibrant North Street with its array of shops, cafes, and restaurants, or take a leisurely stroll along the scenic harbourside. Southville is a hub for creativity, with the Tobacco Factory Theatre and various art studios showcasing local talent. With easy access to Bristol Temple Meads station and a variety of supermarkets and dining options, Southville is the perfect blend of urban convenience and artistic soul.

This picturesque neighbourhood offers an ideal balance of green spaces, shopping delights along Whiteladies Road and Clifton Village, and a diverse dining scene. Nature enthusiasts can revel in The Downs, Ashton Court, and Leigh Woods, while history and art lovers can explore the Clifton Suspension Bridge, Bristol Museum, and captivating Banksy street art. With its proximity to Bristol University and excellent transport options, Clifton Down welcomes residents and visitors alike to experience its unique blend of history, culture, and modern living.

neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Ratcliffe Court, neighbourhood located in the heart of Bristol. Known for its modern developments, Ratcliffe Court offers modern residential apartments and excellent connectivity.

Bristol Temple Meads:
It serves as a gateway to Bristol and the Southwest, providing excellent transportation links for residents and visitors alike.

Historic Redcliffe Caves:
Redcliffe Caves are a series of man made tunnels beneath the Redcliffe area of Bristol, England. The Triassic red sandstone was dug into in the Middle ages to provide sand for glass making and pottery production.

Harbourside and Floating Harbour:
One of the marvels of Bristol’s prestigious engineering history, Bristol's Floating Harbour has a long and interesting history. Enjoy the picturesque harbour side views as you walk along the Floating Harbour. With cafes, bars, and cultural venues, making it a popular destination for locals and tourists.

name: Home in Clifton · ★New · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Bristol, a vibrant city in southwest England, offers a diverse range of neighborhoods, each with its own unique character. Clifton, with its elegant Georgian architecture, is known for its leafy streets, boutique shops, and the iconic Clifton Suspension Bridge, making it a favorite among professionals and students. The Harbourside is a bustling waterfront area where you can find contemporary apartments, cultural attractions like the M Shed museum, and an array of dining options. Southville, on the south side of the river, is a trendy and artistic neighborhood, while St. Werburghs offers a more bohemian vibe with its community gardens and eclectic community. Overall, Bristol's neighborhoods cater to a wide spectrum of tastes and lifestyles, making it a city full of options for residents and visitors alike.

neighborhood_overview:
The house is nestled on a hillside in the vibrant neighbourhood of Clifton Wood, renowned for its picturesque colourful streets, leafy parks, and friendly locals. It's just a short walk away from a variety of boutique shops, proper pubs, gourmet restaurants and Brunel’s famous Clifton Suspension bridge, providing an authentic Bristol experience.

With an truly special panoramic view of Bristol and its floating harbour, this home offers a unique blend of city living and historical fascination right from your window.
The stunning views of the SS Great Britain, the world's first great ocean liner, provide a captivating backdrop for your stay.

With the SS Great Britain on your doorstep, you'll have the unique opportunity to explore this historic ship and surrounding maritime museum and Bristol's other famous landmarks.

Book your stay now and soak in the rich history, vibrant culture, and undeniable charm that our Clifton Wood home has to offer. We look

name: Rental unit in Bristol City · ★4.60 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Bristol's city center encapsulates a vibrant and diverse urban landscape, teeming with a rich tapestry of culture and history. Its bustling streets are adorned with a harmonious blend of contemporary architecture and historical landmarks, including the iconic Bristol Cathedral and the majestic harborside, reflecting the city's maritime heritage. The area thrives as a cultural hub, boasting an eclectic array of galleries, theaters, and museums, such as the Watershed and the Bristol Museum & Art Gallery, offering an immersive experience into arts and history. Lined with a myriad of shops, restaurants, and entertainment venues, the city center pulsates with energy, inviting locals and visitors to savor its dynamic atmosphere and explore its diverse and lively community.

name: Home in Bristol City · ★New · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
This house offers the best of both worlds: easy access to the city centre with its world-class museums, restaurants and nightlife, and the chance to enjoy the open green spaces and hip cafes of East Bristol on your doorstep.

The house is situated on a leafy road in the Eastville/Fishponds neighbourhoods. Eastville is a residential, mostly Victorian neighbourhood, home to the very large Eastville park with its lake, recently renovated playpark and Kind Regards coffee van (Fri-Sun). The Frome Valley Way is a 5-min walk from the house and offers a quiet riverside walk or bike ride with frequent sightings of herons and kingfishers. From here you can walk to the historic Snuff Mills, and on to Oldbury Court with its large playpark.

Fishponds has excellent pubs, cafes (FED, Crafty Egg, the Star and newly renovated All In), and supermarkets (Morrisons, Lidl, Sainsburies). Another neighbourhood, Easton, is around 15 minutes walk or shorter bike ride from the house, offeri

Home in Bristol City · ★New · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
With a rich history spanning centuries, Bristol’s modern day Old Market/Barton Vale district has a unique character built from its vibrant residents and businesses alike. You will discover an eclectic blend of vintage stores and independent shops mixed with cool cafés, bars and restaurants as well as art and music venues. On its doorstep, the bustling bars, cafés, theatres and shops of the city centre are all within easy reach and the renowned Cabot Circus shopping centre is just a short walk away.

Bristol is renowned for its rich heritage and vibrant culture. Birthplace of ‘Banksy’ and home to Brunel’s Clifton Suspension Bridge, Bristol plays host to the Bristol Harbour Festival and Bristol International Balloon Fiesta annually, bringing excitement and colour to this already thriving modern city.

name: Rental unit in Bristol City · ★New · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
host_about:
Nous sommes une famille anglo-irlandaise qui ont vécu à La Rochelle depuis 2003. Nous gérons l'hébergement de vacances à La Rochelle, une superbe ville pour les touristes et ceux qui cherchent à s'éloigner de l'agitation de la vie. Aujourd'hui nous passons plusieurs mois chaque année à Londres ou nous gérons aussi un appartement dans un emplacement idéal 20 minutes par métro du centre-ville et loué pour les locations à courte durée. En outre, nous sommes des musiciens et nous chantons, écrivons et jouons ensemble dans un groupe de folk moderne, The Portraits.

We are an Anglo-Irish family who have been living in La Rochelle since 2003. We manage holiday accommodation here, in a super town for tourists and those seeking to get away from the bustle of life. We also spend several months each year in London where we manage another apartment which we rent short term. In addition, we are musicians and we sing, write and play together in a band called The Portraits.

Hello we are Hopewell and welcome to our profile. We are dedicated to making sure you enjoy your stay in one of our many homes, be that in the city centre, Clifton or beyond.
We are here to help you enjoy your time with us and get the best out of what Bristol has to offer.

We look forward to having you to stay!

name: Condo in Clifton · ★New · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is a couple of doors away from the award winning Avon Gorge hotel, the hotel has views of the Avon gorge river and open to the public, you can enjoy the hotels restaurant and white Lion pub with it's outstanding terrace, famous for having the best views of the Clifton suspension bridge and popular for sunset drinks,

You are steps away from all the best bars and restaurants in Bristol including the IVY, Coets, the Giggling squid, Coopa, Kibu, New Moon etc,

You are a 5 min walk to the Co-op and Tesco supermarket, and a 15/20 min walk to the harbour and city center,

You can enjoy walks up to the observatory only 5mins away with breathtaking views of Bristol and Somerset, the observatory has tours to visit the caves and you can enjoy it's popular cafe open to the public with beautiful view looking over the top of the suspension bridge and the Avon Gorge

You can enjoy the green on the tree lined street the apartment is situa

Hiya!
This is my 2nd time being a host on Airbnb and I really enjoy it. I love meeting new people and offering them a friendly, comfy place to stay. I have a lovely little box room in a lovely, clean and modern house close to the bustling Gloucester Road.

name: Home in Totterdown · ★New · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Totterdown/Knowle is really a fantastic place to be, and a wonderful area to enjoy Bristol from.

Having grown up in the area since I was four, I've seen it blossom over the years and have learned to appreciate what a charming and convenient place it is.

Situated on one of Bristol's hills, it has great views over the city, and is a classic spot to view the famous balloons of the International Ballon Festival.

The area has the rows of vibrant, pastel-coloured houses that line the hilly streets. As you wander through the neighbourhood, take in breathtaking panoramic views of Bristol's cityscape and beyond. Don't miss the chance to enjoy a leisurely walk along the famous "The Paintworks" trail, where you can experience the neighbourhood's unique charm.

Parret and Redcatch park are both close by, and lovely community spots to grab a coffee and stroll. In the summer Perret Park is a particularly good spot to watch the famous Bristol Balloons go b
host_about:
Hi :)

I love travelling, whether it be city breaks or extreme adventures. I get a lot of enjoyment from exploring and understanding different people and cultures, which is one of the reasons I love AirBnB. 

I've lived in London since 2014 and spend my time building businesses to make things better.

name: Rental unit in Bristol City · ★New · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
With a rich history spanning centuries, Bristol’s modern day Old Market/Barton Vale district has a unique character built from its vibrant residents and businesses alike. You will discover an eclectic blend of vintage stores and independent shops mixed with cool cafés, bars and restaurants as well as art and music venues. On its doorstep, the bustling bars, cafés, theatres and shops of the city centre are all within easy reach and the renowned Cabot Circus shopping centre is just a short walk away.

Bristol is renowned for its rich heritage and vibrant culture. Birthplace of ‘Banksy’ and home to Brunel’s Clifton Suspension Bridge, Bristol plays host to the Bristol Harbour Festival and Bristol International Balloon Fiesta annually, bringing excitement and colour to this already thriving modern city.

Local recommendations:

-The Barley Mow pub is ran by Bristol Beer Factory and has 8 cask and 10 keg lines showcasing the best beer as well as a food menu incl

name: Rental unit in Southville · ★New · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Explore the critically-acclaimed food scene in Southville, from local favourites like Souk Kitchen and Sonny Stores, to Michelin-recommended restaurants like COR. Visiting on a Sunday? Step out of the apartment straight into the weekly Tobacco Factory Market.

In case you fancy a drink, there's an artisan wine bar, independent brewery and collection of cosy pubs on your doorstep.

Within a 5-minute walk, you'll find the harbourside with the city's most iconic view of colourful houses, the historic SS Great Britain, or keep walking along the water to explore Wapping Wharf shipping containers.
host_about: Regular guest and host on Air bnb. I have lived in Bristol for 7 years now and still firmly believe it's the best city in the UK! Always happy to give food recommendations from my tried and tested list of favourites.

neighborhood_overview:
A great stay for those attending any events on the Harbourside. Ideally located for the annual Harbour festival!

Also located within 5 minutes of the The Downs, the historic Clifton Suspension Bridge and the SS Great Britain. If you’re looking for something a little further afield, the Bristol Zoo project is a 20 minute drive away. For those who fancy something a more sporty, also within 20 minutes of the apartment is the Filton Driving Range & Adventure Golf Course and The Wave; an inland surfing destination.

The Mall at Cribbs Causeway is a large indoor shopping centre, along with a leisure complex with multi-screen Vue cinema, ten-pin bowling and a large number of restaurants for you to enjoy & it is only a 20 minute drive away from the apartment.

Or why not enjoy a live show at the Bristol Hippodrome or the Bristol Old Vic where you can enjoy a show of your choice after a fabulous local pre-show dinner.

name: Rental unit in Saint Paul's · ★New · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Nestled in the vibrant city of Bristol, Kingsdown is a characterful neighborhood that effortlessly combines historic charm with contemporary flair. Known for its picturesque streets lined with colorful Georgian townhouses and leafy squares, Kingsdown exudes a welcoming atmosphere. The neighborhood is a hub for creativity, featuring a mix of independent shops, art galleries, and trendy cafes. With its close proximity to the University of Bristol and the city center, Kingsdown attracts a diverse community of residents and students. Residents enjoy the convenience of local amenities, including eclectic dining options, while the verdant St. Michael's Park offers a tranquil escape in the heart of the city. Kingsdown's unique blend of culture, history, and modernity makes it a vibrant and sought-after area in Bristol.

Home in Montpelier · ★New · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview:
This townhouse is tucked away on a quiet street in Montpelier, one of Bristol’s most-loved neighbourhoods. Known for its bohemian vibe, Montpelier feels like a village more than a city suburb. Find vibrant local pubs, incredible restaurants, artisan delis and cafes all a short walk away. Plus, you’re in the prime spot to enjoy all that this vibrant city has to offer, and best yet it’s all reachable by foot!

Stroll alongside the harbour, hopping in and out of art galleries, coffee shops and the renowned M Shed Museum. Or enjoy a bite to eat in the unique Wapping Wharf - this cultural quarter boasts eateries and independent shops all housed in refurbished shipping containers. In summer, there’s nothing better than sitting on the water’s edge and soaking up the lively vibe of this vibrant city.

With so many different neighbourhoods to explore, you can spend days exploring Bristol’s city centre. Wander through Stokes Croft to see colourful graffiti by Bristol-born Ba
host_about:
We love welcoming new guests to stay with us. As keen travellers ourselves, we always take note of the things we love about our trips and try to bring those elements to our own spaces. Whether that's through little touches in the house or always being available should you need help or local advice.

After using Airbnb as a guest and host for many years, we decided to put our experience to good use and founded Guesthoo - Cornwall & Devon's first Airbnb management company. Now managing properties all over Cornwall, Devon & the South West, we are wholly committed to ensuring our guests have the best experience possible when staying with us. Search 'Guesthoo' online for more information.

name: Rental unit in Brislington · ★New · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Our flat is nestled in a delightful neighbourhood that strikes a perfect balance between serene residential comfort and convenient access to local attractions and amenities.

Local Shops and Supermarkets: Just a 10-minute walk away, you'll find The Gilmore and a Premier on Birchwood Road for your daily essentials. For a more comprehensive shopping experience, the Co-op at Wyatt's View is a mere 5-minute stroll from the flat.

Transport Links: The locality is well-served by public transport, with the closest bus stop on Wootton Road just 3 minutes away on foot. The 36 bus takes you to the city centre in about 30 minutes, making it easy to explore the wider area.

Green Spaces: Nature lovers will appreciate the proximity to local green spaces like St Anne's Woods, Nightingale Valley, and Eastwood Farm, offering picturesque settings for walks and relaxation.
